text: BEST happy hour in Vegas!! $3 for a pint of blue moon (and they have a selection of beer) $5 martini (totally delicious) and their appetizers like Jamaican jerk chicken, empanadas and burger sliders are around $5 as well.  A definite must-try if you've never been!
Absolutely great food and awesome bar tenders. I'm here for a couple weeks for work and they have been great. Thank you!!

Had a party of 30 on 6/27 and they were able to accommodate us as a normal reservation. Drinks and food were great! I had a bahama mama drink and was so tasty. Ordered the calypso pasta with shrimp and it was the best tasting shrimp pasta I've ever had even my 3 year old chowed it down. Thank you for your great hospitality and service.

We went to Bahama Breeze to celebrate my Son and Daughter both completing their college degrees. The food was great,  as we're the cocktails,  but the highlight of the night was our server,  Tamikah.  She made our special event even more special.  One of our party has dietary restrictions,  and Tamikah worked with the manager to make sure her dinner was perfect,  and it was.  We were a large party (9) people,  and each one of us we're completely happy with our meal and the evening.  We are now fans of Bahama Breeze and of Tamikah!

Dennis was an exceptional waiter. 
Coconut Shrimp (6) for an appetizer was a great recommendation. Ordered dessert too and went with the warm upside down pineapple cake, so make sure you leave room for it!

This is a popular place,here for fish tacos, they were very good 
Been here several times and would come here again,they have patio seating if you prefer  to eat outside.

Usually we are pleased with Bahama Breeze. ..However we made reservations a week and a half ahead of time for a going away party and when we show up  early for our time slot and are still standing waiting 40 minutes passed the time the only response we got from an employee when we asked what the hold up is was..."Obviously we get a lot of reservations here! " very disappointing!
I was there yesterday for mothers birthday had such a great time minus some waiting but we caught happy hour was amazing Steven was awesome thanks for your services!!,

My wife and I went for lunch on a gift card we got for Christmas.  Probably one of the best chain restaurants in have ate at. Our waitress [Ashley] was extremely nice and helpful. She was busy but prompt with our table and several others around us. My wife ordered a mixed drink and it was delicious, the food was great and portioned well for the cost. We will be visiting here again.
We went there for my brother's birthday. Our waitress was great. The food is a bit pricey. The dessert was amazing. Overall, it was a good experience.

Poorly managed. Unnecessarily long waits despite multiple open tables. Servers lack customer service. Orders a steak medium rare and the serves it ice-cold-rare. After sending back to kitchen they re-served the piece seemingly in the same condition. The waiter then had manager come address issue 15minutes later after my family was more than 1/2 way done their meal. Committed to getting a different dish to the table in "3 minutes"... 12minutes later no one brought a dish or offered check. Bad night maybe... Incredibly bad service for sure. Proceed with caution!
They use special rum that's only available here. More authentic. Can't go wrong with any tropical drinks. You can taste the alcohol from a frozen drink.  Love the drinks here

The food was average at best.  The service was below average.  We went for a birthday celebration and ordered some appetizers.  The Edamame arrived covered by a bowl but the bowl was dirty.  The Warm Spinach Dip was pretty tasteless.  The steak Frites and Jerk Chicken Pasta were decent but the Fish Tacos were a mess and not very tasty.  The drinks were overpoured and not very well made.  The service bar was extremely slow and it took quite a while to even get our drinks.  Finally, we had made a reservation several days prior to the dinner and the hostess acted like she was doing us a favor by seating us.  Not the best experience.

awesome spot for carribean atmosphere dining and drinks, good selection and great food, been coming here for years, always happy, favorite dish= Caribbean jerk chicken with plantains, yellow rice& black beans

This place was pretty flipping fantabulous!!! Sam was our server and was hands down the best. We started with drinks, Coquitos mind blowing creamy goodness.  Our first time and we will definitely be back. I had the steak oscar which was cooked to perfection. My arm candy had the Jamaican Jerk chicken YUM! Such delicious food for an outstanding price here in Vegas and we have been to quite a few!!!! Highly recommend!!

We had a party of twelve people for lunch so may have overwhelmed the staff  but service was slow.  Had the Applewood Bacon  burger.  It was OK (pretty hard to mess up a burger)  Family member ordered the cuban sandwich.  He did not like it.  Probably  because it wasn't  really  a cuban.  They don't come with salami,  lettuce, tomato and your supposed  to use cuban pork which this did not taste like.  ( I live near Miami so know Cuban food )  Overall, it was OK, nice atmosphere with so-so food.  Reasonable prices.

Maybe we got the wrong dishes. I got the chipotle beef rice bowl and my girlfriend got the fish tacos. The rice bowl was horrible. It was cheesy rice with beef smothered in barbecue sauce. I didn't eat very much of it. The fish tacos were OK. The sorbet served with the fruit salad tasted very good. We also got onion rings as an appetizer. Those were good as well. This might be a good happy hour place but I don't think I would suggest any one to come here for a normal dining experience. Service was OK.

You must visit this place when visiting Las Vegas. They have the best onion rings and portobello burgers. This place has a reputation of quality over quantity and the price for their meals are not too bad. 
If you want good food off the strip, you must check this place out!

We decided to try this place after reading the Yelp reviews. This place is really fantastic! We had an excellent waiter - Marcus.  He helped us with all our questions,  suggested we come back for happy hour. .and was extremely attentive. We had the ahi tuna and jamaican chicken wings - both were delicious..the wings are FULL wings too - all 3 sections. I had the salmon and fresh greens tostadas and my husband had the salmon.  Both were so good..nobody was talking during the meal. .we were so absorbed in our meals! And lastly - THE MUSIC...Live music..music by Bob Marley, Jimmy Buffet and an easy, grooving island feel to the entire restaurant - which can easily accommodate large groups.  A new LV favorite for us! We will definitely be back for happy hour!!

Celebrating the wife's birthday we decided to come to Bahamas breeze. Some of our group had been here before so we were expecting a great experience. For the most part our server did her job well, but we received some drinks that were watered down. The food took a while to get to us but it was busy so that is understandable. What killed the night is my buddy pulling a 12 inch blonde hair out of his mouth while chewing his jerk pasta. Everyone's apatite was ruined after that.

ok so after 2 years of searching I finally found Jerk Chicken, I ordered the Jerk chicken wings and Jerk Chicken Pasta and as I was smashing I forked up a long ass blonde hair atleast 12 inches long didn't notice it until it was in my mouth, talking about gross that meeker up the entire meal for 6. We were out celebrating my sisters bday and no one felt comfortable eating their food. I also ordered a long island drink and it was weak. I'll never return 2 this joint again.  Oh an the waitress said this happened to someone else 2 night with the same dish. Dig that.

Visitor in the Pittsburgh area. Dinner was tremendous and our server did an excellent job.
We were fortunate to get outside seating so we were able to enjoy the live music.

Terrible service,  we were told there was a 15 minute wait and then after 30 minutes when I checked back we were sat immediately and everyone else that walked in was sat immediately. No explanation was given. It was poorly run with the waitstaff clearly confused and frantic. Won't be coming back

Loved my food and my drinks.  Yolanda was my waitress and she was nice.  I loved their margarita sampler.  It was more than I expected it to be.  Chicken empandas, the house salad and the chicken bowl were awesome. I wish there was a location in Southern California.
Allways great service and great food absolutely no complaints very inexpensive well worth it!

This was my first time in this restaurant. I went on Sunday and it was pretty calm , not too many people inside. I had drinks, an appetizer, entree, and desert. 

Drinks:
Frozen Bahamarita - delicious
Ultimate Pina Colada - just OK. I wish it was in a bigger class

For an appetizer I had the Adobo Chicken Taco. It was good. I liked how it had a little crunchiness to it. It was a little cold though

My entree was the Island Hopper and included onion rings, conch fritters, coconut shrimp, and Jamaican jerk wings.

I ate half an onion ring, nothing special about those since I cannot stand the taste of onions. The conch fritters should really be called conch balls. I love fried conch from this local place in Miami so that was the main reason why I decided to go with this meal, I was disappointed. They were not horrible but could have been seasoned more and they barely had any conch in them. The coconut shrimp was standard though most of the seasoning was on the outside and not the shrimp itself. Being Jamaican I always go for things that are jerked. These wings were not jerked at all. No spice or kick to them. The sauces that came with the food were soooo good!!!

For desert I had the Banana Nut Bread Supreme. It was delicious. The only negative was the stale, warm, soggy banana slice.


I will definitely be returning
My family and I love this place!  We have always had wonderful meals and the atmosphere is so inviting!  We especially love the coconut shrimp, rice and green beans - yum!

Thank you Bahama Breeze for helping make our Wedding dinner better than what we excepted!! They went above and beyond to help make our wedding night the most memorable night of our lives. Great food. Great drinks. Great accommodations. Friendly staff. 


Ps. They even moved tables so we could have our first dance and father-daughter dance. So nice of them. Yes, I did cry at my reception.
One of the BEST restaurants in Vegas! This West Indies Curry Chicken is delicious and reasonably priced. Umbrella drinks make you escape from reality. 4 stars for sure!

I love the Beautiful Decor!!...The inside of this beautiful restaurant looks like you are actually in an establishment, on a Bahama Island...The Bar is gorgeous, as well. And they offer great Happy Hour portions and prices! I loved their Fish Tacos, seasoned rice, and Jerk Wings. 

I was surprised that they didn't offer more crab and lobster dishes, since  a variety of seafood dishes are popular in the Bahamas. I have only been here once, but I will definitely come back! The staff was very friendly, attentive, and professional.

We love this place. We go each time we are in Vegas. They have our favorite ribs. It's a full rack for $20 including fries. Note: the ribs are coated with a guava-based BBQ sauce, so don't expect the typical smoky southern barbecue. They have a full bar with a complete catalog of mixed drinks, although the drinks are pricey. Located on Flamingo road just east of the strip, but not walking distance. Lots of other Caribbean inspired dishes, but we have never tried any other items because the ribs are too good to pass up.

Tim is an awesome server who deserves corporate recognition the general manager is also super helpful she had put together a catering order for me that was absolutely delicious and on point as well as economical.
The ultimate compliment was many guests felt that thought that it was a home cook meal.

My family LOVES this place, so imagine our surprise when we took company & discovered they got rid of the banana cream pie. What the hell were you thinking? NOTHING on your dessert menu compares. Ugh!

I just  moved here and my sister came to visit me.  I wasn't familiar with the restaurants  yet, but we found this place on the Internet.  We went on a Sonday evening after making 'call ahead seating' reservations.  When we arrived, we were seated right away.  The service was immediate and friendly.  The menu has a good selection and a huge drink menu.  The atmosphere was  very  authentic  and casual.  Easy to find and  their own parking lot right off the street.  My sister had a fabulous tropical drink, suggested by our waiter, that she not only loved but only cost $6.00.  We both had seafood which was fabulous.  When the bill arrived, we were pleasantly surprised how reasonable it was for all we got.  We will definitely be going back again and I will recommend this place to everyone!

I've been twice and each time I was pleased with my experience. The staff was efficient friendly. The food impeccable and the management obviously trusts its employees as they should. All in all a great place to eat. First time we went just my family of five, next time was a party of 11. Either 2, 5, or 15 their staff was on top of their game. Kudos

From the moment I walked in and was greeted by Tiffany I knew this would be one of those "memorable moments"! Tiffany was awesome! Very professional and willing to address all my questions considering this was my first time. Once my guest and I were seated at the table our waitress Anita blew me away with her PHENOMENAL customer service! She was so knowledgeable about the drink menu, the appetizers, and the background of the different foods that I literally felt as if I were in the Bahamas and completely forgot I was in Las Vegas. After ordering our drinks and food came out quickly and everything was DELICIOUS! What truly made my experience amazing was Anita! She was fun, personable, and really demonstrated the epitome of what I consider a phenomenal customer service experience! Because of her service this will now be my go-to drinks & appetizers choice when scheduling my weekly hangouts with friends and coworkers. And yes, I will be requesting Anita every time! I was so impressed with Anita's service that I literally chased the manager Sean down just to rave about Anita. To my surprise, considering he was busy, my interrupting him didn't phase him one bit. He was very professional and equally as enthusiastic about Anita as I was! He genuinely thanked my guest and I for visiting and guess what else....genuinely invited us to come back and visit again! I can't say enough great things about this place!!!!! Thanks Tiffany, Anita, and Sean.
We love Bahama Breeze so much we invited over 40 of our family and friends  to join us for our wedding rehearsal dinner! Natalie's staff is amazing. Great food, wonderful staff and fun atmosphere.
Always consistent and always good. Not to mention a very nice host and good service as well.

Almost perfect. The service was super slow. I still tipped 10%. I was at the bar. So no excuse there. The food tasted  excellent and alcohol are awesome. Price is neck breaker on regular days!!! Go at happy hour!!!

Worst experience I have ever had.  We went for lunch on my birthday with my three kids and husband.  We waited 43 minutes (YES-43 minutes) for our drinks!  Our appetizer came and went and we didn't even have waters.  While our waitress was apologetic and I don't blame her, I should not have had to ask for waters when she came and told us three times that the bar was backed up.  We finally asked for the manager - which explains why the restaurant is run so horribly.  We explained the wait for drinks and all he had to say was "I know, it's crazy".  I will never, ever go back here.  We had our wedding shower here 10 years ago and it was great back then but so terrible now that we'll never go back.  (I would give it zero stars but that's not an option).

The hardest thing is deciding where to start, especially considering I never write reviews.  We had never been to Bahama Breeze before and with trying any new place there is always that slight worry. We walked up to a restaurant that looks as if it was flown in from the Caribbean up to the hostess' stand and were warmly greeted. We were shown our way to the table and were given their menu which has an extensive selection, especially the house cocktails. We were delightlfully greeted by our server Sandra and we informed her it was our first time and we would need a moment to take in the vast menu. She was truly polite and gave us some suggestions and brought us our water while we mulled everything over, that's when our excitement started going up as we looked at the specialty drinks. 

I'm not a drinker and the fact that these drinks caught my eye is a good sign. We started off by ordering a truly delicious Bahama Margharita (an infusion of pineapple, strawberry and kiwi with tequila) and my girlfriend a Strawberry Banana Daquiri. Both drinks made to perfection. We started our appatizers in a simple manner with wonderfully crisp coconut shrimp as well as chips and salsa, both which were brought to us very quickly, while we continued to look at the menu. All the while Sandra keeping an eye on us and ensuring our satisfaction. Finally we decided to settle on the Baby Back Ribs for myself an the Filet Mignon for her. 

The meal was astounding. The ribs were falling off the bone and well sauced, and the mashed potatoes I requested with them were delicously creamy and flavorful. My girlfriends filet was cooked to perfection and her sides were enjoyed with gusto. We ordered another round of drinks (keep in mind drinks aren't my thing so they must be good for me to order another) but we decided to try something different. My girlfriend tried The Blue (something, I don't recall the rest of the name sadly) and I enjoyed the Berry Berry Good. Both of us would share drinks to try more of a variety and we fell absolutey in love with the Berry Berry Good, as i quote my girlfriend, "next time I'm getting five of these.'  I'm confident I will as well.

Next we go on to the dessert. When we are as stuffed as were at the end of a meal we don't even consider it, but we figured this place has been so amazing how can we say no? Dulce de Leche Cheesecake and a Chocolate Island (a chocolate cake with chocolate mousse sitting in a delicate sea of a vanilla bean sauce) I didn't want to take it home, i just wanted to eat everything there and get another order to go, it was that incredible. We were so delighted at the end of the meal and asked to see the manager (Jesse is his name) and couldn't begin to describe how happy we were.

All this alone provides something worth noting, but what will truly brings us back beyond anything else is Sandra. We can confidently say that she is without a doubt the greatest server we have ever had. Truly charismatic and professional. When were were looking at our menus in the beggining we saw that she was busy but never once did she let that bother her nor take away from the quality she was providing not just us but everyone. We had great conversations with her and never once did we feel rushed or neglected, it was the exact opposite. She made our night, so much so that on the drive home we were still talking about how amazing she is (plus the quality of the restaurant) We will absolutely make sure that when we go in next we will request her (and if there's a wait we will not mind at all) I cannot stress enough how she truly is the greatest server we have ever had. She is a gem that must never be lost. 

Everything about this place is remarkable. They took two first time diners and in one fantastic experience made us die hard fans.
Happy hour is good here. The place is a hit or miss. My last experience was not that great. The table across from us went un bussed for the hour we were there. Never seen the front end manager.

So a group of 8 went there on Saturday as a get together of retired coworkers. My first time there.!! I had a Bahama Mama cocktail to start along with beef empanadas. They were tasty with the sides and then I had the Pork tenderloin with mashed sweet potatoes and green beans with the fruity Jamican version of salsa. My meal was delicious. I had the coconut cream pie for dessert. Waitress was great for 8 people. We stayed almost 2hrs then were abruptly being asked to leave.
I just love this place for lunch!  I work in the Wells Fargo Tower, which makes it so convenient.  The service is always great, and the food even better.  It's a must-try!

The service was pretty good, and the ambiance was nice, but what I didn't care for was the food itself.  We ordered coconut shrimp as an appetizer, and thought it was very mediocre.  The coconut shrimp at Outback blows these away.  I ordered baby back ribs, and the wife ordered shrimp linguine.  The ribs had a ton of fat, but my wife did like her dish.  Would I go back?  Maybe, but I've had so much better, and I hate spending money on something that doesn't wow me.

I love the ambience of this place! It really has that Caribbean feel to it. I ordered the Buttermilk Fried Chicken which was delicious, followed by the chocolate pineapple upside down cake which was good too. I'll be back!

Nice place, love the tropical ambiance.  Service is usually good. They have huge onion rings and the beef patties (like beef curry in little pastries with mango salsa on the side) are great!  Food always tastes fresh.  Desserts were yummy, too!

I was here mother's day, my mom's first time here. It was filled to max cappacity and about 45 minute wait. At first the hostess told us we could not sit at the bar to wait for our table. Eventually another staff member told us we could help ourselves to full service bar. Our waitress/bartender was Nicole and she was very efficient for being so crowded, she really did a good job and was very friendly. We ordered tortilla soup, Cilantro lime chicken and chipotle beef bowl, and rum cake and banana bread for dessert, we got our food drinks and dessert all in under a half hour. Very impressive service and tasty dishes! The kitchen and bar were really working over time to please all of the customers.My mom was happy with our visit. Nice job staff and management!

I ordered an Island Hopper Combo lunch of shrimp, onion rings and chicken.  The shrimp and onion rings were served and the manager indicated they were having problems in the kitchen and the chicken was still cooking.  The chicken arrived halfway into the meal and looked dry, overcooked and freezer burned. Rather than complain to the manager, I ate the chicken. 
Five hours later I was vomiting and had severe diarrhea into the night. Food poisoning I suspect from the chicken. (Note: Apparently, the Island Hopper Combo has now been removed from the menu at Robinson.)
I have a feeling that the chicken I was served had been improperly stored and rather than tell me they did not have wings, they served it and hoped I would not get sick. Well, I ate it and I got sick!

Came here with a local after needing a change of scene in Vegas.   It was still prop-ish but atleast you did not feel overwhelmed with so many people like in the hotels.  Food was decent, not the greatest just somewhat different and there was live band.  Not really some where I would come to Vegas for.

The food was bland and lukewarm. I got Cajun meal and the only flavor was jalapeño. Even worse, my bf's black bean burger had bacon on it! He's been a vegetarian for five years!! Luckily he noticed and sent it back, which left whole table preoccupied with when the waitress will come back to check on us and bring back the meal. Then the manager came by a very uncomfortable, aggressive and disingenuous apology. They didn't even have the class to take it off the bill! Oh and no complimentary bday desert either. Going there was a huge mistake.

At first the environment was good. They put us in the back of the bus where it was less lively and no one came to serve us till like 10 minutes after we seated. Waitress come up to ask if we were good as she was walking away at the same time." Bi***. No we ain't good no ones serving us or even brought us drinks "   SHe says " oh im sorry what can I get you" apparently she don't know what table she serves. Got the food and the drinks were ok. Environment kinda sucked.  Food was good.  Service sucked. As we were walking out we see our waitress in the damn patio on the damn phone while her tables are waiting. Please fire her a$$.

This place is big and decorated beautifully. The ambiance is very settle with a Caribbean feel. Our waiter was friendly and made sure we were content. I ordered a Calypso Shrimp w. Bahamarita and they were delicious! The food portion was big. It was big enough to go home and eat some more! The prices are very reasonable (very cheap compared to NY prices). I recommend this place and will definitely go back whenever I go back to Vegas!

It has been a few years since we have eaten here and were looking forward to our favorite sandwiches for lunch. First let me say, that service here is hit or miss. Sometimes it is fabulous. Other times, horrible. There is no in between. This was a horrible time - waitress would not shut up, did not accept that we did not want alcoholic drinks or appetizers and tried to push them on us, she pulled a menu one of my party was holding and started flipping through it, insisted on telling us the "specials" despite we knew what we wanted.... anyway - we were looking forward to the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and Portabello Mushroom Sandwich. Both were a disappointment - chicken was like rubber, bread tasted bad (not ciabatta anymore). The portabello sandwich was mashed flat as if someone sat on it and the vegetables were diced small and indistinguishable. More so - for a Saturday lunch it was dead... not the normal for this place. Usually it is busy. Looking out the window we got to watch a drunk/high gentleman purusing the parking lot, and then when we left we were confronted by a man who "wanted to ask us questions" and when we refused he started swearing, dropping the f-bomb and being obnoxious. It was very unsettling to our group - family members from seniors down to children. The place has not been kept up - although when we entered there was a young girl cleaning the windows, the table was dirty, the ledge where the plants are was full of dust, the menus had food on them. No reason for that. 

The area this restaurant is in has certainly changed tremendously and as well, other restaurants in the area seemed to have changed hands/chains as well. If you are on the Strip, I would advise you to stay there and eat. It is not worth the taxi ride over there and I certainly would not advise you to walk down there from your hotel. 

This used to be a popular place for lunch for the UNLV crowd, and possibly during the week things are different. But don't waste your time.

I officially love this place! Came on a Tues night, sat out on the deck to listen to live music by the featured Reggae artist who was performing. My son and I absolutely loved him! Great vibes. Great song choices. Just leggggggit. The food was great and the service was absolutely awesome. Travis was our server, was completely on point the entire night! 
We will definitely be back. :)
Had the most amazing 1st time experience! Amazing food and customer service. Maurice was my server and he has excellent customer service!! Most definitely will be back! Thank you Bahama Breeze

Good food, though a little overpriced.  I usually get the Carribean Jerk Chicken Pasta, which has a fabulous cream sauce, chicken and asparagus.  So good.  I also love the West Indies beef patties and the Ultimate Pina Colada.  I've heard other dishes are just so so.  The service  is usually outstanding.

Awesome customer service. Not sure of his name but her had spikey hair. I wasn't sure about what I wanted and he took the time to explain the menu to my daughter and I . I had the fish tacos ...yummmy and my daughter tried the burger. We left full, happy and satisfied

I took my out of town guests here on a Monday evening for dinner. The service was absolutely terrible! There were only a few people in the place and it took them over 15 minutes to sit us. Then it took them more than 20 minutes to get someone to get outer drink orders. No one even spoke to us during that entire time. People were walking past us, but no one even noticed that five people were sitting at a table in the middle of the room. When some one finally did speak to us, she did not know much about the menu items. It took us three hours (that's right, you read that right) to get out of that place! Never again. They may have been short staffed, but I can't believe they would be that rude and ignore their customers. No excuse for this.
Food was great drinks were great...if you like jerk chicken try the jerk chicken entree...amazing!

I have family that lives near there and we seem to eat at Bahama Breeze every time I am in Vegas.  Pretty good 'island' food and a fun environment for the money, and you will definitely not leave hungry, I have had leftovers each time I ate there.

You HAVE TO get their Cuban Bread for an appetizer, it is pretty simple but my mouth waters just thinking about it.  I have had the paella, coconut shrimp, a chicken pasta dish, and a lobster/shrimp pasta dish and I would order any of them again.  There was something about the chicken pasta dish that I REALLY enjoyed, a tangy garlic cream combo flavor and really tender chicken and mushrooms.

Their red beer is satisfying and for only a couple bucks for a 20oz mug you can definitely throw back a few with no damage to the wallet.  They also have a lot of frozen mixed drinks that looked good but I cant comment on them as I mainly stick to beer when I have a drink. Enjoy!

I love the easy going style and comfort of the decor.   A big menu full of choices but no scallops which I was in the mood for.   My wife and I each choose a different fresh fish which came with rice or mashed potatoes and green beans.  We specifically asked to have our veggies cooked and not served crunchy like so many restaurants serve.   The meal did not come with soup nor salad not even bread.  We asked about bread but was told we could order a loaf for extra charge.  I did added a side lobster tail for an extra $9.99.   When our meal came the green beans were not cooked hardly at all.  They did offer to bring more.  Our mash potatoes were warm but not hot.  The fish was good but not great and they forgot my side lobster tail.  The manager came over and apologized which was nice but did not offer anything other than his apology.  I would have declined a free dessert but that would have been appropriate.
I have eaten here before and it was better but will probably not go back for a while.

This was my first visit to Bahama Breeze and it was great experience.  I ordered the Grilled Chicken and Tropical Fruit on Mixed Greens and it was excellent -  a perfect balance of fresh fruit, greens, and spiced chicken topped with goat cheese! The service was also great. Our waiter was very attentive and it was obvious that he enjoyed his job. I look forward to going back and trying something else from their extensive menu.

As a local, one of my favorite places to go. 2 happy hours and mojitos are amazing. The only reason I didn't give 5 star is the lack of big tv's, sorry but I am a big sports fan. Also I had been a long time costumer, I usually arrive alone to meet my husband later after work and the hostess stuff are far from friendly, is like if you arrive as a woman sitting at the bar does not deserve to be greated!!!. The rest of the stuff are very friendly, from servers to bartenders to supervisors on duty.:).

My family and i were on vacation and drove by this place. We decided to stop. Best choice ever!! I ordered the beef empanadas happy hour special they were awesome and the stuffed banana was amazing it was our 1st time trying new food my bf got the cuban sandwich very good. Got very busy at 4pm because of the happy hour but we will totally come again just for this place.

Strawberry Mojito: If they hadn't packed a half of a pint glass with crushed ice (instead of the cubed ice they put into their glasses of soda or water) it might've been fine. It watered the whole thing down. My opening cocktail was a minty lime water.

Appetizer of West Indies beef patty was delicious. You could probably buy them in bulk at Costco. The mango salsa served with it was also tasty (I usually don't like mango salsa)

Chicken and steak skewers were ok, but there was nothing very Bahamian about them - served with grilled peppers and mushrooms. The rice/beans served beneath the skewers were dry.

Our server was a really nice guy. He recommended my drink, but I didn't have the heart to complain about it.

It's a chain restaurant, meaning not truly ethnic. Can someone recommend a sweet hole-in-the-wall?

We have always loved Bahama Breeze, and considered it a special night out!  NO LONGER!   We were a party of 6 seated outdoors and there were 2 large parties inside, but to WaIT 3 HOURS for food after ordering is unheard of!   What was supposed to be a nice birthday dinner was ruined!   2 tables of 4 ( we were 6) nearby came in after us, were served and left before our order arrived.   The Mahi bowl I ordered- 3 hours later was a soupy tasteless bowl of coconut milk!   The half off discount hardly made up for what was a sad excuse of service all around.   This location will not be visited by the 3 families in our party.  Very sad to say- but it all falls on poor management.

I loveeee Bahama Breeze !! The environment is so awesome and this place is so much fun. The food is also really great. It feels like your on vacation on an island when your in there. Love this place so much, if your looking for a great time this is a great place to go !!

We have been to this restaurant three times, the first time was for Valentine's Day. The service was slow and our food took a while ( 1 hour ) we figured it was due to the holiday. Didn't think much of it 
The second time, we were in the area and decided to give it another shot. So, after waiting over an hour to get our food AND water. I remembered I ordered an alcoholic drink, which was completely melted because the server forgot... 
We decided to not come back up. 
However, after receiving a large gift card for here. We decided to come, Once again. 
The service started off okay, nice server, helpful and kind. However it took us 15 minutes to get water. And once again, the food took over an hour and 15 minutes .. 
This will be our last visit too this restaurant! DO NOT GO

Scott was the best server/waiter  ever, he was very nice and consist And he also helped  me pick my drink, food, dessert . Best customer service ever!!! I absolutely love this place. Awesome food and drinks.   I wish there was one in Los Angeles, but I will definitely come back.

Michael M. Is an hourly manager here and has worked for Darden for years.  He is an awesome addition to the Bahama Breeze and will hopefully help it to improve.  Jeno was a good bartender and both of them made sure everything from drinks to appetizers to dinner was superb.  Food quality could be a little better but the appetizers -especially when they are half off during happy hour are worth a try.

3 stars because it was comical that our server had the personality of an awkward boy going through puberty. I got the Jamaican jerk sandwhich which was fantastic. We also got the flight of rum and margaritas which was pretty cool  but when I asked the youngest brother from home improvement on what drinks were good he looked like I was asking him if I could kiss him mom confused and a little grossed out. Regardless it was ok I would try it again. Jerk food was good jerk kid serving was not.

Everything I got was packed with flavor and my taste buds are a happy camper!   My brother lived in Vegas and this was one of his favorite places and I'm so glad he took us there.  The Beef Empanadas make you say MMMMMmmmm after every bite and for the main course I got the chef's pic of Stuffed Crab, Rice and a savory sauce.  I was so happy that I literally had to go one more time before I left!

First of all I have loved this place over the years! This restaurant has been one of my favorites. We went there tonight for my sister's 61st birthday!. The food was pretty good as always but the service was probably a 2 out of 10. Your server can make or break your experience and our server broke it. From our initial greeting to leaving it seemed she was going through the motions. I noticed other tables had a candle lit. Ours was unlit. I waited 15 minutes and finally lit it my self. Our server just did not want to give us the experience we deserved. Maybe our server was having a bad day or just tired as it was 8:30-9:30 pm. She just didn't smile or seemed enthused
about serving us. I was also unhappy that they did not sing to my sister and charged 8 bucks for her birthday desert. I have never been charged before at any establishment. My Mojito was all ice. I think the bartender needs a lesson from Havana Grill in Henderson on a proper Mojito. Seafood Paella, wood fire chicken and burger were good but not great. I hope our next experience will be back to the standards we expect from Darden and especially Bahama Breeze.

UPDATE:
The manager called me today 03/10/13 and offered to make it right.He also stated his first priority was to ensure that i will have a good experience...I want to thank the manager for the phone call and glad to see Bahama Breeze cares about the satisfaction of their costumers.......
Great food & fruity drinks. Enjoy your jerk chicken pasta while listening to a live reggae band.  Nice decor.  Reminds me of islands back home.

A few of my friends from work and I came here for lunch last week. I really like this place and the atmosphere. It's very tropical and relaxing. I ordered a Bahama Mama and the bar there does a fantastic job with that drink! It was delicious. My food was good and the service was very good. Our server was a very nice lady and she got us everything we wanted with a smile. Very personable. I have been here a few times and I will keep coming back.

Bahama Breeze has good food but horrible management. We made a reservation two days in advance for a 9-person party on my sister's birthday. We arrived 15 minutes prior to our reservation time, cake in hand. They had not reserved any tables for us because they just didn't have room, and then said we would have to wait for others to finish. This completely defeats the purpose of a RESERVATION. But the worst was yet to come. The general manager lied to us repeatedly... first she told us that a party table in the back had paid and were finishing their desserts. We watched as their first round of desserts were delivered 15 minutes later. Apparently at some point she told the party table that another party was waiting and they would need to leave soon. I would have been insulted if they had said this to me while I was enjoying my dinner, just to cover up for their incompetence. She even stationed servers near their table to put pressure on them to leave (she admitted this to us... wow). Later, another 9-person party table opened up, but we watched for 20 minutes as it remained dirty. We asked the manager if we could just sit there (we had been waiting for our RESERVED table for over an hour at this point), and she told us that she heard from somebody we didn't want to sit there. Another lie. The table remained unclean. She wouldn't even look us in the eye unless we went up to her first and her tone was overly rude all night. Finally an hour and a half later we were seated and given one free appetizer. Hooray. The waitress was great. If you make reservations here, don't expect them follow through.
Not gonna lie - surprised to find how much I enjoyed the jalapeño mojito. The coconut shrimp were on point, and the bartender and service was above my expectation. Not a bad use of your money.

We loved this place! Great atmosphere, great food, great service. I had a drink called something like "Bahamacardi" and it was so good! The shrimp linguine was delicious, and my sister said her fish was too. I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Vegas.
This place was excellent.  Food was very good.  My wife ordered the Frozen Bahamarita and is was good.  Will be returning!

Not the best food experience. Ordered churasco medium rare the outside pics were cooked food and the inside pieces looked like they were hidden in the middle cooked well done?? Not the best flavor on this dish. My sister ordered a mojito... if you are going to call something a cuban mojito at least attempt to make it correct (it tasted like cough syrup). Service was good. I have been to the one in Tampa the food and drinks are night and day.
Great place in the dead or winter for a little Caribbean style fun. It's a little franchise feeling but service and food is great.

One of our favorite restaurants and go-to's for something other than Outback or in the neighborhood. I really like the Salmon, though the Jamaican jerk wings off the happy hour menu are always delicious!

I do not recommend this place.   My wife and I ordered and an entree salad and a Burger. The salad came without dressing and there was no catsup for the burger.   I asked the kitchen person who brought the burger for catsup and she said ok. She never returned.  We waited for 15 minutes for someone to come by to ask for these things.  I finally went to the reception station and asked for the manager at the same time my wife went to the waitress station and asked another waitress for some help.  Our waitress suddenly showed up and put in an order for a new burger (which was stone cold by this point). My wife got her dressing finally and it was the wrong dressing!   The manager never came!

This is our favorite restaurant!!! You can choose so many wonderful foods:
Salmon prepared a selection of ways( other fish too)
Coconut shrimp, wonderful:
The best ribs in town: 
Sweet mashed potatos... Yummy
Onion Rings to die for. All delicious veggies! 
Could go on and on !!! Try it... It's irresistible ! Drinks are great too! Go there!

Loved the Bahama Breeze in Tampa so I tried this one when I moved to vegas. Service was horrible. I never bring it up but it was so bad I told the manager since I had the same waitress twice. He said that is just how she is. It took forever to get anything.
Had the fish tacos and they were great. Waiter suggested try them blackened and I'm glad I did. I will be going back when in town. Service was a little slow but still very good and friendly.

This was an amazing experience!  The drinks were strong, the food amazing, the service top notch!  We wish we had one close to us!  AMAZING!!!

Standouts were the onion rings and coconut shrimp.
We love the carribean atmosphere and excellent food. The drinks are excellent and plenty strong. One of our favorite stops when we are in the area

We went here our first night in town an its all we could talk about!
We were seated immediately. It was a little loud, but it was also busy. I do wish it ad been a little brighter, but it was still a welcoming atmosphere. The waitstaff were also pleasant and attentive without being annoying.

The food was so good! I had the calypso fettuccine.  It was perfect. The lighter portion was just big enough to make me full, but not so big that I was stuffed. We also had a slice of cheesecake that was also delicious, my fiancé's favorite part of the meal. We really enoyed our visit and plan on stopping in again the next time we are in the area.

Whenever I come here I come for just the lemonade. I do order food with it, typically the baby back ribs. My last visit the ribs were ehhhh. As I said, I come for the lemonade. Now the lemonade! Sucked... It used to be fresh squeezed and delicious. The bartender told me that now they make the syrup mix in the back beforehand. I came a week prior and it was still delicious. I dunno, I'm leaning towards him just being lazy. I even ordered two different ones. Both sucked and we're just syrupy tasting. Nasty nasty nasty. 

The visit I'm commenting on was about a month ago. I haven't been there since and probably won't return just because of the lemonade. 

To the bartenders credit, he didn't charge me for both lemonades.

Bad and overpriced.   Wanted to like this place, convenient location, nice patio outside on a Spring evening, but no. We ordered steak entrees, Oscar and Sirloin, neither was cooked correctly Carly.  Medium fully well done, medium rare was cold and bloody.  Asking for assistance from the waiter got no better results.  We were hungry so we ended up trying to eat what we had but they were so grizzly and tough we gave up.  The fish tacos literally needed to be held up and drained, pouring off some liquid ( wet lettuce?) ruining the crunch a taco should have.  Mashed potatoes were only potatoes side choice, white or sweet.  They had skins on, white mashed potatoes and were not washed!  Periodically, you could feel the crunch of sand/ dirt from potatoes not well scrubbed before cooking.  Yuk!  Ordered wings and quesadilla appetizers early, knowing the other two in my party would arrive hungry.  Waiter discussed hot or mild wings.  He brought onion rings instead and quickly dropped them off and left.  We ate the quesadilla, caught him later to correct and he said I said "rings". I said No and reminded him, " spicy or mild?" And he said Oh yeah. The weird thing is that he reached to take the rings away.  Usually, they say sorry Ill bring you the correct item, and offer you the other, since it cannot go to anyone else.  We may have eaten a few if he had, given how hungry everyone was, if he had. But no, and it was so late by then we cancelled the wings.  This whole fiasco was $75! $90 with tip.  Will never return, neither should you.
went beyond my expectations!!! food,ambiance and service was awesome. I highly recommend the firecracker shrimp and the grilled chicken with cilantro cremation. we will definitely be back.
Excellent food, Thursday night (service industry night) had good music and a 9pm-closing happy hour. Service was also very good, definitely a place I will visit again in Vegas

This was my first time here and I had a pretty good experience. Our server Randy was great. I ordered the Jamaican Jerk Chicken (a bit too salty though) and when I cut into it, it was still pink on the inside so he took it back and brought me a new plate, one that the chicken was fully cooked. While I was waiting for the new plate, he brought me a salad to snack on, on the house. Then when we finished eating and asked for the check, I realized he didn't charge me for my plate. Free dinner. Awesome!!!

Tried this place for an early dinner/happy hour and it was delicious! The customer service was friendly and prompt! We ordered a few drinks and appetizers from the happy hour and it was fantastic. For dinner, we shared the large size jerk chicken pasta and it was plenty for two people. The piña coladas were made perfectly topped off with a fresh pineapple piece. The atmosphere is fun and laid back as if we were at a tropical resort on the island. We will definitely be back.
Cortni was awesome. Perfect customer service. Food was excellent. Will definitely be back and hope to have her again as our server.

Live Music on the Enclosed Patio, while eating Carribean food near a fire pit on a cool December night...... Loved it!  Great waiters and management shows passion and professionalism at this location.  At the time of visit, our Restaurant dot Com certificates were honored and made the experience even more enjoyable.  Black Bean Burger (vegetarian style) and Rice Bowls were on point. Virgin Pina Colada was a bit on the sweet side, but no complaints!  The pineapple salsa....  a MUST have with Sambosa. 

Great location, away from the strip, but close enough to main streets.

Nice atmosphere. I sat at the bar and had the shrimp and lobster quesadillas. They were excellent but the service at the bar was a little slow. If you like amber beers try their brand I thought it was pretty good.

I kind of want to find something to nitpick about this place.  I hate being a guy that hands five stars out like they're candy.  But this place is truly amazing.  If I have to pick a restaurant outside of our usual rotation, or a place to go with friends, it'll be Bahama Breeze.  An amazing alcoholic drink menu (Painkiller, a bunch of mojitos) as well as some of the best lemonade you'll ever have (Lemon Breeze).

We typically have great service.  This last time featured a waiter that was very into his job and described menu items with words like "exquisite."  It's refreshing to have a waiter who is knowledgeable and happy to help.  The decor is clean and aesthetically pleasing.

We decided to start with the Tostones appetizer, though we weren't quite sure what to expect.  The plantains were crispy and the flavors diverse and delicious.  Despite not being much of a seafood eater, I always go with the fresh fish at the front of the menu.  Normally, it's the mango glazed tilapia.  This time I went with the Mahi Mahi as per the waiter's recommendation.  It wasn't as good as the tilapia, but it was still yummy.  My wife's curry bowl was equally as appetizing.  We left this place as we always do: with a full belly and smiles on our faces.

My husband and I honeymooned in the Bahamas over the holidays and we fell in love with conch fritters. I came home and told everyone how much I loved them and then my aunt sent me a gift card to Bahama Breeze as a wedding present. This place is so good. Like, unexpectedly really really good. And obviously a lot of people know this because the 2 times we've been there for dinner it was super crowded and there was a 45-minute wait. As we were waiting, a manager called out for a party of 2 with a reservation. I never would have thought to make a reservation here but now I know for next time!  Bahama Breeze is very good.  And I got a pina colada that was outstanding!  Whoever the chef is definitely know Carribean food very well.

Just had a great experience here! Sat at the bar before heading out on a flight back west. Anthony was tending bar and made my mojito to perfection, after I asked for some minor specifics. He also recommended a great appetizer that hit the spot. 

Would give 5 stars, but I usually hesitate if I have only had one visit. I will be back (might be awhile as I live In California) and will update on my second trip! 

Try the jerk shrimp....yum.

I used to love Bahama Breeze, but my past couple of visits have forced me to leave a lower rating.

They have changed some of the recipes, and removed the Carribean element to many of their dishes. The flatbreads have become bland pizzas, for example, and several of the seafood dishes have had their fruity sauces replaced with garlic butter generic sauce. The fire pit was also closed down, according to our waiter, and so they do not fire sear their foods anymore. I guess it just broiled.

With those changes, there's nothing special to it anymore and I have not been a customer since. If they reverse those changes i may consider going back and giving a better rating.

I made a big deal to my wife that we had to go to Bahama Breeze this time while we were in Las Vegas.  We went Monday night and a lot of reviewers commented that the concept for the restaurant and it is terrific...it really is nice.  But for us, that was where it ended.  Our service was very good (Thanks Sparky!)  My wife had the curry chicken for dinner...it was so dry and lacked flavor she could not eat it.  She ordered a strawberry magarita and she got a mango margarita instead.  We sent it back and this time it came back with only a little mango in it.  WTF?  The bartender could not make a most simple drink?!?!  To top off our drink issues...The pour on the tequila had to have been a 1/2 ounce if that...it was like drinking mix only and then it was served in a martini glass!.  If you don't have margarita glasses put it in a hurricane glass, those they had..  I had the paella and a couple of beers...it was a safe bet .  My daughter had the jerk chicken pasta, again, just okay, kind of lackluster in flavor.  To drink, she ordered a Bailey's and coffee...served in a regular ol' coffee mug.  A place like this I would have expected a clear mug to showcase the drink...nope, didn't happen.  I know some of this may seem like petty things but...our bill was close to $100 for the 3 dinners, drinks oh...and an appetizer.  The entrees did not come with any type of salad offering either.  Over priced and the Monday night bartender(s) needs a bit work.  We did voice our comments to the manager (actually we were going to leave and our server sent the manager to us!).  He said he will talk to his staff and try to fix things.  He did give us 3 comp drink tickets to use anytime.  One thing we do not do is complain to the manager in order to get a comp meal, we usually will talk to the manager AFTER we pay.  Getting comp'd is not the point, bringing issues to management's attention so they can resolve the problem is the larger issue.

My school group and I found this place after asking the desk clerk at our hotel. Man was it good. The atmosphere is great, it's Carribean themed. For dinner I ordered the blackened chicken pasta which was very tasty and a slice of key lime pie for dessert. Yes, it's a chain but it is one of the better ones out there. Check it out if you are in the Cleveland area.
The place was packed. The drinks were fantastic, so was the food and not to forget great service!
I luv the drink selection, always taste yummy on any day of the week!

We stopped there late (9:30pm) after our kids hockey tournament game, staff was very nice and sat is immediately. We started off with the lobster quesadilla and bang bang shrimp, both were fantastic...

Main entrees that we ordered were the jerk chicken alfredo pasta, paella, steak oscar, and key west fish tacos. All were really good, EXCEPT the key west fish tacos, they were quite bland and lacking any real flavor, could've used a nice cilantro lime cabbage slaw, or a lemon lime, cilantro mayo....

I would def recommend this place, and would eat there again..

Great place! Had a Birthday reservation there and they were completely helpful, the staff. The food was really good. Jamaican food with Caribbean vibes. They were busy, but that didn't delay the food orders. Would definitely recommend.

My man and I went here for 'A night to remember'.  It was beautiful as always, wth live plants, live bands and a clean place to eat.  However, since the last time we visited the prices have gone up.
We were extremely happy to see our old barender, who make magnificent, frest Mojitos and also our waiter, who was very attentative and went above and beyond the "Call of Duty"
One thing that we do suggust is getting some discounts in the reastruant, it would keep a more steady crowd.  I strongly suggust the Crab Claws St. Thomas as an appetizer, and the Shrimp Liguine as a main course.  We were too full to do dessert, but I image it would be wonderful as well!

The service was good except for the fact I had to request straws for my drinks. The food was delicious, but there was a small mishap with a possible seafood encounter and a mild allergic reaction. If you're allergic to seafood, make sure to request that your food is cooked/prepared separately from seafood. Despite the minor inconveniences, I enjoyed my first experience here. Also, it didn't take long for our food to be served which is a plus.

I don't want to admit this...but I am actually addicted to this place. In particular it's the coconut shrimp and the chicken empanadas. I guess I am ashamed because I know this is a chain and there is a great Jamaican restaurant in town which serves much more authentic food,but I am also a New englander who loves red lobster, so what can I say.Maybe it's cuz it's own by Darden. I'll figure it out later.

When I come here it reminds me of my trip to Barbados. I love the atmosphere, music,it's so much fun. I forget for a little while I am in a desert. The food is always on point.
I was there Saturday evening. The staff and atmosphere was great.  But the jerk chicken was merely seasoned baked chicken and my coconut shrimp was fried in old oil.

We missed the lunch crowd, so it was somewhat quiet. However, after having a couple of Pina Coladas, my girl friend and I were glad we didn't have to worry about folks thinking we were laughing too loudly! I think I had some kind of jerked shrimp dish, which was excellent. The bartender was extremely pleasant and a native Chicagoan to boot! I will definitely visit there when I'm next in Vegas!

great happy hours!! Firecracker shrimps, spinach dip, sesame crusted ahi...soooo delicious! Drinks are amazing deal and prices are so cheap. But more than anything, the staffs working there are the most friendly people working at happy hour. Just super nice, fast services. My boyfriend and I love the place. We definitely recommend this restaurant!! If u r tourists and staying on the Strip. It's rally worth to come here rather than going to overpriced bars on the Strip with snobby servers.

Ate there on Sunday with Cousin and his wife.

Love the decor, wait staff great & the food is good.  

I had the lobster quesadilla.  It was good just not great.  I had part of my cousins cuban sandwich and it was good.  I tasted the fish from the fish tacos & they were good.  

OVerall the experience for me was just a ok.  There is a lot to choose from the menu and I am sure there are some great items, but I just didn't get great food.

1st time here few weeks ago and I LOVE THIS PLACE! the place was spacious, food was great, staff was wonderful and not to mention 1/2 off everything on the appetizer menu!!!! and if you feel like your breath is kickin' there's complimentary mouthwash in the bathroom ;)

1st time here. My boyfriend and I went out for date night and choose this place. Nice atmosphere, very clean. Everything we ate we liked. When the music started it was very loud where we couldn't hear each other. Told manager and they did turn it down a little. I would go back again.

Ten minutes into my farewell to sobriety(I had been on the wagon since 2004, but
exigent circumstances had bent my arm), I was approached by a fellow pilgrim
who asked me if he could help me hold up the bar. "Indeed, sir, I can use all 
the help I can get." It was a sound decision and my new friend acquitted himself well.
Our conversation was the faire you might hear in the watering holes frequented by
other raconteurs like Oscar or Tark or Stephen Colbert(bring it on Colbert, I know 
a lot of big words too.)
But don't let my account give you the impression that the Breeze is a toilet populated
by drunks boring the rest of the drunks with stories they've told too many times. The
Breeze is an island with all of the amenities you would find in a tropical locale. Stout,
jerk chicken, dirty rice, cuba libre, huachinango veracruzana, and conch fritters are
all spoken here. When's the last time you had a bowl of Paella Valenciana? Never?
Well we got it here, mon. They've also got the Cajun equivalent, jambalaya. 
The Breeze is online and you can check  the menu out anytime you want to. They have take out too.
My new found friend and I had a great time and you will too. Check it out.

We went here for a birthday party for a co-worker of a friend of mine.  It was not my first choice to go to..honestly I'd only seen this place in passing on my way to the airport.  From the outside it doesn't look like much, nice big building on the corner of Paradise and Flamingo on the Northwest side.  Walking in, however, you feel transported to another place with the Caribbean theme of the restaurant and bar.

However, like a friend has told me, you can't necessarily paint something to make it what it ain't.

The food here is expensive for what you get.  We ordered quite a bit of food for the party: Spinach Dip and Island Chips, Island Onion Rings, West Indies Patties, and Creole Baked Goat Cheese to start.  None of these, to me, were particularly good.  The Spinach Dip was not even touched as my friend ordered it and then tried to pass it along to everyone else because she hated it.  The entree's were a little better: Cuban Sandwich and Margarita Chicken.  However for the $10 and $15 plates of food, I've had much better.

The service was slow for a slow Wednesday early evening dinner.  It was nice that we were able to sit in the atrium outside that was nicely cooled.  All in all, this seems like a poorly done chain restaurant based on a Caribbean theme.  My search shall continue (though how hard I look is yet to be determined).

Great food. Solid Happy Hour. Tall drafts for $4 and half off appetizers! Everything is flavorful and well executed. There's a wide variety of dishes whether you're a fish monger, meat eater or veggie cruncher.

The ambiance and vibe just add to everything.

This weekend was my first time going to Bahama Breeze with two of my friends and I'm sad I haven't tried this place sooner! Everything was great, I tried the "Zombie" drink which was nice and tropical. They have a nice selection of appetizers and my grilled chicken salad that was made with fresh fruit was fabulous! The server was very nice and attentive. I was also a fan of the fact the menu had the calorie information beside each item, it helped me make smarter choices in selecting my meal, I think all restaurants should start doing that. Lastly, I would like to say I enjoyed the island vibe that the entire restaurant had.

My wife and I went for a 9pm dinner.  It was a slower weeknight and we sat out on the closed patio area.  There was a guitarist playing some light guitar to some background islander music.

The service was excellent.  All our drinks were quick. The waiter made some good recommendations which we accepted, and we we're glad we did.  He was also personable.  He stayed and chatted for a bit, and we didn't feel rushed at all. 

They recently changed up their menu to include rice bowls.  And boy, the Carnitas bowl is pretty amazing.  I will be ordering that often;  It's a new regular dish for me. 

The reason this place hasn't earned 5 starts, is because their key lime pie leaves a lot to be desired (both my wife and I agree on this).  This should be a staple of a dessert for an islander themed restaurant, and it is a main dish the staff suggest for a dish.
At first they were friendly but the guy who took my order forgot my food. Drinks were good. Won't be back. Thank you

Our evening didn't start here, my husband and I were out to take my daughter to dinner for her 18th birthday, she decided on Hamada of Japan (DO NOT GO HERE, the service is HORRIBLE). Needless to say we ended up at Bahama Breeze we were seated in the area where there have some steel drums set up and a gentleman playing on them.

We were greeted by our server Ivan who was awesome...GREAT Lobster and Shrimp Linguine and Cuban Sandwiches...OOOH and the house Pina Colada!!!!

My first time dining at bahama breeze was fabulous.... everything was great.... service... food... and the ambiance... so told myself i'd be back again...

2nd attempt... Horrible... brought friends n younger cousins to try the place out... we'll that's the last time i'll refer anyone and will i ever go to that place...i didnt mind what my friend found in the food and the manager giving my friend the option to have a new plate of the same item or order another item but the fact that they ddnt stick to their words... the manager told us that we each can order dessert n give it to us... so i double checked with server if we all can each get desssert as a complimentary.. he went n asked and he said yes... so three ordered dessert... there were 5 of us..when we received the bill... there was no discount... just one of the dessert was taken off... the server told us that he made a mistake understandin the mnager.. when it was too late.... the manager never came back ever again when we finished.. but when i looked back as we paid at the cashier the manager went back and the server probably askin what happened... 

i am the type who doesnt complain...pay it off and leave dont ever come back dont refer anyone...
Love this place!!! Great place for visitors from out of town or for special occasions. Food and greats are exxxcelent

We've been to this place a few times for dinner and also just drinks and apps and it is always good. We stopped in last eve for a cocktail and app at the bar and had a Moscow mule which was good and an order of Conch Fritters and Yuca Fritas (fried Yuca) which is like a fried potato but better. Everything was very good and reasonably priced. Service from the two female bartenders was excellent as well.  We'll be back for sure!

Again i experienced a well prepared meal here at bahama breeze!.... It all began with my servers aley & jason they both displayed professional & vivacious attitudes!.... The service & food are always prepared to perfection. I strongly recommend anyone to come in and experience a wonderful time!

The worst...
Just because you have the recipe does not mean you can make it right. The paella was a joke it was more like mushy rice soup, could not tell diff. between any of the seafood, not to mention what they called sausage is more like pepperoni slices.

Best key lime pie EVER!  The coconut shrimp are legendary.  Great service and wonderful cocktails.  I had a small mahi and shrimp rice bowl.  Delicious and left enough room for the pie. Very extensive menu with something for everyone.

A very welcoming restaurant with a great menu that really makes an attempt to capture a Caribbean theme. The alcoholic menu was superb. We had Bahama mamas and a strawberry daiquiri and they were very enjoyable. Even though the restaurant seemed full of patrons, our meals were served to us in a very timely manner and we couldn't have been happier.

I absolutely love this place! With the birth of our son, my husband and I started a tradition that we would bring any new members of our family here on the day they join our home. We brought both our biological children and also our foster children here. It's a "Welcome to the Family" celebration!
We start off with the hummus appetizer which our 5 year old son is a big fan of. (Update: no longer on the menu) We also love their house salads with the cucumber sliver slices, pumpkin seeds, and crisp, tasty dressing! I ALWAYS get the paella which is AMAZEBALLS! Though I make it myself at home, theirs is way better! My husband always gets the Buttermilk Fried Chicken. We are creatures of habit and when you find something as delicious as these two menu items, you gotta stick with it! 
We used to LOVE their coffee as it was Jamaican Blue Mountain; but they switched a while ago, and it's just not the same. Kinda my one let down now.
Their frozen and tropical drinks are delicious, and we can never agree on just one dessert so we always order 2 or more. This time we got Chocolate Island (our go-to favorite) and a never-before tried Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside-Down Cake. Both lived up to expectations!

If you go on a weekend in the summer, they may have a band playing outside. Fingers crossed! 
For a chain restaurant, this is one of the better ones! Darden owns your classic Olive Gardens and Red Lobsters which are good for chains, but they hit it out of the park with this concept! We are partial to Jamaican themed anything though as we honeymooned in Montego Bay.
Haven't a negative thing to say, perhaps the pleasant greeting from all 3 beautiful Ladies as we entered, and Randy our server handled it well.

Bajama Breeze is a cute little themed restaurant that I went to for a friend's birthday. They accommodated us last minute for a party of fifteen so that was nice. We started off with the firecracker shrimp, coconut shrimp, and the fire-roasted jerk shrimp which were all pretty tasty. (Although I did prefer the coconut shrimp over the other two.) For dinner, I ate the lobster and shrimp pasta, without mushrooms, which had very little sauce, but was better than the one at Red Lobster. Our waiter was hilarious and also gave the birthday girl a long sugar cane, yes, sugar cane which was talked about for a good minute. My drink also came with a sugar cane inside of it, the Lemon Breeze, which I added strawberries too. Overall, the place was chill and the food was good, but not great. I think I would go back to see if it deserves that last star..

This place fell off big time since '05.  I keep giving it a chance because they have some dishes I really can't get anywhere else, but I'm too through with thier poor service.  The last several times I dined my servers had attitudes, bartenders have made me pitiful drinks and act as if  they don't see you while they engage in personal conversation.  I always ordered thier breeze salad but the lettuce is consistently ugly so I have to peruse it first. The last straw were my parents choosing this place for a nice date night, only to have the waitress spill the drink in his lap... something from a sitcom.  No compensation, zero f**ks given ha! Step your game up you all.
"The menu here is very different from BB's around the country. Less of a Caribbean food selection on the menu. However, their new wood fired chicken sandwich on naan was delicious!"

I can't in good conscience give this place any stars at this point. We have been going to Bahama Breeze for about two years now. Until lately we have always received good, prompt service. We like to sit at the bar and the bartenders have always taken good care of us. There have been many changes in bartenders the last few months and none for the better. The last two times we have been there the service has been extremely slow. Last night we sat at the bar for twenty five minutes and finally walked out and went to Red Lobster next door. The bar was not that crowded and there were two girls behind the bar. They never even acknowledged we were there. I really doubt we will be back after that experience. The food is great at Bahama Breeze but until they get some decent help, they are going to be in trouble.

If I had to choose one favorite in Las Vegas this would be it! It has the best vibe, best service and best food. If you come here ask for Tina as your server. She is the best. Happy hour is where it's at too. I can't say enough good things about this place. I've been here several times and every time it's been perfect. It almost feels like you're not in Vegas but the Bahamas, hence Bahama Breeze. :) Enjoy your dining experience, it won't disappoint!

This has always been one of My favorite Vegas restaurants. We always have a large group of people when we visit and the service doesn't disappoint. For my most recent visit, I ordered the stuffed crab shells (definitely my new favorite) and an order of beef empanadas which I ordered to take home. So, I got full off of mango lemonade, lol. Did I mention it's served in a glass and the extra is served in the mixer? When I got around to the beef empanadas with the mango chutney (breakfast), I was pleased with the amazing flavors, even as leftovers.
This restaurant is a great place for happy hour. They have amazing drink & food specials.

I went to this restaurant because of all the hype that their paella was getting. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. You could say that I was disappointed with the paella. The flavor was a little bland and the rice was a little bit uncooked. The shrimp did not seem fresh to me. I was really disappointed because I love paella. The atmosphere is nice and the service was above average. They have a good lunch menu and some of the specials looked really appetizing. My experience would have been better if I did not have such a high expectation with the paella.

Best Caribbean food in Las Vegas. The entire menus is spot on. They also have awesome drinks. The staff is friendly and offer spot on service. Very efficient at keeping the food and drinks flowing. Good location close to the strip for all visitors.

First time ever to Bahama Breeze.  I had the snapper shrimp saute and my husband had the sirloin with cheese and poblano peppers.  We all loved our food.  We also had the dynamite shrimp and empanadas for appetizers, again very good.  We went on a Saturday night and we had to wait over an hour.  So be prepared to wait if you go on the weekend.  The server was attentive and friendly.  Overall a good experience.

Brought mom here for Mother's Day. Planned a day trip at her request. The one place she wanted to go for a nice meal before heading back home was Bahama Breeze. So we visited a few other places in Las Vegas, then ended at Bahama Breeze where mom wanted Paella. She says other than in Spain, Bahama Breeze makes the best Paella! So we ordered salad, which, by the way, was delicious with an array of cold, crisp vegetables with a dynamite vinaigrette, and two orders of Paella enough to serve four people. We even took some home since we couldn't finish it all. A family member and I ordered a glass of the Merlot which was a nice compliment to our meal. There was no room for dessert! Next time for sure. Definitely worth the trip. Will do this day trip thing again this summer. It was fun! Bahama Breeze is high on the "do over" list!

This was my first visit here. Had dinner with my boyfriend who has been here before. 
We had the lemon breeze to drink and they were tasty. 
We order appetizers from the happy hour half price menu and decided on the beef empanadas. They came out fast and were really good. 
My boyfriend ordered the carnitas rice bowl. The presentation was good and it was warm, starchy and tasted good
I ordered the fish tacos and was a little disappointed.  They weren't even luke warm.  Our friendly server, Lisa, offered to take them back and warm them, but I declined. I usually don't complain and never send food back because I'm afraid of what will be done to it.  
She left our table and returned shortly and said they were taking the fish tacos off the bill. Wow, that was really nice. 
I really wanted to like this place, but I don't think I'll be back.

We ate at Bahama breeze Robinson twp tonight.... We have eaten there 50 times before with no problem.... Tonight my husband and I both ordered Cuban sandwiches which were funky tasting and really bad smelling... We send them back.... The manager assured us that they were fine..... Yuck..... He asked us to order something else....40 minutes later we received our new dinner and we were rewarded with a new check that was $20 more than the original would have been.... He never checked back.... I guess we were to blame for the funky pork..... Will never ever return...there are way too many great chain restaurants to frequent .... Bye bye Bahama breeze!!!!!!!

Bahama Breeze is a chain restaurant serving food and cocktails inspired by the Caribbean Islands. There is a traditional cocktail inspired from each island. The lemonade comes with a sugar cane stick in your glass, so you can chew on the sugar cane if you'd like. It adds an authentic touch to the sweet tasting drink.

Reverse happy hour from 9 PM to close is the best! It is half off all drinks and appetizers, getting you the most bang for your buck. There are a few appetizers with shrimp, but all are prepared differently. There are a variety of appetizers to choose from, including shrimp, chicken, and beef dishes.

There is live music as well at night, adding to the comfy island feel. This is a good place for a date night or even families, being open for lunch and dinner.

Tempted by Caribbean food we headed to Bahama Breeze.  What we really found was very bad Caribbean inspired chain restaurant food with fake enthusiastic waiters.

Everything is god awful.  Tasteless processed shrimp, fried chicken straight from the freezer bag, fake Caribbean food, obesity sized portions, to over bearing super enthusiastic waiter that just wants to sell sell sell... it was a disaster.  You could stick a knife in his gut and he would still smile and say that was the most thrilling fun he's had he ever had and then try to sell you a tasty signature yummy cocunut piss flavored drink.

For the first time ever, only half the food was eaten and doggie bags were clearly declined.  I felt so cheated, I honestly thought this was a non-chain, real caribbean restaurant.
The lobster and shrimp quesadillas are amazing! Absolutely delicious. I also highly recommend the hibiscus margarita. Very good!

The good service, cool atmosphere, and tropical cocktails earns the place 2 stars. As for the food.. 1 star. Ordered the taste of Jamaica sampler platter. The only thing decent were the plantains. Jerk chicken was so dry you could sand with it. Pulled pork was so dry you could use it as a fire kindling. The rice was bland. And the greens were overcooked. Very disapointing. Seeing as 5yrs earlier I had eaten there and the food was great. Will return for the atmosphere and cocktails. But not the food...

This is one of our favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  We always have great service and when we were there this week it was no exception. They used to serve a great chicken salad with their black bean and corn salsa, they took it off the menu a few years ago but they always make it special when we ask about it.  That is what I call service.

Prices are reasonable and the staff is always friendly.  I wish they would bring this restaurant to Portland, Oregon!
Amazing service, my first time there & was seated down immediately and food was quick! Didn't remember the name of our server but he was excellent
Great food. Hard decision what to get, and even though our server was only "4 days in" he steered us in the right direction. Thanks Thomas!!!!! Nice atmosphere, music, food, and drinks.

I came here while one early afternoon while visiting Vegas. The food here is so flavorful. Seems like a great place for groups because there is a lot of space. The service was great as well. The waiter made sure our drinks never ran dry and that we had everything we needed and was very friendly. I got a sampler plate with empanadas, jerk chicken, and rice, and other yummy choices. Also tried the baby back ribs. Sooooooo good! I would love to try their seafood here.

Seriously one of my favorite restaurants! Always seated right away and the environment reminds me of home

I don't think I'd actually get an entrée here but almost all their appetizers are big enough for 2 people to share. Of course, you should always come during their happy hour. Half off appetizers and drinks.

All the times I've been here, our server is always friendly and funny. I also love how it's near the strip but away from the madness. Definitely taking my family and friends here when they come to visit.

I actually really like the food and drink here. 5 stars for that! Liked it so much that I have been trying to bring my wedding party and guests here for our rehearsal dinner.  But 3 strikes for me is enough however.  Trying to book this has been the worst experience of planning our entire Vegas wedding.
