We have been put on hold for 10/20 min a time only to get someone that can't help us, doesn't want to help us, nor doesn't seem like they have any interest in working with us. Rude, don't care, unhelpful, constant runaround. Not a problem, we'll take the business of 25 guest we were going to come in with and enjoy food and drinks elsewhere. A little foolish on their end if you ask me... good luck with that attitude

I just had my wedding reception there and the food and atmosphere is amazing! I was more than impressed with the quality of the food and wonderful service from the waiters that worked our party. I will definitely be returning.

Stopped by for the happy hour. Prices and selection were decent, however service wasn't as great. After being seated, waited for 10-15 minutes until finally a waiter came by and apologized claiming that we were not in his section and that he would fill in for the server that was missing, maybe they got abducted by aliens or something? 

Anyway, the food was actually pretty good, ordered coconut shrimp, adobo chicken tacos for apps and mahi-mahi fish tacos as an entree. Each were flavorful, my favorite were the fish tacos, although the shrimp and chicken tacos were both close.

Other than the mishap at the beginning of my visit Bahama breeze was a good one!

Love these places.  They are starting to replace Olive Garden as my go-to chain restaurant when traveling.  They have some nice lighter portions, and their food is very good and reasonably price. Most of their restaurants have someplace you can sit and hear yourself think.

This location is no exception.  I was very pleased with my appetizer (lump crab meat stack with avocado, shrimp, greens, and a very tangy sauce.)  My chicken main dish (a nice, right-sized, tasty platter for ONLY TEN BUCKS) was a very pleasant surprise.  The waitress was efficient and friendly.

General comment to BB management: I really mourn the loss of the corn fritters, they were out of this world.
Went their to get a pina colada, and was pleasantly surprised at how good it was! In fact, it was better than the ones my husband and I had while in the Bahamas; so kudos to Bahama Breeze!

Another food chain that tries way to hard and misses the point of the food by over doing it! I had to dumb down the food I ordered because everything was just overboard, for example they had to much stuff in one dish that took away from the flavor of the food and my server was slow and kept doing a disappearing act. I'm going back for happy hr so I'll update again. I've been to several location in GA but you just never know what your going to get. Not my favorite restaurant at all!

We were actually on the way to Olive Garden but were caught up by Bahama Breeze as there're many people setting at the porch at 5:30pm. We're first time here and found out they have happy hours 50% off on liquors and appetizers. Nobody taking care of us after we'd been setting at the table for 10mins. Finally a waiter named Gregory came to us explained and apologized for the wait. He also got us the 50% off appetizer (the wings) after happy hour. It's nicely handled. Despite the wait, the foods are great. We ordered the seafood paella, Jamaica chicken wings, and the BBQ ribs. 

The wings are really good, highly recommended! The paella has many ingredients in it; the size is quite large, good for parties of 2-3. The BBQ ribs are juicy and savory. We're glad that we did go to Olive Garden.
Foods great happy hour even better! You can get your drink inside a pineapple, or coconut!  How awesome is that, even procing isnt outrageous considering how close they are to the strip!

Loved the restaurant ambience and food. Perfect place to relax with soothing live music, delicious food and great cocktails.

Need to mention especially about our server JD. He was so fun to talk to and made our decisions easy. He made the food even more delicious with the way he described them to us :). Employees like them make a place even more special.

Definitely order the jerk shrimp and Jamaican chicken. It's not like what we were used to in other places.

I was looking to get away from the Strip and all the pretentious,  way overpriced food there, when I stumbled upon this place. It was Tuesday afternoon, at least in the 80's. This place is a tropical themed place, with nice covered outdoor seating - perfect! There was a nice breeze & it wasn't  crowded, although I'm sure it is at happy hour & prime times.

Nice menu with carribean influenced items, and drinks. I had a great margarita, coconut shrimp & salad ( lunch special). Good value, and delicious. If I lived nearby, I would be a regular.
Sehr lecker und nicht zu teuer. Die Tische im Aussenbereich sind etwas wackelig und schlecht ausgeleuchtet. Dennoch: Sehr empfehlenswert!

Good food and drinks. The wait staff was great but the server is kinda d*%#.  I ordered coconut mojito drink and I asked for straw. He said " that's the straw" pointing to 2.5 inches of sugar cane stick. Next time I'll dare him to suck on that for $100 to finish my drink.
First dinning experience here. My wife is leaving 80% of her plate on the table. No flavor on the steak, under cooked broccoli, and sour mashed potatos. Save your money and dine elsewhere.

Went on a Friday night at 7:30 place was about half way full and we were seated in front of a live singer, music was good, food was great and staff was even better.  Crowd was a little on the older side 45+ so next time we might come later.

Spinach dip was da bomb!
I always receive great customer service definitely a favorite spot when looking for a place to sit and unwind.  They treat Vegas locals good.

Not great, I had a good experience my first time but on my second trip the empanadas were bland and the Mahi in my fish taco , wasn't even close to being done cooking... I mean completely raw and just sautéed. They comped the meal and gave a free dessert, but I'm pretty sure they messed up the check , either way I'll never be here again. Shame, I like the vacation atmosphere
Came here for Happy Hour. Food and drinks were so delicious! The customer service was outstanding. Marcus was our waiter and made our first experience wonderful. Will definitely be coming back!!

Amazing experience and pricing better than restaurants  on the strip! I liked the island music and the relaxed vibe! I felt like I was on a tropical vacation. Lobster Mac and cheese was delicious and the drink in the pineapple hit the spot. I recommend.

Not bad at all for a chain restaurant. The theme is well executed and feels very authentic. The setting is casual and relaxed, but with enough ambient noise to make it kid friendly. Cuisine includes lots of chicken and seafood options. A "lighter serving" option is available for many meals, making for a cheaper - but still quite filling - meal. I didn't have high hopes going into this place, but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and level of service. I'd definitely eat here again.

I wanted to try something new so we decided to give this place a try. It was such a great experience and a nice change to all the all you can eat places in town. The menu was mouth watering and so was the food. I had the Calypso Shrimp Linguine and the portion was so big that I had it to go. The waiter even added a little hand drawn picture of a sailing boat on top of my to go box which was kind of neat. My hubbie and I had the linguine for lunch the next day. I added green onions, sake and garlic to it and it was delicious! Our drinks were great too. Its not a surprise that this place was packed for a tuesday night. The only downside was the garlic bread. It was a little soggy. In all I think that this is a great place to hang out with friends or your significant other. Can't wait to go back...

Ahi stack looked like raw pink blobs on a plate and completely not appetizing. Within 2 minutes of getting appetizer the main dish was brought to table. Despite being piping hot, the shrimp in my bowl were nearly transparent and not well cooked at all. Manager tried to do right by us but not the first disappointing experience here . Will think long and hard before returning. Quality has taken a tumble over the years.

First time trying Bahama Breeze, and really enjoyed it.  Went to this location last Thursday.  Prompt service, with an personable and down-to-earth staff, fun and relaxed Caribbean atmosphere, great music, excellent food!  Ordered drinks and the Grilled Chicken with Cilantro Crema for myself, while my friend ordered ribs.

Came to Vegas for my Dirty 30 birthday celebration. We had a party of 18 and I was trying to find a reasonably priced place with a large selection of choices. Thank goodness I picked Bahama Breeze! I tried to make a reservation a week or so in advance and was told to just call the morning of. I was a little skeptical but thought, ok fine, let's see. Called the morning of and got a reservation, no problem at all. Had to wait about 20 minutes once we got there for the table to be ready, and had to have them add more seats 3 times, for some reason they kept counting wrong. But all the staff was very sweet. Had two servers, one was named "Red", both were AWESOME! Took a while to get drinks out, but with 18 people that can be expected. My hubs and I had some Mojitos, the avocado crab stack, coconut shrimp, fish tacos and side salad with fruit vinaigrette. Everything was DELISH! I mean like super, awesome, very, very good!!!!!! They also let us each have separate checks which made paying SO much easier! Thank you Bahama Breeze for making my birthday dinner amazing! All 18 people loved their food and drinks, and that's not an easy task!

drove by here so many times thinking I need to try that place out, finely did. Sat outside enjoying the band, dinner and a couple drinks. bartender gave great service and the empanadas were good. not quite as authentic as Jamaica but very close.
Love their Lemon Breeze Drink.. Ordered one Chef's special salmon for lunch..
We love this place! Our family of 5 tries to eat here whenever we are in Vegas. The food and cocktails are awesome, and the staff is always friendly.
This is one of my favorite spots: great food and even better service definitely coming back.....our server Donna was AMAZING!!!

I was seriously so disappointed by this place, we are locals and decided to try something new and hit up Bahama Breeze. They had a happy hour special so we got some half off appetizers, the carnita street tacos were good but that was the only good thing about this meal. My mans steak was filled with grissle and his mashed potatoes were generic. My jerk chicken pasta had nothing jerk about it and also very bland. So disappointed we spent $70 there!!!

Let's preface this post with some crappy weather that ultimately was probably the downfall of our dinner. We were greeted by a server who didn't identify herself. She asked if we've been here before and I said not in a long while. She said, "oh well, the drinks and food specials are in the front". Monotone. Flat faced. And she walked away. I order our beverages. I actually lap timed how often she came back to us. The longest lap was 15 before ordering. In hop 2 bubbles chicks behind us trying the "Thursday night special" we weren't told about. I guess the promotion ends at 9, it was 8:55pm. Any who. While were there nearly an HOUR, the girls and our table get our food the same time. Sweet. I thought our lovely server forgot about us. Nope. She took our plates and promptly shuttered over herself to ask if we wanted anything before handing my check covered in some sort of sticky syrup which was over her hands. She was extremely nice when she handed me the check. Ya, know for a $50+ ticket and hoping for a 15-20% tip, you would THINK she'd be nicer. Nope. So, she got what she deserved. She made me feel like I inconvenienced her for doing her job. Wish it was better. Also Mgmt should take note that this restaurant needs a good DEEP cleaning. The window sills are disgusting. The menus need to be Lysoled & wiped down with bleach wipes. The carpet needs replacing. I can go on and on. But the most disappointing part of the evening was being treated "less than" the other guests by our server. Oh by the way, thank you Ashley S. for being one of the most unpleasant servers I've ever encountered. I only found her name on the actual receipt. 

PS if you smiled and were nice you would have gotten 20%.
We loved the Cuban Bread appetizer but they stopped serving it. The rest of the food is ok. The best thing about this place is the Chocolate Island desert. The wife likes the Mojitos.

Never thought we'd eat there as it's a bit off the Strip for some reason we ended up there for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. Employees were extremely friendly and accomodating, offering us advice on what's good on the menu -

The jerk chicken is awesome and so was the salmon salad. A lot of food for what you pay too! It was a Sunday afternoon so the atmosphere was pretty mellow - overall, a great find for lunch.
I had my wedding reception here and it was an amazing experience!!! Great food and wonderful staff, I'm so glad I chose this place!

Came for a wedding rehearsal dinner. Before the rest of the family arrived, we sat at the bar and ordered apps and drinks. The pina coladas and lava flows were ON POINT. Thick, creamy, and not the least bit skimpy on the booze. The yucca fries and spinach dip were also pretty legit.

But then when we sat down at our table, the entrees were all appalling. I don't even remember what we ordered because nothing had any flavor. The décor is pretty cool though!
Great fruity island drinks! Seafood dishes are absolutely fresh, not bad for a chain restaurant. Quick service, neat island style decor.  Try the blackened anything.
Had spicy jerk shrimp and almond crusted mahi. It was all very good and reasonably priced.  Cheap happy hour drinks as well.

For a chain, it was fine.  I was here for business and staying up the street.  We were seated right away, and the service was quick.  Our waitress was a little strange and over-friendly.  I had the chicken with cilantro crema.  It was better than I was expecting, but not spectacular.  If you need something cheap and fast, this place is fine.

Totally amazing.. me and my wife visited this restaurant  after a long day of shopping at the mall at Robinson .. it was excellent and we enjoyed the food a lot .. we are vegetarians but still we enjoyed this Carre bean sea food friendly restaurant  ... we loved the veggie sandwich and the especially the drinks we ordered . Painkiller I loved it :D

Kurt was our fantastic server for lunch in the tropical area to the right of the entrance.  I always get a booth there cause it's cozy, & it puts a smile on mom's face, especially after chemotherapy.  The enclosed patio to the left of the entrance is very bright & also beautifully decorated, obviously has that Bahama feel.  On a rainy day, it was perfect for mom & I.  

Two of my favorites that I've never gone wrong with:

Jerk Shrimp w/ Cuban bread is the best, best, best.  I have had their appetizer sampler which was very filling also, but I highly recommend the Jerk Shrimp over that if you're hungry.  

On the lighter, yet EXTREMELY good side is their Avocado stuffed Crabmeat salad!  Real crab meat & lots of it, stuffed into one avocado.  The salad is light & flavorful.  I love it & crave it all over again just writing this.  Next time, I'm gonna ask for extra crab, no salad cause I don't eat too many tomatoes & there's a lot.  

Also a reminder to self, Margarita Flight or Sampler!  I have to try this next time.  I usually get the KJ Chardonnay.  

Our server Kurt was friendly, helpful, & although it was packed & super busy, he was always there.  Immediately got a knife to cut mom's Apple Bacon Cheddar Burger (she loved it), & a to-go box.  He also offered suggestions off of the menu & overall made our day.  Thank you Kurt, we will be back in your section.  

Just a month before, dad & I sat at the bar & the bartender was not so nice.  I thought I am only sitting in the dining area here from now on & I am glad we did.

I really would like to give them a 4.5, but I really can't give them a 5.  We started with drinks & appetizers:  Rumrunner for the wife, a mojito for me, with coconut shrimp and conch fritters.  Rumrunner was delicious, but the mojito was not tasty and not well executed (mint wasn't muddled, lime wedges were un-squeezed and rock-hard, and it had crushed ice instead of cubes).  Shrimp and conches were both delicious, but they had the same sauce, which is a very minor criticism.

We had our minds on paella, which we ordered, and after all the fried stuff, we wanted something vegetable-y, which was not on the menu (unless you count salads, which we were not in the mood for).  On inquiring we were informed that there were broccoli, green beans, and asparagus available, of which we ordered the first two.  To our surprise and delight, the vegetables were nicely cooked and delicious.  The paella was awesome, especially considering they did not skimp on the seafood.  My wife didn't like the style of rice, but I thought it was appropriate.  It was also too much for us, and we ended up taking it home.  Since I'm writing this the day after our visit and I just had a fairly large portion of paella leftovers, I can report that it was maybe even better the next day.  

Back to our visit, we were too full for dessert, so I just ordered an Irish coffee, which even after I verified that they would make it the proper way (coffee, Irish whiskey, and whipped cream), the waiter came back with this drink that he said had Kahlua in it, which I summarily sent back whence it came, which I felt they could have been a little more apologetic about.  The real drink, when it came back, kind of had an aftertaste like bottom-shelf spirits. 

The ambiance was nice.  There was a musician playing tropical-themed music, which we quite enjoyed.  The service was fairly good but not superb; no complaints.

Amazing service. We were greeted and spoken to by every employee we saw: the hostess, the busser, the servers, the food runner. Everyone was super nice and friendly. Honestly, some of the best customer service I've received in a restaurant ever.

The jerk chicken wings are tasty...unfortunately its not spicy whatsoever. They really need to kick up the heat on them. 

On two occasions, we got the Cuban Sandwich. Its large with plenty of meat. The second time we got it, the sandwich had lettuce and tomatoes on it, which we didn't like. But its really a good sandwich.

Get the Breeze salad. It has a delicious dressing...salty, sweet and sour all in one. The real star, though, is the pumpkin seeds.

The rice and beans are good, though on both occasions, they were not hot when they got to the table, just warm.

We also got the tostones, which are fried plantains with a topping. These were not too good. There's not enough topping for all of the tostones and they're dry. There's no dipping sauce or anything, either. They were kind of bland.

The price is a little higher  than average but its manageable as long as you stay away from  the pricier items.

This is a MUST stop here if there is one close! So delicious! We came with a party of 19 and had at least 9 kids with us. They were very accommodating and everyone single person in out party loved their food, including the kids! After trying our appetizers we began to share food, because everything was seriously soooooooo good. For an appetizer, order the Jamaican jerk wings, they are the best wings and cooked perfectly. They have a happy hour after 9 with half off appetizers and special drinks, so well worth it. Fresh lemonades made with real fruit and shaken for you. Really delicious! Kids pasta is great and serving size is big. Salads are huge also. Really, nothing bad to say about this place, food came fast, great live music and friendly staff.
Also had the empanadas, coconut shrimp, fire cracker shrimp (my personal favorite), ribs, jerk chicken pasta, shrimp and grits, steak and crab stacks. I'm sure there was more but bottom line everything was good. You will not be disappointed!
Unique dishes with beautiful presentations.  Decent prices.  Virgin Bahamarita is a good drink.  Good for groups.  2 Blocks from the strip.

Where do i begin, this place is FANTASTIC, the decor is beautiful. Takes up the corner spot in a large shopping center, big parking lot. Came in Fri 1/15/16 around 8:00pm, the lot was full but to our surprise there was no wait, the restaurant is huge. The staff are great our waiter Fred came over within a minute of our sitting down and gave us a rundown of the best & most popular drinks & dishes since this was our first visit. My daughter that doesnt drink, loves strawberry lemonade and orders it whenever its on a menu, she says this was the best shes EVER had. All i can say is this place is now in my top 5 of places to have a great "experience" meal. To me, the prices are low for the quality & quantity of food we received, if it were more i wouldnt complain. We were so stuffed couldnt try dessert. They do have small plates so we might do that with drinks next time so that we can try those delicious looking desserts.
Had the ahí and the sauce on it killed the taste of the ahí. Had the chowder very tasty! Need to serve with something other than oyster crackers!

The drinks were really good, probably better than the food. I had the jerk chicken sandwich and fries. The sandwich was ok and they really didn't give me that much fries. I might try this place again but try something else.

This place is the theme restaurant of all theme restaurants! You definitely feel like you're not in Ohio when you walk inside. The decor is interesting and the staff is nice. 

My boyfriend ordered a flight of rum drinks and really enjoyed them. I got a pineapple mojito and it was just okay. 

We got the jerk chicken wings for an app and they were awesome! But our actual meals were really just okay. 

In addition, our server seemed very overwhelmed and mentioned having tables across the restaurant. Therefore we were checked on pretty rarely. 

Lastly, the place was pretty pricey, even considering the drinks and app. 

Overall, we wouldn't run back to this place

Love Bahama Breeze, whether it is in Orlando or Las Vegas. However, the first time I ever dined at one was in Orlando. 

This is a fabulous restaurant and it has a great ambiance. It truly reminds me of a meal in the Bahamas. The only thing missing were the geckos on the walls. 

Food is great, service is ok. Decor is perfect.

and yes.....  I know it is a chain.  I typically shun chains and like all chains it will probably go down the big spiral.  But for now, I like it!

I had a gift card for Bahama Breeze that I got on my birthday and I had forgotten until one day I drove by and decided it was the perfect time to use it. I was solo so decided to seat at the bar and blend in into the party ambiance, although not planned that way I landed there during happy hour which gave my gift card extra buying power.
As I waited patiently at the bar a couple sat by me and were instantly acknowledged and asked if they wanted drinks, they ordered two mojitos and the bartender left to make them, when she came back with their drinks she asked them if they were ready to order, it was then that I realized I have the power of being invisible if no one is looking. I sort of interrupted and asked if I could have a drink and that I was ready to order, she took their order and then took mine giving me that "can't you wait for your turn? look"
I ordered the paella which was very good although not authentic for it was made with long grain rice but the result was the same, a delicious zafron rice dish loaded with seafood! I also got the coconut shrimp with some kind of sweet n sour sauce that was equally delicious as the paella, there are also many more items on the menu that I would love to try like the Jamaican chicken or firecracker shrimp they both sounded good I just didn't have the belly space but I'm working on expanding.
The setting is also very nice, the building is like a large plantation house very spacious with high ceilings and nice breezy caribbean atmosphere with indoor and outdoor sections.   
The waitress returned to ask the people by my side if everything was ok, they asked her if she could take their picture and I took advantage of the opportunity and asked her for my check hoping not to interrupt a perfect customer waitress relation.
 I'm definitely coming back..what else can I ask for? Awesome fun and clean environment, excellent delicious food and outstanding service...........for the couple sitting next to me!

Service was nearly non-existent. Employees were noticeably disinterested or awkwardly unhappy. Quality of the food was comparable to fast food. 
 
I keep hearing good things about this place, but I was disappointed. They sat us in the patio area. The patio is a nice open window area with a gas fireplace in the center. The fire creates a nice mood and the fresh air is lovely. However, its not the greatest on a warm day. Also you can smell the gas or propane that fuels the fire when down wind. It can be nauseating after a while. Our server is a nice guy, but noticeably disinterested. We place our order with an appetizer. The appetizer is delivered but utensils or napkins were not provided. We flagged an employee, and let him know we didn't have any napkins or utensils. A few minutes later he produced a handful of cocktail napkins. We needed to flag another person for the rest. The appetizer tasted horrible. Ahi tuna should not have a heavy fish flavor. Our main order was delivered by an individual who was not amused by our misunderstanding of what he said when asking "who ordered what". It was clear that he was quite unhappy with this duty. I had ordered a Cuban sandwich. It tasted fine, but was ordinary. You can find the same quality at any subway or port of subs. Nothing impressive. We decided we had enough and requested the check...I can still taste the tuna, it was pretty bad.

I could live off the buttermilk fried chicken breasts, so good. And don't forget my bahamarita!!! My only complaint is that there not one closer to my house. Devin is a great quick and friendly server. The best! Gotta come back for happy hour!
Good food . I went for happy hour . Was surprised at how extensive the happy hour food menu was . I ate a lot for cheap lol

Decided to have dinner at Bahama Breeze at the suggestion of a good friend who's a regular. I was pleased to open the menu and find so many healthy options. The calories are listed with each menu item which is so awesome for us calorie counters!  I'm back to eating healthy and working out on a regular basis. I can definitely see myself having another healthy dinner here again especially after a good work out. This would also be a great place to grab a drink and to eat on your day off from counting calories.

I'd recommend trying the chicken tortilla soup(110 calories) and the grilled chicken and fresh fruit salad(660 calories).

Buttermilk chicken is outstanding. I mean comfort food at its finest. The crab, shrimp, mango avocado stack is great. The chicken kabobs are really nice but kind of plain. Something about their yellow rice is quite tasty. The lobster and shrimp linguine is a huge portion and the brandy cream sauce is sweet and finishes well. Their tomato salad is great. I always get the Lemon Breeze lemonade drink here too. Chocolate Island makes a great ending.

We came here for date night, but unfortunately left disappointed. We ordered the chips and "salsa" but what we got was chips and bruschetta. We both ordered steak -mine medium and my husband got well done. We were served our meals that look small, but were almost average size on huge plates however the steaks were undercooked (we were given a medium rare and a medium) the steak was tough, chewy and under seasoned. My husband and I were both upset because of the great reviews but we both ultimately left dissatisfied and still hungry. 
Also, double check the bill- they calculate the tip after taxes are added. 
I'm only giving it 2stars because our server was really nice and the drinks were great (ultimate pineapple and pina colada).
Probably won't come back.

Bahama Breeze is probably one of the best casual eateries to eat at in Las Vegas for a mid-price point. It is two blocks from the Strip, just far enough to spare you from the chaotic traffic but close enough that you can ride-share to it; and if location isn't enough to sell you, their happy hour will.

With $5 Wines, $5 Well Drinks, and half-off appetizers what is not to love? My highlights were their Jamaican Chicken Wings and Coconut Shrimp paired with a Frozen Bahamarita. They have something for everyone, their menu ranging from dishes of all sizes.

TIP: If you're going to eat here over the summer (which is like May through September in Las Vegas) make sure you are seated in the main dining room and not in either of the patios because while the tropical decor is to die for, you will literally die from the heat
Delishhhhh!!!!! Food was amazing!!! Service was fabulous!! Would totally recommend to a friend!

I love this restaurant!  It has a good menu, different from other Pgh menus.  We go here often, and I usually get the Cobb salad, its great.  On Tuesday I tried the coconut shrimp tacos, they were so good!  The spicy shrimp appetizer is my favorite.  The restaurant is pretty, we have always had good servers. If you have to wait they have a lovely waiting area, it is just always an enjoyable experience to dine here.

I had heard about this place but I had not had a chance to try it. I was on my way to eat brunch on the strip when I saw this place. My friend and I decided to eat here instead because there was plenty of parking and it had good reviews on yelp.

We started off ordering the panko onion rings as an appetizer, They were pretty good, I'm not a fan of panko bread crumbs but my friend is so we got them. We also got a side caesar salad, It was so light and delicious. It also had shaved pieces of parmesan cheese and the croutons tasted homemade. 

For the entree, we decided to split the Calypso Shrimp Linguine, the menu said it had shrimp in every bite so I needed to see if that was true. I love shrimp so I had to try it. They gave us the plate and there was a lot of shrimp, I mean, a lot! It was awesome! The linguine was perfectly cooked al dente, the pasta was sauteed with garlic, onion and tomatoes with a hint of spice and cream. The amount of cream was perfect and not overwhelming and there literally was shrimp in every bite. Pastas are usually topped with shrimp, this one also had shrimp in between. It was so good and the price was awesome! $18.00 for a large portion which my friend and I could not finish. We left some pasta, I ate all the shrimp and enjoyed every single one of them.

The desserts looked yummy but we could not try them because we were stuffed. 

I love this place, hope to go back soon.

Great mojito.  Very authentic and a nice size.
Service was very attentive in the bar on a very busy night with sports all over.

This restaurant is decent. The appetizers are quite good, but there aren't too many great options available for lunch or dinner entrees.  One nice thing is that there usually isn't too long of a wait at this location, even on weekend nights.
The crab cakes and Jamaican chicken wings weren't good. The lobster shrimp quesadilla was really good. The mojito is stellar and the martini was underwhelming.

Bahama Breeze is an overpriced chain food restaurant with a tiny dining area. Their wrap around porch is pretty sweet, except they totally built a tiny dining area to force you to wait for over an hour on the porch buying expensive syrupy cocktails. 

The best part: the porch overlooks the parking lot that is I-271.

Been here twice now, and had two decent meals. Everything tasted good both times.  Just recently had the fish tacos.  They weren't the best I've ever had, but the tilapia was cooked well and they had fresh toppings on them.  So, uh yeah, it's good.

I had made reservations so I could easily get in but when we arrive the place was super dead and I was surprise actually. We sat on the patio area and it was relaxing, had awesome music as well. I didn't like the fact that I had to ask for silverware and I asked twice to have a booster seat for my child. They were very friendly though. I believe they are more known for there drinks rather then there food. The food was ok. I had a jerk chicken sandwich with asparagus. I had the pineapple drink which was amazing at least. They never came back to ask for refills or anything. I wasn't that impressed really I only gave stars because my drink was awesome. I will only go for drinks most likely and not food.

Happy Hour experience at the bar tonight - Ordered a Red Sangria which was 90% ice and 10% wine due to the wine glass being really small and filled to the rim with ice.  Noticed others were asking for light on the ice when ordering drinks.  A couple next to me complained about the drinks being all ice too.  People have obviously caught on.  They definitely rip you off on the drinks, even during happy hour.  Sangria was not part of happy hour so I paid $6 for a sangria that I finished in four sips.  Ordered the grilled chicken which was burnt and dry.  Overall a bad experience and never going back.

Read about your establishment on your news about racial profiling a group of black sororities. Calling the police on them and assuming some members of the party would not pay. Shame on you. That is a terrible way to be in 2018. You know nowadays of the repercussions of unnecessarily involving the police when dealing with minority ethnic groups in business establishments. Way to make yourselves look terrible. Will never eat here again.

loved their chicken wings!!!
coconut shrimp was yummy!


love the caribbean theme!--

I'm reviewing this place mostly for their amazing happy hour!

First of all it's a bahama themed restaurant for eating island favorites, tapas, and even drinking. I'm a big fan of their appetizers alone. During happy hour, all appetizers are half off so that's what my friends and I usually do. They also have a to-go menu for those on a tight schedule and wanna grab and go. 

This is to get an idea of their schedule:
Store Schedule // Sunday - Saturday: 11AM - 12AM
Happy Hour // Monday - Friday: 4PM - 6PM
Late Night Happy Hour // Sunday - Thursday: 9PM - 12AM

Happy Hour includes these appetizers to much on (and the portions are pretty big):
-Beef Empanadas
-Firecracker Shrimp
-Chicken Quesadilla
-Firecracker Shrimp Street Tacos 
-Pork Carnitas Street Tacos 
-Adobo Chicken Street Tacos 
-Lobster & Shrimp Quesadilla 
-Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp 
-Coconut Shrimp
-Jumbo Lump Crab Stack 
-Warm Spinach Dip and Chips 
-Jamaican Chicken Wings Tostones with Chicken 
-Crispy Onion Rings 
-Habanero Chicken Wings

SO MUCH VARIETY HONESTLY. GOOD PRICE FOR GREAT QUALITY!

The place is clean, especially their bathroom, and I've heard their drinks are pretty amazing (they also have hand-crafted drinks for happy hour).

I recommend this place if you're hungry at night and looking for something cheap for big amounts to fill you up! Also, just go to their happy hour!

3.5  Stars is A-OK.  I really enjoy coming here.  The service is pretty good, the staff has been really friendly.  Son that is always a huge plus.

The food is different from other local spots.  It has been really tasty.  The portions always seem small when it arrives, but still end up very full.

The drinks, alcoholic and non are always very well made and tasty.

My recommendation is the Jerk Chicken.  It is really good.

Used to be my favorite place.Quality and taste of food is horrible.I remember 5 years ago it was amazing.I used to have to ask them to make anything jerk not so spicy.Now it seems they don't use any seasoning.The jerk chicken was very bland and dry.Empanadas tasted microwaved and service is just not what it used to be.My favorite local place is now trash.

We just gave this restaurant a second chance this evening. 
It had been about three years since our last experience, be ause the food was mediocre at best and the service was poor. 

We hoped for a better experience and received what we hoped for.....but just barely. The food was still mediocre. The service was slightly better. They had pleasant entertainment. 
However, and sadly, it was not enough to bring us back again. 
Shame.  I did so like the outdoor dining porch.

4 stars because the drinks, customer service, and atmosphere are great. I would give the food 2.5-3 stars, though. It's really hit and miss. The food has really good flavor, but I think the ingredients are on the cheaper side. Drinks are seriously amazing though!

I came here for dinner with my friend and I had the best experience out there. The food was fantastic the crowd is lovely and F.J the manager made sure our food and experience turned out as expected . Our waitress Sarah was also very kind and helpful when it came down to explaining the menu. Over all I give this restaurant a 5/5 make sure to go in and check them out, guaranteed a wonderful experience and great food!

When this place first opened I probably would have given it 4-5 stars. The food was delish, service was excellent, and the had a bunch of good signature cocktails. Like alot of other places when they get popular, food, and service suffer. Went a couple days ago after not going for like 2 years and I just wasn't impressed with anything. Im mean it was still OK; but not as good as it used to be.

Ate here about a week or two ago and I got to say the food here is pretty good I had a party of 4 people with me and the service was exceptional they always came by to ask us if there was anything we needed they came by to give us refills each time and they were very friendly and courteous which made me feel really comfortable as for the food it was really good I had a couple of my friends appetizers and some of her dessert I also had the fried chicken sandwich and it was really delicious and I might think of trying it again overall I see myself coming back here as the atmosphere it really comfortable and I like the setting and the energy of the servers it is pretty pricey in my opinion but it is worth because the food taste that good.

We came with our three kids last night.  We had a great waitress (Jewel).  The one challenge we have going out with our kids are their allergies (several).  This is one of our main criteria evaluating places now.  This place was great addressing our kids issues.  The waitress was somewhat knowledgeable, but when she wasn't, she quickly grabbed a manager who answered our questions.  We finished ordering, and she came back five minutes later and told us that one of the items my daughter ordered did have Gluten.  We quickly changed that.

The overall food and prices were very reasonable for what we got.  We did have a manager stop by a couple times to see how we were doing.  

Now, it was a little loud and the food delivery was not really consistent.  I do agree with another reviewer that the front desk hostesses could be a little more pleasant, but overall, we did have a very good time at dinner.  We never tried this restaurant before and we have one in the city where we live, so we'll give that one a try soon.

But, in this one, our server made the evening great.

After hearing how great the happy hour is via yelp reviews, we decided to stop in. I had a free appetizer from the Yelp Elite event that was near expiring as well! The happy hour menu was definitely affordable and they had a wide variety of options. We got the nachos, chicken quesadilla and habanero wings. The chicken quesadilla was my top pick. I wanted to like the nachos more, but they were kind of cold and mushy :( and I was really looking forward to those! I only had a few chips before deciding that the calories were not worth the taste. Drinks were strong! Service started off bad (ignored for 15 minutes) but then redeemed when we were greeted by Josh. He was super attentive and checked on us often but not TOO often. He was also very sweet to take off the most expensive app whereas most people would take off the least expensive app.

Delicious food but this review is solely for the rum cake dessert. OMG, the tastiest and strongest butterscotch rum sauce (came w raisins) I've ever had. Thee best. Didn't even need to order a cocktail after. Amazing, ha. Mini bundt rum cake is delicious and moist as well - they might even inject it with a rum simple syrup after it's baked. YUM

Absolutely awful experience. Dined there back in April for my wifes birthday! Sent letter to their home office at that time.Never heard back from anyone. Upon dining our server Shannon was fantastic. Suggested a few drinks. We ordered bahamaritas and the island onion rings. This all came out great. We sat.at booth in the bar. I ordered.the island burger w fries. My wife ordered one of their bowls. I observed the fries sitting in a bowl for over 20 mi. A mgr appeared to be getting food out, however he looked confused and just walked away leaving the window full of food. Our food finally arrived about 30 min later. The fries were now ice cold and disgusting ...my burger was blackened char and tasted as.such. i ask for a mgr who arrives 10 min later. I show him my black hockey puck of a.burger. His reply "my bad" ??? No genuine apology only an offer of a bowl of soup??? All the while the GM is glaring at us from the kitchen ,never.to make contact with us.
Bahama Breeze Grilled Chicken, TO DIE FOR! So so good, and my boyfriend ALWAYS orders, Calypso Shimp Linguine....LOVE BAHAMA BREEZE MY FAVORITE!   VERY DELICIOUS!

I was so disappointed with both the food and service!   I ordered grilled halibut with mango sauce.  When it finally arrived it was no longer hot, and even with the sauce, it was so dry it was like eating a crunchy newspaper.  
The two other people with me ordered starter plates that sat in front of them long after they were finished.  Presumably this was when our order should have been put into the cook?
The waiter came to ask how our food was when one person had already finished and the other almost so.  I told him what was wrong and he offered to replace it, but it was too late.  : /  Sad to have not enjoyed my meal - but the company was GREAT!
Food is fairly average. Nothing special. Slow service. Took almost 30 mins to get our food on what looked like a slow day.

Did the happy hour which is cheap and appetizers was really good specially the avocado with shrimp and crab meat and mangoes delish!!!!!! We also ordered chicken wings with BBQ sauce dip, spinach and chips and shrimp poppers... and my favorite drink was Virgin Bahamaritas (strawberry and kiwi slush yum)
First time here for happy hour and got coconut shrimp and jumbo lump crab stack, soooo good! Definitely coming back for more Mon-Fri 4-6pm

I have been coming here on and off for years.  The menu seems to have changed but the one thing that has absolutely remained the same is their Mojito.  

The Mojito is made from fresh pressed sugar cane and it muddled to perfection.  THe standard comes with a light rum.  After your second or third start to experiment with some of the other rums...perhaps a dark one.

Great restaurant .. Amazing food and happy hour $3 -20oz beers ...Local place , great for your budget Dione our server was one of the best serve that I have had...if you want to eat and drink cheap this is a must ... Don't spend money on the strip go here it's well worth your money and it brings you to the Bahamas

We had a really good experience here for a networking happy hour during a recent conference! We were able to rent their deck space, which was very cute, and had really good service. The food and drinks were good too. Everyone in our group of 40 or so seemed to have a good time!

What a fun restaurant!!

We came here after we prepped all our models for a show and it was a fabulous place to eat.  It was more of a carribean type dining experience!

We asked to be seated outside since we smokers and their deck was still sort of indoors.  But airy enough for us to smoke.  There was live music playing, a bar in the deck area, and another deck for larger reservations/parties.  I was impressed on the decor already.  I'm a sucker for restaurants that are interesting to look at, sometimes I go with not so interesting people to eat. hehehe

Anyhooo...as soon as we sat, we were asked about drinks.  I ordered a mojito, but I should have gotten the Bahama Mama margarita...It looked dramatic as it tasted. DAMMIT!!! But nevertheless, my mojito was still delicious!!!

Apetizers:  Coconut shrimp....HOT AS HELL (temp wise) which meant it was freshly cooked!!! HMMMM to die for....

My plate:  Chicken Kabobs!!!  OH my god it was the best kabobs ever.  Chicken was cooked with red and green bell peppers, whole mushrooms, and red onions.  The kabobs were served over "island rice".  

SO GOOOD!! I toook it home to the hotel and saved it for the next nite!!!
Went here last night & I absolutely enjoyed the food and drinks! Friendly waiter as well

I visited Bahama Breeze with my boyfriend on August 24th. A friend of his recommended the spot to us. Since it was off the Vegas strip we were seated right away. Our waitress was Jaime. She was very attentive and polite. She had asked us if we had been there before so she could properly introduce us to the menu and even made a few suggestions. I ordered coffee and mentioned I was tired and Jaime frequently stopped by to check if I needed more coffee. 
I ordered their fish tacos with fries. I really enjoyed their spread for the tacos it had a nice zing to it. The entree came with 3 tacos so it is a large serving. My boyfriend order the chicken and mashed sweet potatoes. YUM!
The restaurant is huge. Tall ceilings and lots of sectioned off seating areas with different decor, which made it visually appealing. There was lots of seating in the hostess area as well. I thought the wooden beach chairs were a nice touch.
I would definitely return to this establishment.

Items selected:

- Key West Fish Tacos
- Island Hopper: Jamaican chicken wings, conch fritters, coconut shrimps, onion rings

While the food quality met our minimum expectation, cleanliness fell short. Our server was throwing her towel to the table and sprayed the cleanser from a distance, the vaporized mist almost got to my table... The floor and the seat was not clean either.

And no wonder, they got shut down by the SNHD right after our visit.

http://vegas.eater.com/2014/9/5/6159951/bahama-breeze-suffers-an-imminent-health-hazard

Gross.

Another great meal at Bahama Breeze!  Stopped in with my family to have lunch and as usual, everything was just Great!  Nachos on point, Margaritas Amazing, Seafood Chowder hit the spot, and the Steak was great, love the sauce!  The service is always good there, and I love the decor!

Super disappointed with our experience here. When we were sat down we waited for a long time to for the waiter to come to our table. When he did show up we ordered 2 sodas but never received any water. The sodas took forever as well and when we finally got them they were watered down and Flat. We ordered an appetizer and when they brought it to the table they just dropped it off without even paying attention we didn't have any silverware or plates. More waiting finally I just got up and got silverware from another table and went hunting for a waiter to bring plates so we could eat our food. By that time I was over the entire experience and just wanted to eat and go home.

I think Olive Garden could have made a better fish taco. One ounce of cold white fish tucked into a stale flour tortilla with some cabbage. Nope! The second star is for the tortilla soup I got before the tacos, that was pretty delish. Normally I try to give a place the benefit of the doubt but my dining mates described their dishes as "this doesn't do rice a roni justice" and "seems like boiled salad." Sorry Bahama Breeze, step it up!
Meh. Got the shrimp linguine. The servings were large, but nothing had much flavor and it wasn't the best value
Good food, Good service, Great environment and Fair Prices. Last minute reservation and they were still able to get us a table for our party of 11.

I'm a huge fan of their happy hours special! Of course, their food is not as fresh as you think, but if you're craving a better option than Wendys or McDonalds, then this place isn't as bad. You have to be careful as well, I got my entree plate half-way done. How could you cook chicken half-way done? The manager on-site apologized for the mistake and comped the meal, however I wish they didn't make that mistake, so I could've enjoyed my meal. Will try my better luck next time.
This place reminded me of Yard House.  Similar food items.  We had the wings, beef empanadas, shrimp quesadilla, and the ahi.  The ahi was the most tasty thing.

I have visited Bahama Breeze a lot over the years. I have had varying levels of service and food qualify, but it has always been corrected if I had an issue and I have had more good experiences than bad. My favorite dish is the buttermilk fried chicken breast. I also like the onion rings and their dipping sauce is great. When I'm not ordering the fried chicken breast, I like the chipotle beef bowl. Their drink menu is great and I recommend the Zombie and the Painkiller.

even thou BB is a chain eatery  really like the food. i try to visit when in LV and really enjoy the food and service. all the appetizers are very good and if visit during HH are worth the money for sure. plenty of beer, wine etc buy i like the Bahamarita. 1 more tip........ ask for CHRISTINE  to be ur server. she has served us several times and is always friendly, helpful and a JOY to be around while in LV and the BB.

I came to this restaurant during a family reunion.  I knew that we were a large group and I knew that it may take a bit longer but the time that it took for my drinks and my food to arrive was just ridiculous and we were the last table to be served when we were the first to have our order taken.  This is not the kind of service that I would wish for anyone and there would be no recommendation give to anyone ever

It's so lovely here!!!! The inside is beautiful. Came here for the first time with a friend on Cinco De Mayo and I will say it felt very tropical here. We got there during happy hour so all appetizers were half off and the regular margaritas were $5. Everything was delicious. We ordered the nachos and the jerk chicken wings. Everything was enjoyable and had much flavor. 
The bad news was as we were paying for our check, the couple in the booth behind us frantically got up stating there was a huge flying roach on the window seal. I didn't stay long enough to see it. My friend and I both got up and paid our check in the front of the restaurant.
Looking for a light lunch and found the lobster shrimp quesidilla on the appetizer menu. Tasty!

I've come here during Happy Hour twice now and will continue to come back for the great food, wonderful drinks, and quality service. This is the only Bahama Breeze in Pittsburgh (I believe the next closest one is in King of Prussia) so it doesn't feel like a chain to me. My favorite drink is the Yaka Hula Hickey Dula featuring rum, Reisling and pineapple juice. So good! I recently tried the Skillet-Simmered Jerk Shrimp which was AMAZING! The shrimp is served in a mini skillet in a wonderful juice blend of thyme, garlic, and veggies with a mini loaf of Cuban bread to dip into the skillet juice. This is one of the best dishes I ever had!

You can either eat indoors or outdoors. On a beautiful day, I definitely choose the outdoors. The only thing that would make the scenery ideal is a real ocean breeze and ocean to hear and overlook as you dine.
Best food since we have been in Vegas. Family friendly, affordable.  Very friendly service.   The coconut shrimp was to die for.   The coconut shrimp tacos blew my mind.

Came here for lunch on Sunday & Monday (2/13 & 2/14)

I absolutely love this place.

I think I love the service more than ever. They have the best friendliest staff ever! (I know I sounded like a little kid over exaggerating) But, honest to God. You cannot find that type of service in LA.

This is like my favorite lunch spot in Vegas.

The plates are a hit and miss. Depends on what you order and if you know what you're ordering. 

Good luck and enjoy the good food. Cause there sure aren't any in LA.

*Get the cilantro cream sauce for dipping its grrrrrrrrrrrrreat!*

I've always loved Bahama Breeze and this location is no exception.  The coconut shrimp and seafood chowder soup is my favorite.  The fish tacos looked awesome and is on my list for next time.  The service was friendly and quick too.  Love the tropical drinks especially the painkiller and coconut mojito.

Eh, I've had a lot better food at other chain restaurants in the area.  See, the problem here is that all of the food is simply reheated rather than cooked on location.  I asked that they hold the zucchini on my veggie sandwich at lunch- the server said they couldn't because it is what comes in the bag.  Now, I know that a lot of chain restaurants get their food delivered in bags, but don't tell me about it.  Just say that it is premixed or something.  Keep me in my ignorant bliss for just a few minutes.

But, that does speak volumes about the wait staff.  They are never very good at this location.  When you sit at the bar during lunch, you can hear them all complaining about everything from customers to the manager.  

For the price, you can do much better in the area- there's about 100 restaurants within 5 miles of this joint.

I've come to this restaurant several times and have always received very good service and food in a good environment. My last visit was on a Wednesday night at about 930-10pm. We were greeted and seated well. 

Then came the most flamboyant black male waiter ever. For some reason he completely lost it when I inquired about the chicken quesadilla. He told me they weren't that good and I still decided to try them. He then, while rolling his eyes, said," so you're going to try something and then send it back if you don't like it, AFTER I just told you it's not that good?" I replied,"yes!" 

So the food was bought to the table and the food was freshly cook, and quesadilla was good. There were two male waiters that for some reason were extra loud and at times inappropriate. For example this waiter at my table continued to make it obvious that he was addressing my girlfriend alone, right from the moment he first approached the table. 

At some point, I'll return to the restaurant but they lost points with me. We were having a great night and this experience with the waiter messed the vibe up, completely.
It's like a trip to the Bahamas but a lot cheaper and quicker. Our favorite restaurant in greater Pittsburgh

My Island oasis in the middle of Sin City.  We come here every time we come to Vegas.  I know you have no clue who "we" are.... but my whole family.  We plan where we are going to stay, club and when we are going to eat at Bahama Breeze.

Let's start with the Cons.... there isn't a location in Southern California.  Then again, id probably spend my rent money eating there all the time.  

The Service: Is always wonderful. Haven't had a bad experience yet.  The staff is always helpful and pleasant.  So cheers to them!

The Atmosphere: Wonderful!  For someone who has been to the "islands" this place is a good representation.  From the ceiling fans to the music being played.  Not loud, but mellow music.  Helps the food go down better... screw the sugar.

The Food:  OMG! Even if everything else was horrible the Food is so good you'd ignore it.

Jerk Chicken- my mouth is watering just thinking of them.  They have the perfect amount of jerk flavoring and are fried or baked to perfection.  Crispy on the outside but tender and juicy on the inside.  We made a mistake of sharing an order. Bad idea.  These are too good to share.

Beef Patties- Yummy! If flavor and good food aren't you thing... steer clear of this option. Truly a mouth satisfying appetizer.

Seafood Paella-So I have had Paella at a number of locations and this is one of the best.  The whole dish is a burst of happiness in your mouth.  I've had this 2 of the last 3 times I went here.  Everything else just doesn't seem to catch my eye.....

Always too full for dessert..... maybe next time.

Great drinks, Servers are polite and well informed. The food is average-great, depending what is ordered.  Have seldom had anything that disappointed.  I don;t recall ever saying to my friends - "That was FABULOUS!!"  It's a fun place to meet friends, yet quite noisy at certain times of the day.  I DO always feel like I am on VACA in the Caribbean when I am there.  WONDERFUL ambiance!

This place rocks! The service is fast, the food is delicious ~ try the jerk wings :)
The drinks are tasty.. we have never had bad service or meal coming here. The atmosphere is awesome!
Waited over 30 minutes for meal, waiter was always within five feet of us (seemed creepy) and they don't even have tarter sauce! How do you serve fish and not have tarter sauce?!

I normally don't love chains but didn't have much choice coming into Pittsburgh late. The food was fantastic. Very flavorful and fresh.
They don't actually take reservations but they put you on a running list "in case." Didn't really get that but we didn't wait anyway at 830pm. 
Service was very polite and helpful. 
We started with the baked goat cheese appetizer stuffed into bell peppers with crostini. Unbelievable! I had the Chicken Santiago which was also very good and my colleague had the almond-crusted mahi mahi special with mashed sweet potatoes. Very fresh and perfectly cooked.
If I'm in the area again I will probably go back.

Thank you EARL.... we went out for a 6 person work dinner/drinks and he killed it with service. Theres not a lot of wait staff in the area thats good. We loved him!!!! He also seperated our checks and we didnt have to wait to long for our drinks!!!
Haven't been here for years. Don't know why we've waited so long to come back. Great menu and great atmosphere. Prompt and friendly service. Outdoor seating with this weather is perfect.
The place is HUGE inside!!!  The food was really good... the firecracker shrimp were my favorite for the night... only downfall, the service was just a little slow!
Operated by racists.  Don't eat here while black.  Better yet don't go here at all.

I'm a Caribbean girl that cannot get enough of sweet Bahama Breeze. I always make an extra effort, to dine in here when I visit Vegas. Another 5 Star visit on a warm Saturday night. I made a reservation a couple days ahead, for myself and a few of my girlfriends. I was just a little disappointed that they didn't have the Reggae band playing. 

Overall the service was outstanding. Our waiter was very attentive & efficient. 
Now to the delicious food.
Here's what we opted for:
Taste of Jamaica - 
Awesome jerk pork, jerk chicken, beef empanada, callaloo, sweet plantains, white rice and black beans. Respek the flavor. Love, loved it. 
My very favorite is the Lobster & Shrimp quesadillas. This is a must try. There's no other like it. Two thumbs up!
Caribbean style lobster Mac&Cheese - 
Lightly fried lobster tail with Bahamian mac & cheese. AMAZING! 

Drinks
Goombay Smash - very strong but good. 
Yaka Hula - Bacardi Black Rum, pineapple juice for a tropical tribute to Island romance. This sweet cocktail was inspired by a Hawaiian love song. Excellent drink. One of my favorites.
Pineapple Coconut martini- This is one Sexy drink. Loved it.

My fellow yelpers, I would not steer you wrong, if you're tired of buffet food, fancy expensive hotel dining, come to Bahama Breeze. Prices are very reasonable. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. I will always be a returning customer.

Although I've only been to Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas once, I've been plenty of times in Jacksonville Florida when I used to live there, even celebrated my birthday there. So I think due time for a review.

This restaurant is actually one of my favorite places to dine; it's not "fine" dining, but it's not cheap casual. It's a nice in between kinda place, affordable but definitely appropriate for special occasions 

They have awesome fruity speciality drinks but also a full bar so your dark liquors as well and standard type drinks. They have HH from 9pm-close Sunday thru Thursday which is great for Vegas! Love reserve HH!! And their HH includes food items as well. 

This BB is way bigger here in Vegas than the one in Jacksonville. Bigger restaurant means bigger decor and displays inside. Pretty standard dim lighting and Caribbean decor. We came on a Friday and surprisingly it was not busy at all. They had a small dj at the outside patio playing hip hop music that did not seem to fit the theme for the restaurant but the inside music was more fitting and appropriate to the island theme. 

They have a wide variety menu all incorporating an island type theme and taste, but I love how their menu is separated and really makes selection an easy task. 

I'm a sucker for their establishment favorite the Coconut Shrimp. I think I get it every time as an appetizer! The crispy coconut batter on the butterfly shrimps are fried to perfection and that citrus mustard dipping sauce is almost like a marmalade glaze. Not too sweet tho and that mustard almost like a Dijon flavor gives it a nice kick! Definitely one of my fav dishes here. 

My family was having seafood this night (we refrain from meat on Fridays during Lent) and this place has lots of seafood options, well lots of options period. We had the Key West Shrimp and Grits, Calypso Shrimp Linguine, the Fish Tacos, and the Island Hopper (it comes with jerk chicken but we just saved it to bring home). 

The shrimp and grits was good, but I wish there was more grits that came with the dish. But the garlic light cream sauce on the shrimp was good and not too heavy, just right. The green beans at accompanied the dish were good, just needed a dab on pepper. 

The calypso shrimp linguine was the best tasting of the 4 main dishes we ordered. My sisters dish so I can only comment on that I tried a little bit of it, but it was enough and tasted good enough that when I go back I want that to be my order!! It's like a light pink sorta sauce, white cream sauce but with the Caribbean flavors and spices it turns it sorta pink ish. Every good and sauce was not too heavy at all. 

My dad had fish tacos accompanied by fries and guacamole. The guc was really good but the tacos shells were a bit too hard. 

The island hopper actually is listed as an appetizer, but mom got it as a main entreè.  Comes with coconut shrimp, coconut batter covered onion rings, shrimp stuffed hush puppies and jerk chicken. The onion rings were good and the coconut batter adds a nice twist of flavor. The hush puppies also very good. I like that they were not too dense, and nice a light almost fluffy. The dish also comes with the citrus mustard and a pineapple chutney - which also tasted like a sweet with a kick pineapple marmalade or glaze!! You can eat the chutney straight, it's so yummy. 

Also the bathrooms are big and nice and I like how the have little mouthwash cups and mouthwash available at the sink so if you're going out straight after dinner, that least you good on the breath check 

The place is a chain restaurant, so you get what you expect, but it's great food, reasonable pricing, appropriate for special occasions but not going to blow your wallet like if you were to eat somewhere on strip in Las Vegas and probably get less quantity. It's a good vibes sorta place and the service is good!! S/O to our server Matt for taking good care of us!! 

Solid good dining restaurant and I will be back! Yay
This was an amazing restaurant. The jerk chicken was as close to authentic as you can get. The empanadas were delicious as well. Fun environment. Cute setting. Definitely a great place to eat!

I wish i could give this a better review.   

Went here while in town, and because my boss was staying at the hotel next to it and was curious to what it was. 

There was an NBA playoff game that night, so we went in with the hopes of sitting at the bar and watching the game.   Not that every restaurant needs to have tv's, but hey, if you have them....  great.

We sat at the bar, and the game was on, the smallest TV i have ever seen at a bar.  It was about the size of the security monitors some place off on their park ling lots.  So, needless to say, we could see little, tiny guys running around but never could see the score.  

The server was super friendly, but they were super inattentive.  Our food was just ok, nothing to write home about.   I guess we were pushing closing time, because they started mopping behind the bar with that smelly mop water while we were still eating.    Then we had to wait -- the longest wait-- was trying to get our check and pay to be able to leave. 

Not sure if I'd come here again. Unremarkable.  Not what I remember from my youth..

Came here for dinner on Saturday night.  Easy to get a table and the service was perfect, never felt rushed and never waited for a refill or a dirty plate to be taken away.  Food was delicious and the margarita was the best I have had in quite awhile.

Extremely disappointing and at the same time hard to believe this place has a rating as high as 3.5 stars. After eating here I have to believe nobody involved with this restaurant has ever eaten Caribbean food. Myself having spent 3 years living in South Florida, eating at small, authentic, family owned restaurants (and eating authentic homemade Carribbean food) I have to say there was nothing remotely authentic with the food I received. I could go on but I won't, just save your money and your stomach and avoid this place.

Loved the experience of dining here! 

Food: We ordered a variety of dishes, including the nachos without beef, chicken quesadilla, and my personal favorite - the jackfruit tacos. Personally I found the chicken quesadilla a bit dry. However, the jackfruit tacos were mind blowing and very unique. They came with a side dish, so we chose the black bean soup which was better than most I've tasted elsewhere. Their drinks menu was also really impressive - I want to come back here to try the margarita flight, which includes a hibiscus margarita and tamarind margarita. 

Service: Our server was Earl, and he was very attentive, polite, and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised with the service we received, even during peak weekend hours.

The first time I went here I thought it was amazing. The second time not so much, it could be due to the fact that my mom was vomiting in her napkin(alcoholic) and it just killed it. It just didn't seem to deliver like i remembered. Not sure I'll be back.

This is now one of my favorite places to eat in vegas.. I have eaten here dozens of times.  They have amazing drinks, and their food is like none other.  Unique, flavorful and just WOW. We have eaten at various times of day, and have always had A+ service and food. You MUST go there.. Love their Bahama Magarite with a sweet shot on the side.  The bread pudding was so good and love their specials..
I always get the Caribbean jerk chicken pasta.  I love it ! YUM

This past weekend we tried to attend a birthday party down the street at Paladar but due to poor management there, we found ourselves not receiving service or locating an empty seat so we headed down the street to Bahama Breeze.  The manager quickly welcomed our group of nearly 20 with open arms and fast service for drinks, appetizers and desserts.  He was a big part of the reason that our night was salvaged.  Thanks so much, guys!
My favorite place to eat and drink .Been there a few time and never had a bad experience bar tenders and waiters are very friendly.and the drinks are amazing!

Service was great, food was great and not very expensive, atmosphere was very nice. The only downside was the drinks were a little pricey which considering its Vegas, probably very common. We came on a Friday night at 630pm and had no wait. Definitely worth coming
My favorite happy hour in Las Vegas. Half off appetizers and $4 cocktails. The Ultimate Pina Coloda is my fave its so refreshing. The jerk chicken wings are a must try.

I have always enjoyed the food here but today's experience is not good.  My group has now been here for two hours and we still don't have our food.  We have a group of 11.  When we got here the restaurant was only about 1/2 full but we were told that it was a 45 minute wait.  They seated us after about 40 minutes but now on over an hour later we still don't have our food and the natives are getting restless.

If you wanna feel like you're on vacation come here! Tropical drinks, amazing food, & atmosphere that makes you think you're eating on an island. I'd recommend to everyone! This place is huge & the layout is awesome. Also good service.

What's not to love about this place?! We got a tip while around town that if you want to try an amazing pina colada, go to Bahama Breeze. We went over obviously with high expectations and we were not let down whatsoever. 

I would like to mention that the service here is phenomenal. Our waitress, Tina, was probably one of the nicest waitresses I have had in along time. She was personable, she would talk and joke with us and just super nice. I have no complaints about service at all. 

The atmosphere in this place is pretty rad as well. There was live music, a little covered deck with a fire pit, and a lot of cool decorations that made for a great environment. This place is mainly a seafood restaurant, so if that's not your thing then this place probably isn't for you. I'm a huge seafood fan so I loved it. 

Last of all, the sought after pina colada that we were searching town for were hands down the best I've ever had! There was more to it than just your average pina colada, it was called the "ultimate pina colada" for a reason. Me and my girlfriend both were very impressed with it. We weren't too hungry so we just got some street tacos to shared and they were great as well.

We sat and hung out at this place and just talked for a while because it was such a great environment to just relax and have a great time. 
If you're in Vegas,  GO TO THE BAHAMA BREEZE! You will not be disappointed.

The atmosphere is nice and the food was good. My wife and I had the center cut steak   Medium well) with mashed potatoes and green beans. My steak was cooked great but my wife's steak was cooked medium. The staff was great and re-cooked it just right and quickly, though both could of used more flavor. We had jerk chicken for an appetizer that was pretty good and filling. Overall a good dinner out.

Love the jerk chicken pasta and fresh lemonade!!! That's a must have with any meal. Food is always good and customer service is great! Always a nice treat for the family, especially when you have small kids since it's kid friendly. Always nice to have dinner in the outdoor patio area. Oh and make sure you attend happy hour!!!! Yummy!!!! Definitely a favorite spot.

We decided to avoid the craziness of the strip & come here for dinner last night, thinking it would be less busy. It was a lot less busy but very understaffed. We had to wait almost 40 min for a table for 4 at an almost empty restaurant. We were seated at around 10:30 pm. 

To be fair - the food was not bad. What was most upsetting is that I ordered the rice bowl with shrimp & fish. A few bites in, I bit into something hard. I thought it was a fish bone but it was a sharp jagged piece of a plastic - probably the remnants of a food container about an inch long and wide. I told the server & she asked if I wanted my dish replaced and I said no as I did not want to wait for another plate at that time of night as our kids were very tired. She showed the plastic object to her manager & I was waiting to see what he/she would say or do. Well the disappointing outcome is they did nothing. No apology from the manager & we got charged for my dish. Very disappointing.  

This is not the first time we have found unwelcome objects in our food at restaurants. In fact once at BJ's my sons Mac & Cheese had the corner of a plastic bag in it but we did not say anything as it was large enough to see & not harmful. The sever saw it as she collected the plates & reported it to the manager. She came to our table to apologize & said we would not be charged for the dish. 

So to the manager of the Bahama Breeze - your management skills need some fine tuning to say the least. Your food quality control obviously needs some work. It's not OK to find sharp plastic objects in our food & it's especially not OK for you to ignore it. Very disappointing.

It almost felt like I wasn't in the chain-ey burbs of Pittsburgh when I sat on the deck! 

Definitely a new stable in my restaurant routine.  

Pros: Fresh Fish, summery drink list, outdoor seating 

Cons: Cheesy uniforms 

I will be back!

The extra star is for our excellent service-
To be honest the food was "alright". 
Alexis was very personable and informative. I was so pleased to have observed her equally attentive and welcoming service to all customers. My husband and I often go out and its rare and rewarding to get great service. Thank you.

Great layout, music, etc; relaxing atmosphere. 

I was in Vegas for a work convention (exciting, I know) and on the way to the airport, for the last couple of hours, I wanted something quick and easy... but relaxing.  My local friends wanted to meet here for Happy Hour.  

I got here around 4:30 on a Monday.  I really love being able to just park and walk up in Vegas. Eating on the strip is a whole process of parking and walking through casinos... that's like a wasted 20 minutes there, another 20 back.  A place like this, nice and easy.  

The layout is great.  It goes for a Caribbean/Cuban feel, especially outside, without feeling cheesy.  Nice shutters on the enclosed patio area, warm air coming in, sunny... just a very relaxed atmosphere where you really don't feel like you're in Vegas.  I felt like I was on vacation, actually, which sounds cheesy but it's true.  The restaurant was pretty open, though, but it was a weekday.  

Now, the food...

Happy Hour is an amazing deal.  It's like $5-something per dish and beers and drinks are from $2-$3....!?  What... the... hell!  So good.   

We were starving so we got almost one of everything; the jerk chicken, pork sliders, burger sliders, empandas, quesadilla, coconut shrimp, etc.  Everything was great.  My friends were a little hesitant about the jerk chicken because it was black, due to the rub, but it was great.   My friends had a pineapple coconut martini (great), mojito (they loved it, had real sugar cane), I had a hefeweizen.   

So basically, you can't miss at Happy Hour - everything was great.

This is a small detail that I really appreciate. In the men's bathroom, they have mouthwash dispensers. It's a great touch because, let's be honest, your breath after eating isn't going to be the best so this is a great way to hit the reset button. 

It was just a fun, casual experience... it really felt like we weren't in Vegas, but on vacation.

Delicious shrimp and Mahi, vegetables,sweet peas and yellow rice- combined in one perfect mix, just the right Jamaican spices! Delicious mojitos and exotic island drinks make for a perfect touch with sesame crusted Ahi tuna!! the Jerk chicken is scrumptious.  The Lobster and shrimp quesadilla should not be missed- enjoy the island music, the superb service and the island ambience!! Special thank you to Brandon and Dan for making our dinner extra special. Happy hour is great and the fire pit always adds to the perfect island setting.

Went on a Sunday for lunch and it was pretty good. Had the sirloin and it was fine. Had the ultimate pineapple drink and it was on point. Service was good and restaurant seemed to have a pretty laid back atmosphere. All the food we ordered was pretty good, would recommend to others and go back.

Great place. We've been here before. As we arrived and were seated we spent about 5 minutes without a greeting or drinks. I was a little upset but the manager took notice and made everything great. She took care of us immediately. Offered 2 appetizers on the house and turned us over to a great server. The rest of the meal was perfect. The Mahi Mahi was cooked as it should. Environment is lively and inviting. Great dinner. Thank you
#JerkWings..#HappyHour..Great food and service was on point as well..Must stop by if you are staying in the area.

Happy hours prices are VERY good, but sit at the bar.  I don't know if my waiter was new or what but service was very slow.  Never came by to check if we needed more drinks.  Only stayed for one round and appetizers.  Food was pretty bland but cheap.  Probably won't be back.

If you like piña coladas and getting caught in the rain, this is your spot especially during happy hour!! My friend took me here since we both were craving for refreshing piña coladas. Happy hour deals are great. We came in at 5 and the restaurant wasn't so busy so we got seated right away. Our waitress took our orders and was very enthusiastic. The only thing was that she didn't commit to her promises. When she asked if we wanted lemon with our water, she did not provide the lemon. And many times she visited our table of empty cups, she did not quickly respond to refill them. Other than that, food and drinks were bomb and I also really like the set up of the restaurant. It's nicely jungle/exotic themed and they also offer patio seating for lovely fresh air! Will be back for more

This place is a total joke. Our server was an absolute jerk who refused to give us menus because we sat down in the bar table area without getting menus from the dimwitted hostess. Then he went off on a tangent about how there was a miscommunication and we should not have been seated without menus. He is the definition of a low wage uneducated worker. So then i go to the bar and tell the bartender i want two drinks for me and my date (who looked better in her photos ) and he says he will let our server know because im in his section. I go off on the dude because i just want to get two drinks and carry them the 2 feet from the bar to the table right behind me, but he refused to do this cause it wasn't fair to the server. What a bunch of degenerates at this chain hell. The manager came over and eventually offered to buy me 2 drinks, but hell no because he defended his erver. Ended up walking out on my ugly date, who was sitting at the table wondering what the hell she should do and also this Bahama Breeze forever. Letter to corporate also sent, but a canned response was received. Punks.

We went here for dinner on 8.12.15 and had a great experience. Our server Tina and her team were very attentive and the food was delicious. Happy hour is good because you don't have to be just in the bar to take advantage of the reduced rate. We have been here several times when visiting Vegas, I wish the restaurant was close to home in California.
