Every once in a while I get a craving for jerk chicken pasta, which leads me right back to Bahama Breeze, so I was pleased when my group decided to go there last night.  I've never been disappointed with that dish, so it's my go-to, but I've also had the Cuban sandwich, the tilapia entree, the habanero wings, the goat cheese appetizer and these haven't disappointed me either.  I can't say that Bahama Breeze is absolutely amazing, which is why it won't get 5 stars from me, but for a chain restaurant I am impressed with the consistent quality and service that I receive there.  If you are in Robinson and craving some island fare head to Bahama Breeze and you should not be disappointed.  Oh, I almost forgot, and this may be unique to the Bahama Breeze in Robinson, but any time I've gone they have a live musician playing  Caribbean style music, which adds to the background quite nicely.
The ribs were burnt but the music outside was cool.. The bartender was very nice. The place is very clean. I lost my id there but overall the place was okau

I brought my husband here for a date and boy did we enjoy ourselves. The waitress was very very helpful and recommended some good ideas for us to try (it was our first time). The place was set up very nice and I love the little scenery they have inside and outside. The food was delicious and served in very generous amounts. I highly recommend you trying the Pineapple-Coconut Martini it's to die for!

Had a great experience at happy hour except for one thing.  The waitress up sold the group into having our piña coladas in hallowed out pineapples.  But she failed to mention it cost $8 more.  Guess caveat emptor right???  But we all felt she should have mentioned the additional cost as we were ordering off the happy hour menu.  Other than that great service and ambiance the apps were all tasty the jerk chicken wings especially phenomenal

First time that we have eaten at a Bahama Breeze.  My husband and I were traveling to Nashville and spent a night in Cleveland.  Since the restaurant was close to our hotel, we decided to eat there.

We were a bit skeptical since we knew that Bahama Breeze was a chain restaurant operated by the Darren Group.  However, we were pleasantly surprised but the high quality of the food and the freshness of the ingredients.  We liked it so much, that we returned on our way back home a week later.

Drove by this place a million times... finally decided to come in and check it out. Neat vibe. Great drinks and a wonderful happy hour! Had a frozen bahamita and an ultimate pina colada. Like the colada better. Bartender was Jesse and he was excellent... helped me maneuver through the menu. Very helpful!!! Tried the key lime pie and it was great. Also tried the jerk wings... interesting taste that finished wonderfully. I am a very picky Mac and Cheese guy... so that one did not ring my bell. Will definitely bring back friends and family when they are in town!!!

Love love love this place! I will definitely recommend this place to everyone. The food was excellent and the waiter was great. My pina colada was one of the best I've ever had, I will definitely be back.

Walking into this place gives you a relax feeling of being on the beach. Customer service was real good from our server. Took a little long for our food to come out and it wasn't layered with Apps first then meal. Other than that service was solid. I had the Habanero wings and firecracker shrimp to start and both were delicious. Followed it with the Cuban Sandwich. The sandwich was good but tasted a bit bland for my taste. Once I asked for the extra mustard it was good. I would definitely come back when I am in Vegas. I do recommend you stop by and have try!!

I can't even say how many times I've been here with family, co workers or my boyfriend. Honestly just amazing food with a lot of flavor. Best time to go is any time they have a happy hour that you can't wait to run off to. There special Bahama drink are delicious you will probably order 5 of them from how good they are. The fire shrimp are bomb. And lobster shrimp quesadilla are dam near filled with gooey deliciousness. You won't be sorry you came

I was born and raised in Vegas so whenever I come back to visit I have to come to this place. They need to open up a restaurant in Arizona. My favorite meal is from here and it's a must try, the salmon tostada. The portion is huge, the salmon is perfectly cooked, and the dressing is to die for. Another favorite is the habanero wings, you get a ton of wings since it's an appetizer and the sauce is sweet and spicy. The cocktails are great here and the happy hour deals are wonderful! The service is always great, everyone is so friendly we haven't had a bad server yet. My mom and I come at least every two weeks, sometimes once a week.

After getting a couple of kid free hours to get my son's birthday shopping done I needed a bite to eat. My man suggested Bahama Breeze because he was in the mood for fish. I was just hungry and didn't care so off we went. 

Joanna was our server and she was lovely. I would definitely give her 4 our of 5 stars. We started with the Coconut shrimp (which is my man's favorite). It was good but I don't love it like he does. Something about fried coconut flakes just doesn't do it for me...to each his own. I ordered the lobster/shrimp quesadilla with a bowl of the seafood chowder. My quesadilla was fine but nothing to write home about...it could have used some hot sauce. The soup, however, was phenomenal. It was like a crab/shrimp chowder with little fried shrimp on top. It was creamy, smooth, not too salty and hearty enough. It was rich so I couldn't finish it all. My man was a fan and took the rest home for a late night snack. 

Overall an A-OK experience. I will be back if I think about it.

Bar/drinks review only. Great happy hour prices. I like the Aruba Red (beer) which is only at Bahama Breeze. I haven't had the food in a long time just because I tend to opt for healthier choices at other places, and I can't remember it well enough to write any opinion on it. I love to stop here for a drink from time to time.

Awesome food, excellent customer service.  Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helped me make a great decision.  I enjoyed talking sports with him...even though he is a 49er fan...lol.  Thanks for a wonderful lunch experience!

This place is pretty generic. There's nothing particularly bad about it but there is nothing great about it in any way. Generic food, not slow but not fast service, servers are "ok". I did not leave upset or anything but nothing here impressed me or wowed me enough to entice me into a return trip.

I came here with my fiancé and had Anita as our waitress...she said was amazing! Funny, engaging, genuinely sweet and knowledgeable!
We tried her recommendations of the lobster quesadillas, jerk chicken pasta, fire cracker shrimp, shrimp and lobster linguini and the ultimate pineapple drink and needless to say when my fiancé and I need a break from La and find ourselves in Vegas we will definitely be back! If you find yourself at Bahama breeze ask for Anita, It'll enhance your experience.

With its close proximity to the university, my classmates and I often swing by for their happy hour that goes from 4-6 pm. (Apparently there is also a reverse happy hour that happens 9-close!) We LOVE it.

With its tropical, breezy, just-sitting-out-on-the-veranda ambience, their specialty drinks are matched to boot. We usually indulge in these $4 perfectly garnished and charming cocktails. Ultimate Pina Colada, Bahamarita, Mojito Cubano, Pineapple Coconut Martini. (I've tried them all except the sangria and margarita on the rocks.) They're so pretty that you'll want to bust out your phone and be that person at the table. You know, *that* person.

If this doesn't suit your fancy, they also offer select beers for $2-$3, wines $2 off, and the standard mixed spirits for $3. 

Appetizers are half-off and are consistent with the quality of their drinks - flavorful, garnished appropriately, infused and influenced with its caribbean namesake. They offer a wide variety, so all mouths are sure to find something to pique their taste buds. The coconut shrimp seems to be a popular choice, but I recommend the beef empanadas, which is what I ordered on a recent visit. 

Round up your friends, relax and take a breather at "Bahama Breeze." Totally worth it.

I am staying at the Residence Inn right behind this establishment.  My roommate and I were hungry but did not want to venture off too far.  We went here and were blown away.  Not only was the service great, thanks to Luis and Jason behind the bar, but the food was AMAZING!  We got there at exactly 9 p.m. and that is when they begin their happy hour.  I had the jumbo crab lump and shrimp tacos, followed by a mojito.  The next evening, I returned.  I had three of their Aruba Red beer and that was delicious.  To eat, I had the jumbo lump crab and the empanadas.  I was not disappointed!  Great place, music, ambience...it has it all.

My wife and I had been to three Bahama Breeze locations: Raleigh, Seattle, and Las Vegas. We  revisited the Las Vegas location yesterday. 

The first thing we order, directly after the drinks, is the beef empanadas. Just as they were at every other location, they are unmatched and delicious! We went at lunch time for the first time at any location hoping to get a variation on the menu. We were pleasantly surprised. We got the lobster quesadilla combo with a caesar salad. The caesar had slightly too much dressing incorporated into the salad, but the amount of lobster and shrimp packed into the quesadillas made up for that minor hiccup. Great food and atmosphere as usual. Special thanks to the host staff at the front who were very hospitable!

Very good food selection and a very laid back atmosphere. Does give the feeling of being in the islands. Prices are in line for the casual atmosphere. The wait staff and hostess are very helpful and pleasant.
LOVE the beachy island vibe here! Live reggae band on saturdays & they aren't just ok, they are amazing!!! The delicious cocktails are just 7.99! We got appetizers & salads, everything was yummy!

Located a little south of the strip but a true hidden gem. The prices were reasonable. We went during lunch. The Cuban sandwich was delicious. The house salad was amazing. My sister recommends the beef empanadas. Coconut shrimp were cooked to perfection. The drinks...they were amazing. Very tropical and fruity and you cannot taste the alcohol. Indoor and patio seating. It was great to be able to enjoy the warm weather. This will be a place we definitely will be coming back to and sharing with our friends.

Cool place to hang out with the family ... Especially if I'm picking up the tab! The place makes you feel like you've escaped to the Caribbean.
Cool thing is they have live reggae music at night.

nice atmosphere but our server wasnt the best at her job. She kept looking at me and asking for my id and my husband had it our drinks were good but took forever food was was excellant ill go back but would like another server who loves her job

This Caribbean restaurant has been a staple at the corner of Flamingo and Paradise forever it seems.  They consistently serve good food.  I really like their jerk chicken pasta and their seafood paella.  But this time, I decided to try something different and ordered their avocado and crab meat salad.  It was so good!  All the ingredients in the salad was very fresh and I got a whole avocado with this salad. They serve the avocado cut in half for me to scoop out myself and mix with the lump crab meat.  This place is quite busy during their lunch hour rush.  Their happy hour between 4 pm to 6 pm rocks with half price appetizers and cheap drinks.  If you like chicken wings, try their Jamaican chicken wings.  Everything I have tried has been tastefully presented and very pleasing to the palate.  If you have never been here before, you must try this place out.  You won't be disappointed as a they have a wide selection of menu items to choose from.  Oh, did I mention their mojitos are to die for!!
Best Jamaican food in town. Forget the overpriced restaurants on the strip. Just go there and enjoy food, drinks, and live music for a fraction of the cost.

Had the half price appetizers, sliders, chicken, carnitas, korean beef tacos, empanadas, and one more I cannot recall, kinda of a shrimp mango thing.....Anyways they were all really good, def got out money worth pretty big portions that we had enough to take home. I gave them to my brother and he really liked them as well.

Didn't get to try any signature entrees, but based off of our appetizer sampling this place is pretty good.
Food, service, and prices were perfect! Lindsey was a great bartender. Only thing I didn't like here was the terrible shirts.
This food was beyond good. It took me to my happy place. It was so seasoned and moist. I will be coming here more often.

I've been wanting to try this place ever since I moved here. I finally made it and I wasn't disappointed.
We started with the panko/coconut onion rings, they were really good. Not to greasy and the coconut flakes gave it a nice flavor.
I got the avocado and crab salad. Very very good. I ate every single bite!
No run for dessert, but my two drinks were sweet enough. They were a specialty drink, kinda like a pina colada but without being frozen, very good!
I definately will come back!

I stopped by here with a friend to celebrate National Margarita Day because they had a deal going on where you could get margaritas for $2.22 each. Devin, was our server and he did a great job taking care of us. We started out of course with a margarita and it tasted pretty good, but they weren't consistent tasting each time. The promotion price was deducted from our bill with no problem and I was glad since the drinks were just so-so. 

Grilled Chicken and Tropical Fruit Salad ($12.49) -  Pineapple, red grapes, strawberries and mandarin oranges with goat cheese crumbles, candied almonds and drizzled with Island vinaigrette and grilled chicken. When it came to the chicken I was disappointed because it's described at grilled and the picture of it on the menu shows chicken with grill marks, but mine appeared to be seared instead of grilled and had no flavor at all. The chicken lacking flavor honestly left my mind once I tasted the greens, fruits and dressing underneath because there was a good amount of it and it all melded very well together. Good portion for the price and I'd order it again even if the chicken doesn't live up.

Rebecca's Key Lime Pie ($6.99) - Handmade with a brown sugar crust and golden meringue. I've had this dessert before and it tasted just as good this last visit. It's my favorite on the menu and tastes just right. Love that crust.  

Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside-Down Cake ($6.99) - Warm chocolate cake with a chocolate molten center topped with caramelized pineapple and served with raspberry sauce and fresh Island fruit. The first bite tasted a bit like burnt chocolate, but once I got towards the center it was chocolate heaven. 

Inside was clean and they have plenty of dining space as well an outdoor patio. 

Happy Hour is Monday - Friday 4:00 PM - 6:00 P.M.

Late night Happy Hour is Sunday - Thursday 9:00 PM - Close.

This casual and slightly Caribbean-style restaurant has a menu of tacos, shrimp, quesadillas, wings, salads, rice, soups, burgers, chicken, fish, and desserts. One other reviewer here uses the word "passable" to describe this restaurant. I agree. It is not one of my favorite restaurants, but I could eat here occasionally if necessary.

Happy hour appetizers and drinks until 6pm 

Pork street taco appetizers were delicious.  Just enough food to be filling as an early dinner.  With happy hour pricing tacos were just $4.

Went here for New Years Eve. It was my first time here. The drinks were good and the little plastic lizards they put in them were cute and were the highlight of the night. 
I did not like the jerk chicken sandwich, the chicken was lukewarm, not seasoned well and not the jerk taste I was expecting. The bbq sauce was good. The black beans and yellow rice were good, but again, lukewarm. Everyone at my table said their food was only warm, not hot, so I guess our plates were sitting for a while before we got them. 
I would give this place one more try and try a different dish only because I did like the atmosphere.

Service was great, and food was tastefully prepared and served timely.
Our server was Neil and he was very informative and attentive to our needs.  The drinks were great too.

You better get really drunk because the food is horrible.   This our 3rd and last try at this place. We ordered conch fritters.just ok.  Chicken empenadas that were wet inside and doughy..disgusting taste. Sent it back for chicken curry rice bowl.  It was a small amount overall with about 5 small chunks of chicken. .the flavor was so so but after biting into a piece of chicken fat,and gristle that did it.  My guest ordered mahi tacos..it was,and griffin thin sliver of dried fish..looked like jerky more than fish.  Tge visit before we had a chicken pasta dish that was like a parmesan soup...Truly a terrible cooking.  We had a gift card which had money on it after we paid the bill...we gave it to another table as we won't be going back.  That's how bad it was.  Being locals..they must be staying in biz off drinks and tourists.

Love this place! Hot flavorful food, great happy hour, and from the moment we walked in the staff made us feel welcome! Gerry our server hit the spot. He was attentive, and outgoing. Jerk wings and shrimp n grits are a must try!
Mojito and new Major Lazor cocktail had a great kick. Atmosphere is a lively island feel. Best bang for your buck! Highly recommended

I came here for happy hour around 4:30pm on a Friday. My server Alexis was great! Very kind and friendly. I ordered the Frozen Bahamita and Jerk Chicken. Both were so good. I would highly recommend trying this place out when your in Las Vegas.

The portions are so huge for a happy Hour menu and they are half off. The drinks are only $4.. I ordered the Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp -  large  shrimp in a garlic-thyme butter with warm Cuban bread for dipping. It was good and I wanted to get more but found out the portion was big enough for me. I had the frozen Bahamarita that has 
Cuervo Gold Tequila, strawberry, kiwi and mango ices. My friends liked their food too. Richard our server was great, very attentive and made sure we were good. The place has a tropical feel and very airy, spacious. It is great for parties and you get tables for happy hour menu, it's not only at the bar.

Good service... I went on a Sunday lunch date, the waitress greeted me by asking me if I would like to start with a pain killer (speciality drink)... my kind of greeting. I opted for a zombie..  it was good, Wasabi' zombie is still the best I've tasted.  Delicious lobster and shrimp linguine.
Service here used to be good. Now the service is just o.k. Food is par, neither great nor poor. Restrooms filthy. No manager interaction, just walking around. Probably won't be back.
I don't know if this is always 5star, but it was tonight.   Great top shelf marg for the price (especially in vegas) and excellently prepared salmon salad.

Nice place! Christine B was an amazing server. I will return. If you want to come for a nice casual dining experience with great drinks, you should come here. The food is served at a decent pace, it come out nice and fresh and they make sure to keep you satisfied. I loved my server and the food was great.

Caribbean-themed restaurant with a laid-back atmosphere. We all -- Mom, Dad, big kids, little kids -- all really like this food!

Some suggestions: Coconut Shrimp, Jerk Chicken Pasta, Grilled Steak Kabobs, Ribs with Guava BBQ sauce, Calypso Shrimp Linguine, Jerk salmon w/ mashed sweet potatoes 'n plantains... Mmmm...

Save room for the homemade Key Lime Pie or Pinacolada bread pudding!

We have gone to this place SO many times and it disappoints every, single time! Slow service and even slower food. It's a great location for my co-workers and I, only a few minutes from work. The menu is fun and different but everything about the service consistently leaves us wanting more. Plus, seems like every time we choose here were late returning to work. Today, our server Michael, took forever for drinks. Food was an equally long wait. He never checked up on us after the meals finally did arrive (yes, our empty glasses meant we were still thirsty). Then he stood near our table while we all waited, credit cards ready, before I finally had to ask for the checks. Word of advice: don't waste your time.

Bahama Breeze is a fun place to eat!  We came here around 7p on NYE before we walked the strip.  I was surprised we were able to get a reservation for 10, but it seemed like 7p was a bit early.

The food is pretty good, and for the price you can't really beat it.  I know that Vegas has all sorts of buffets, but there is something somewhat sad about buffets; most people concentrate on eating.  The ambience is great despite the somewhat tacky props and decor.

I'd imagine I'd give this more of a 3.5, but since they were so accomodating about adding another table (to make 10 from 8) and since I had such a good time (it being NYE), why the heck not, 4 stars for everyone!

Love this place, nice ambience, has live music playing on the outside patio. Love the Jamaican jerk wings. The Cuban sandwiches are amazing. Everything I've tried here so far was really good. Just wish this place wasn't so far away.

My family and I were staying in Vegas for the week and we decided to have my aunts birthday there. This place is hands down amazing! Great selection, cheap drinks and the best service I've had in years!!! The burgers, pasta, and banana supreme is Delicious.  Gerald and Tina were our waiter's. We will definitely be coming back. They also came out with writing on my aunts desert for her bday

Staff is super friendly! It's definitely a throw back to the 90s when these big themed family restaurants were all the rage. Along with mom jeans.

For portions were massive! So definitely a good deal.
I got steak with plantains and beans. Flavors were great but my steak was kinda cold. My husband got a cream cilantro chicken dish that was absolutely yummy.

Dessert was molten chocolate cake with pineapple. It was good but nothing really outstanding about it.

They also offer happy hour and late happy hour. I'd recommend catching those. Their appetizer options are all half off which makes that lobster quesadilla only $7 yum!

By far this has been one of our favorite places to eat and drink in Vegas.  We come to town about 3-4 times a year for a extended weekend, and Bahama Breeze has always been our most anticipated stops.
Something went astray this time.  I ordered my usual ( Cuban Black Bean Soup, and Jerk Chicken Wings), my wife ordered the Portabella Mushroom Burger.  When he explained it was a hamburger, with a mushroom on top, my wife requested just a "burger" made with the Portabella mushroom as the burger.  I guess the special request was just to complicated.  First she got a open faced bun with a mushroom and veggie mix on it.  She requested the same thing again, and this time it came out as she requested, at about the start of the second bite, a small black bug crawled out from under the lettuce and casually walked across the corner of her sandwitch.  We called the waiter, pointed out the intruder, and he promptly took it back.
He then asked us if we wanted any desert.  We didn't quite understand the question, so we said no.  He brought us our bill.  
We didn't understand.  My wife had had nothing to eat at this point.  We didn't ask for anything else we just thought he would replace her un-eaten sandwich. 
The manager did come over and apologize, and told us how sorry he was, but her sandwich was not replaced.  
As we were leaving, I told the hostess the story, she hailed the manager who apologized again, but didn't seem to understand when I explained that my wife was leaving your establishment Hungary.  People shouldn't leave a restaurant Hungary.  
Not sure if we will try again, just kinda sad that our favorite place, now has a scar.
Menu has changed.  Less Caribbean flavors, more mainstream.  Food well prepared, generous portions.  Good experience, but not as great as it once was

This has always been my favorite place to eat in the last five years but with the service tonight they kind of dropped the ball. I was with a large party of about 13 and the first thing I noticed when I opened the doors were how dirty the glass windows were. The appetizers came out pretty quickly but our entrees took too long. I had the shrimp and lobster linguini which was hearty and very good with also a snack of 3 onion rings which were quite tasty. Once we received our food my friends entree was barely warm and they replaced it with a piping hot plate, but they took so long to bring it. We also had to ask for a refill of water two times. Hopefully it will be better next time.

I am trying to like this place but twice I am asked to wait 15 minutes for a table when the restaurant isn't busy and there's no one waiting in front of me. After waiting they tried to sit me in the large dining area where no one was sitting. I traveling for work and dining alone so I think they are trying to force me to eat at the bar. 

My first visit was mediocre. I ordered a beer which came to me in a bottle that a runner just dropped on the table and ran away. The beer was warm inside but the bottle was cold and the label was about ready to fall off. I guessed they tried to ice down  a room temperature beer. The waiter at least offered a glass for my beer.

I ordered the grilled chicken with cilantro cream. The chicken didn't have much taste since it seemed to be grilled then some bland glaze added on top. There was a bed of mash potatoes that was smothered in a  green 'cilantro' sauce which I liked but I'm a sucker for any thing smothered in gravy. 

So overall I would go back here but I don't expect great good. It's is reasonably price but nothing special.  If you go during happy hour you can make out like a bandit with half price apps and drinks for dinner. Happy hour is 9pm to midnight.

Had a retirement party for a friend, 20-25 people were there, they shoved us in a small room with the fire pit in the center, some ppl had to stand due to the lack of chairs and tables, the service was absolutely terrible, very slow, some ppl had to go to the bar for their own drinks. My drink was basically a slushy with shot of tequila on the side , I had to drink some of the slush in order to get the tequila to fit in the glass .. Knowing how many ppl were there they only had two servers and one bus boy .. You could tell the girls were over whelmed and it showed in their service and attitude.. Some of the appetizers were bland , such as the spinach artichoke like dip was extremely watery and had ZERO flavor, the smoked wings were tough , the only good thing were the coconut shrimp.. I use like eating there , but after this , I probably won't return .. Party or not !!

I had the "fresh fish" salmon with mashed potatoes & asparagus. 

Was actually better than I expected, no fishy taste and the potatoes were very tasty. They should be with all the butter they add. 

Excellent meal if you're not looking for something heavy.


Now about the SERVICE. 

- We sat at the bar and were greeted with an obnoxious bartender. 
- When asking for water he just had to say "so you just want good ole lake mead?" Tackiest way to try and upsell. I wish he would try that at a fine dining establishment. 
- He tried to memorize our two simple order and of course he messed up. Use a pen and paper next time.
- forgot to put in our appetizer & never realized it.

The guy definitely had a few drinks before work. 

If I ever return I'll grab a table.

FYI I love lake mead water.

It's a fun hang-out, as long as your expectations are managed.  It's basically TGIFridays or Applebee's, but with a more exotic menu.  The service is hit or miss. But if you just want a bite after work and you are nearby, you could do worse.  Stick to the basics, and don't be too adventurous, and you'll be alright.
The staff is really polite (5 stars) and the food is OK (2 stars.) I went with 4 because food is more important. The drinks are good if you're looking for tropical stuff (duh.)

We love this place! Food is always great, especially the shrimp firecracker, staff is friendly and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're not in Vegas anymore. Their alcoholic drinks are always awesome! I definitely recommend this spot especially lunch time on a Sunday afternoon! Just relaxing to sit in the patio with a drink in your hand and great food in front of you!
Good vibes. Great food. Phenomenal service. Counch fritters x Reggae Punch for the win!

Great food and a great happy hour menu! Perfect for 104 degree weather!!! Their bahamarita is the perfect frozen drink and their sangria get a two thumbs up!!!! Happy hour is the best time to come and get the best bang for your buck!! And the crowd is pretty great!

BBQ ribs were pretty tasty.

Also the mens bathroom by the bar smelled like trix cereal. I was oddly satisfied.
I really enjoyed the food and drinks here and the service was fast.  I ordered the firecracker shrimp and would suggest that to anyone.

Our friend, Richard Maurer, is one of the rotating house bands at this location.  He is a very talented musician who lives, eats, and breathes music.  His percussionist stylings on the steel drum are worth a listen!

We went to Bahama Breeze last Sunday to watch Richard play, and enjoy the company of friends and a tropical meal.  The menu had an interesting variety of offerings that all looked so pretty in the pictures!  My favorite bites were the fried yuca, tostones with chicken, my husband's empanadas, our dulce de leche cheesecake (big enough to share!), and their pineapple salsa.  Flavor-wise, the food wasn't anything to write home about, but it was novel.

The service and music were excellent.

For a Bahamian off strip restaurant we had a great lunch at Bahamas breeze . 

Service : Service was attentive and good . 

Food: we had a bunch of plates for two people. We started with the tostones which were great but very filling . We also tried the seafood chowder which was very good but very creamy . I had the shrimp and cheesy grist which were good and loaded with calories . We also added plantains and a side of beans . 

Drinks : drinks were amazing and one of the reason we will be back . We had the coconut mojito which was amazing and also a margarita which was pretty standard . 

Overall experience : The patio is a great place for a lunch and is enclosed to keep out the heat of the desert . We will definitely be back for a lunch in the future .
Food was good, Beef empanadas were fabulous with the pineapple chutney. I like the Caribbean decor, makes me want a vacation away from this desert scenery.

Called in a to go order at 130 to be ready at 2. Got here at  215 and they were making it.  The coconut shrimp was tasty.  The tortilla soup had unappetizing chicken chunks in it.  I'd be curious to try more seafood and the jamaican jerk chicken.
Love coming here for there happy hour every week. It has great appetizers. I highly recommend the beef empanadas, so good.

Awesome appetizers and awesome desserts!
 Unfortunately, I have been three times and cannot, for the life of me, seem to remember a single entree. Must have appetizers  are as follows: West indies Beef patties, fire roasted jerk shrimp, crab claws st. thomas, island onion rings,  jamaican jerk wings.

The food was just ok.  Had a salad and onion rings.......we did order spinach dip for the group and that was solid. 

Service was really bad tho........our server was too busy paying attention to others.......he screwed up a few times.....but the big one was when I told him no cucumber since I am allergic.

Paella was super flavorful and filled with substantial amount of seafood. Was way too much but our waitress quickly boxed it up for us without having to ask for it!  My husband had chicken kabob and he lived it. Love the ambience and lively Caribbean music. Our servers were attentive and on top of all our extra requests. Only advice for 5 star rating is up front hostess needs people skills. She's not well trained OR she needs to be reassigned to different position where she doesn't get overwhelmed with minute issues!  Chocolate upside down cake was amazing!!!!

My girlfriend and I stopped here for drinks yesterday. The bar staff was super friendly and we got our drinks quick. The first round was very strong but the second round tasted extremely watered down. Everything we ordered had the same Dark Rum in it so I'm not sure how the taste differed so much. When I told the bartender we were ready for the check he acknowledged my request then ignored us for at least 10 mins. I finally had to ask another staff member for the check.

Ok so I had to "live in Vegas" for a couple weeks while working on a Casino and my "home" ended up right across the street from this place. Which in case you were not aware, is apparently in a bad neighborhood. I was warned by 1) the cab driver dropping me off from the airport 2) a co-worker and 3) another cabby taking me home from work--that I should never walk alone after 5pm. The menu looked pretty good, so I was excited to try this place. The service was so slow. We were seated immediately and then ignored for like 20 min. then our order taken and then ignored for 30 min, we asked what was up and they had made the order wrong, but no one told us. Finally after being in the restaurant for about an hour and a half we got our food. It was okay, but definitely not worth the wait. It was the type of chain like food one would expect from a Chili's or TGIF and they got the order wrong. We talked to the manager and he did not seem to care. Moral of my story--this place is no breeze.

We love going here! The Jerk Chicken Pasta is to DIE for... 

Anyone who goes needs to try it out!
Loved my Birthday lunch! I had the seafood tortillas. I did want the lunch to end! Loved the atmosphere. Music was great!

Our server's name was Lindsay. She had a smile very unique to her. Warm and calming. She lightened up the entire establishment with her kind smile. She was very attentive and gave us our space at the same time. A quality and skill that not too many servers possess. 
Although I don't remember the manager's name, he provided helpful suggestions to wonderful food and ways to prepare it which were not all on the menu. He personally checked back with us later and offered other options... Including wonderful desserts.

Bahamas Breeze used to be one of my favorite restaurant a few years ago...not anymore.

The food to me has gone downhill. Before, I never had a bad meal here. Now, it's been a hit or a miss...more misses than hits. My favorite used to be the jerk chicken bow tie pasta but it's subpar to me now. 

The service is very slow & some of the waiters are just down right rude. The last time I was there the waiter was so nasty, our party just decided to leave instead of getting a new waiter. Worst service I've ever encountered & don't think I'll ever go back because of that experience.

Came here with a group for a gathering.  Sat in the enclosed patio and the service was fantastic. Jason and Brandon worked hard to ensure all of our needs were met.  Some friends and I took advantage of the happy hour menu.  I agree with all of the reviewers that the coconut shrimp is amazing!  The Jamaican jerk chicken wings were also awesome.  I'd also recommend the empanadas that were such amazing comfort food!  The $3.21 cocktails for their birthday wee great as well!  All in all I'd recommend this place!

Delicious food at fair prices.  The coconut shrimp is the best anywhere.  It is offered as a combo with a side salad or soup, or as entire meal.  The service is friendly and efficient.  Good service is a real plus and the hostess and servers remember their past customers.  This is a chain restaurant, but operates with independence, except for its chain menu.
Happy Hour is the best time to go! The beef empanadas and coconut shrimp is flavorful.  The ultimate pina colada is refreshing.  The warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake is to die for.

It's like a TGIF type deal w/ tasteless generic food w/ some "islandy" decorations. There's no real carribean taste and no dishes that stand out. Two things to try though, are the tostones w/ chicken which is like plaintain nachos, the plaintains are deepfried twice and the blended island margarita.

Took mom for her 77th birthday. Never again.. It took 15 for the servers to figure out who's table was who's. We ordered drinks. Then food. They brought our drinks with our food. It took 25 minutes to get our Drinks.. Are you serious. We were in deep family conversation so it took us a while to realize they totally forgot our appetizers. Worst part ever after I told the server it was my moms birthday they NEVER brought anything out to sing her happy birthday. I spent over $100. For crap service. Very upset only thing manager did was offer to give her a dessert to go. Really you guys ruined her birthday party. You guys should be embarrassed. I attempted to call Corporate and never got a response. Kudos

Can I just how much I love this place? LOVE IT. 

From the moment you walk in, walk to your table, eat, leave, sit back in your car...you think..."Now that was just amazing!" 

Every single time my wife and I go here to eat the food is outstanding and the staff is incredible. Now a days it's hard to get good food and good customer service, but these people get it and do well at it. 

We will always be back and will always want to tell others about this place too. Thank you all for producing a great product and taking your job seriously. See y'all soon again!

I have been here many times and had one very bad experience. I spoke with Dan the manager and he assured me it wouldn't happen again. We went back last week and Brandon was our waiter. I must say he was awesome. Drinks and food all came in a timely manner and he checked on us many times. This is what I'm used to getting at Bahama Breeze. 
I highly recommend this place.  I will be back. Thank you Dan and Brandon.

I love the Habanero Wings. If you are a wing lover like me Bahama Breeze provides a unique spin that you won't find anywhere else. The wings were all a good size and it's served with a nice flavored sour cream that perfectly complements the flavor of the wings and balanced the spice of the Habanero.  My server Devin was also very friendly and attentive.  I had a great experience.

My wife and I have dined here a few times and thought we had found another favorite. 
The Habanero wings are good. The Key Lime pie is very authentic. However when we decided to go there for my wife's birthday we were extremely disappointed. I ordered Jerk Chicken. I ate about half of the chicken when I realized it was getting difficult to pull the meat from the bone. This generally means chicken is undercooked. When I showed our server he called over the manager who insisted she have it remade for us. I told her I didn't really want a remake. So I opted for it to go. I was really disappointed when I told them it was my wife's birthday and ordered Key Lime pie expecting they would make her feel important with some sort of Birthday thing. But what we got was a waiter who said " pretend I sang for you and then you blew out a birthday candle then walked away. 
I will never go back to Bahama Breeze nor do I recommend them to anyone else. I can see now why they were not busy near the strip on Friday night. Diners Beware!!!

Their happy hour is the best!

You don't have to sit by the bar or at a particular area of the restaurant to get their happy hour specials, which is a huge bonus!  Happy hour is from 4-6 pm Monday - Friday.  Their prices are outstanding, and the service is awesome!  Drinks are strong and the food is tasty!
Excellent food excellent drinks our waiter whose name is Dave is unbelievable we set in the patio with the rest of the meet-up group and had a wonderful time

Had reservations for 10 on a Wednesday at 6pm, 630, still no table. Manager points to a table, telling that it's my table, have to wait for them to leave. Meanwhile, other possibilities to seat us are evident, even an unused room. Manager blunty reports "room is closed'. No offer for a beverage or anything to possibly compensate for the inconvenience. We left, never to return. Seems he couldn't have cared less.
I love be the patio here!! Great service, very polite and attentive. They have a Jamaican hot sauce to die for and a great happy hour.
I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the ingredients and food preparation at this chain restaurant. I had Ahi tuna and black bean soup and both were special. Kudos to the chef!

This chain is part of the Darden Group (Olive Garden, Red Lobster, etc)

Pros:  Great Food (the last 2 times for both my husband and myself)
           Atmosphere is very nice and different from the usual PGH fare.
           There's a really nice patio/outdoor dining deck that's nice             (depending on the weather), if you can pick up the whole restaurant and plop it down on a beach, it would look totally @ home!  

Cons:  Pricey (as most large chains tend to be)
            Wait staff is inconsistent.


First Visit:  Fabulous!  Food was great and our server was sooo good that we earned him a "Pineapple"!  (which I will explain later)

Second Visit (7/19/10):  Food was great, service was absolutely awful!
We sat outside, which is "seat yourself" and 
A.)  it was quite a while before we were acknowledged and drink orders taken.
B.)  we were clearly not our waitress'  priority.
The food runner ran all of our food and my husband was in need of another drink after the appetizer which went completely un-noticed the duration of the meal.  We looked and looked for ANYone to grab a refill and it was a ghost town on the patio other than the other patrons.


PINEAPPLES:  If you have a great experience with the server assigned to you, if you ask to speak with a manager to tell him/her how awesome your server was, the server "earns a pineapple" for the guest compliment to their service.
Its a nice thing to do to show how much you appreciate it when someone does treat you right all night!   :)

We came for late night happy hour.  We had two shrimp dishes.   They were excellent.  The service was great.  Good casual ambiance.  Lindsey was our waitress.  Lindsey did an excellent job.  Thank you!

A friend of mine hosted a business dinner here and invited me to join them.  It's been a while since I've visited this joint, so I gladly accepted.  When I arrived, they were already seated and the Appetizers were coming out.  They ordered Coconut Shrimp (Crispy large Shrimp hand-breaded with sweet flaky Coconut & a Citrus-Mustard dipping Sauce) & Creole Baked Goat Cheese (In roasted Red Bell Peppers served with vine-ripened Tomato Salsa and Parmesan Toast).

The Coconut Shrimp was OK, not great.  They're large sized Shrimp.....the Coconut Breading was a bit sweet for my tastes.  The Creole Baked Goat Cheese was excellent!  If you try the Goat Cheese, you have to slice up the Bell Pepper and eat it....it was amazingly good.

For an entree, I ordered the Jerk Chicken Pasta (Jerk Chicken Breast, fresh Asparagus and Mushrooms tossed in a rich Parmesan-Herb Cream Sauce with Bow-Tie Pasta).  They weren't kidding when they said this dish was "rich".....I think I gained 5 lbs after eating this thing.....it was very good though.  Despite being rich, the Sauce didn't overwhelm the dish and it had a nice flavor.  The Jerk Chicken was cooked perfectly and was of good quality.....you could taste the flavor that Jerk Chicken is known for....I was left wanting more.  Thank God it wasn't bottomless, otherwise I'd have to buy new clothes afterwards....ha!

Overall, it was good service and good food.  This place is a solid 4 Stars.

Return Factor - 82%

I came in here with one of my co-workers for their late night happy hour. Their appetizers are half off during happy hour and the portions are what make it worth your while. 

I got the crispy onion rings, the lobster & shrimp quesadilla, and the Jamaican chicken wings. For a drink, I just stuck with the coconut water.

The crispy onion rings have a panko-coconut breading that's fried to a golden-brown. The coconut flavor is really subtle, but you can't go wrong with this classic appetizer.

The lobster & shrimp quesadilla was pretty amazing. Who would've ever thought that cheese and shellfish would be a perfect match? They came with pico de gallo and sour cream on the side, which go perfect with these little triangles of cheesy goodness. The lobster seemed a little sparing, but the shrimp was definitely there.

The Jamaican chicken wings had the perfect marinade to it. The jerk spices added a unique zing to the wings that blast your tastebuds with rich flavor! The spiciness factor isn't too hot. It won't burn your tongue, but it definitely has a noticeable kick. 

I'll be back to try their entrees, but their appetizers are really something special. Any place that has amazing deals for their happy hour is worth it to me!
Was in town and stopped here for lunch. Good food, clean, great service.
The food was alright I had a burger however I had better. The drinks were pretty good I have to say. That's the only reason I'm giving them 3stars the drinks

I generally avoid rating chain restaurants, but I am obsessed with Bahama Breeze and try to visit one everywhere I go.  Usually places that have an "exotic" decor relative to what you're used to are just banking on that, and the food isn't anything special.  Well, I've eaten at this BB on three separate occasions, and I've found the food to be consistently delicious, the staff friendly, and the atmosphere delightful.  I've been here with a lot of former Disney cast members like myself, and we've all agreed that the way the staff here handles its customers is admirably similar to the Disney standard.

It's been a few years since I've been here so I don't really recall what I had to eat besides the onion rings, which were big, juicy, and crispy.  I'd love to come back next time I go home to visit.  (I currently live in San Diego.)

Though I am neither a big Caribbean food buff nor a Caribbean food connoisseur, I am proud to say that Bahama Breeze has hit all my five-star-diamond standard. 

The food is absolutely fantastic, and the service is excellent. It is a fairly good-sized restaurant, yet the food and the service are delivered at the great speed. 

Unfortunately, I'm not quite cool with the seafood. (I get allergic to seafood from time to time.) I did taste my friends' seafood dishes for a bite, and they were yummy. I personally liked to order BBQ Ribs and Pork Tenderloin. Great choices though.

Driven by the joint for years, finally stopped in. Was pleasantly surprised by large drink and food menu. Very friendly wait staff. Was Reggae Fest wth live music, guitar player/singer and his computer-track band.
Great quality food, customer service, and atmosphere. This restaurant feels like you are on an island somewhere- nice escape.

Some of the best jerk chicken west of da Islands painkillers are a great tease also when in Sin City this is my first stop gotta make happy hour for more fun so many great choices gonna visit tomorrow night also love bringing new people here they are pleasantly surprised a little taste of the virgin islands and Jamaica  you can't pass this gem while in Las Vegas

I ate here for the first time the other day, and I have 0 complaints! I was a little skeptical because I've never eaten at a Caribbean restaurant before but the food here is so so good!!! The waitress that we had was amazing as well, she was so funny and genuine. I would definitely recommend this place, and I can't wait to eat here again!

Restaurant seemed mostly empty. Was given a pager and was told no more than 10 minutes to wait. 20 mins later i was seated. Waiter was very friendly, but a little too sparky for me. Took a half an hour to take our dinner order. Have been here over an hour and still haven't gotten my food yet. Wait. Just came. How am I supposed to eat this whole burger with this little bitty cup of ketchup? Smh. My daughter ordered her burger medium well. It was burnt to a crisp. Food over all was bleh.  Service was friendly, but horrible.

From the outside, Bahama Breeze looks like a franchise restaurant that should've been closed in the 90s. But, their happy hour is something worth checking out. From 4:00-6:00 pm, a 20 oz. draft beer is only $3! The firecracker shrimp street tacos (3) were my favorite and half off as were the rest of the appetizers. The habanero chicken wings weren't that spicy, but you get at least a dozen wings. The lobster and shrimp quesadilla was a bit lackluster. Otherwise, great happy hour find!
Outdoor seating feels like your in Key West. Good, solid Caribbean food, happy hour starts again at 9:00, reasonable prices, good drinks.

Listen.  When you have a group of 18 to 21 people it can never be easy.  I'm sure the wait staff do not enjoy.  Plus issuing separate checks and keeping it all organized this cannot be an easy task.  Saturday night we were there and it was a very large party.  Jerry and I cannot remember the gals name kept up with us all night.  Very accommodating.  Very courteous.  Very attentive.  It was nice.  The food is ok.  It can cater to a lot of different tastes.  Pasta to steak to hummus and nachos.  Drinks were good.  It can get loud but we've obviously made it one of our stops each time we come into Vegas.  We always have a large crowd when we do our annual trip and this place just gets it.  

Thank you BB.

Came here for my friends birthday party and the happy hour menu was amazing!!!!! OMG sooo much drinks and appetizers for such a low cost. 

You have to try the Ultimate piña Colada. If you like sweet drinks then... Please do yourself a favor and order one lol happy price is only $4.

Not very welcoming. For got my drinks twice luckily I had water in my diaper bag.

Didn't seem like they wanted to help us. Christina was our server. No one got refills and we couldn't even ask because she wasn't around. People that served our food didn't seem like they wanted to work. 

Food looked AMAZING just like the pictures. 

I got a salmon salad and it had to much dressing. 

Spoke to the manager very professional he said sorry still left a tip wish I hadn't service was horrible

Heading out of Vegas after a nice weekend we wanted to grab a bite to eat off of the strip. It's my job to choose our restaurants so as we drove by Bahama Breeze something made me say say "stop, turn here!" I'm glad we did.  It's your typical chain restaurant with oversized booths and waiters in tropical shirts, but we were both pleased with our meals and our friendly waiter. We had the beef empenada appetizer, the chicken kabob over yellow rice and the fresh jerk salmon of the day. The food was seasoned well and the menu has plenty to choose from without being overwhelming. 

The food was reasonably priced for lunch and the portions were great, not too much food it was perfect. Our waiter was so sweet and even gave us a tip on a great place to go shopping! The tropical drinks looked great, so next time I visit I would like to try one.  It was a nice relaxing comforting lunch to end our fun trip in Vegas.

When will you put a Bahama Breeze in SOCAL? I love this place! The appetizer cajon shrimp platter with bread is the best thing I've ever tasted.  I have been writing letters to the company to expand westward for years, but no feedback and no outcome :( BEST FOOD EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Best decision we made coming here tonight was leaving our booth to dine at the bar and I am so glad we did! We had the BEST service from Russell & Evann. No exaggeration - these two fellas were on top of it!!! Plenty of conversation & lots of suggestions of cool things to do during our stay.

Now about the food .... WOW! Everything tasted fresh & amazing. Our appetizers were like entrees they were so big! We loved the seared sesame crusted Ahi, coconut shrimp & chicken quesadillas. If we didn't come hungry & ready to pack in some grub the appetizers would have been enough because we also had cocktails. But we also ordered bowls! The plantain bowl was my favorite!!!! sweet & salty all in one dish and I was able to substitute the ground beef for jackfruit #Vegetarian. 

This may become a regular stop whenever we visit Vegas! But ONLY if we post up at the bar - the service in regular dining started off suspect & unimpressive LOL

Went here for lunch today after a long day at the Convention Center for the builder's show.  It's approximately two miles away and conveniently located on Paradise and Flamingo.  You walk in and definitely get the vibe of being in the Bahamas.  Fresh water flowing, tropical decor everywhere and many choices of rum mixed drinks with flavors that bring you back to paradise at sea.

Items Ordered:
- Firecracker Shrimp (Appetizer)
- Jerk Chicken Fettucini (Entree)

My initial appetizer was quite good and I'm not sure what the sauce was made from, but it was very flavorful.  Was definitely in the caliber for bang bang shrimp from Bonefish Grill.  The jerk chicken Fettucini definitely had a nice kick after each bite and made my taste buds crave more.  The portions for both entree and appetizer were extremely generous and I'm so glad I split my meal with my wife.  I really wanted to try the pineapple mixed drink, but unfortunately I was in working hours.  I'd definitely like to come back for happy hour and try other items on the menu.

this is a cool place. . i went the people that were there for the wedding the food was good i liked the pasta ordered .  the survuce was fast  and they seated our large groups quickly. they had a good tropical look. like i said in a bast review i would not have gone there if i was by myself. i wanted to do stuff more unique to Vegas
I love the Calypso Pasta with shrimp so much, that I learned to make it myself. West Indies Patties are soo good as well.

I've been here a couple times now.  There isn't really anything terrible at the place. It's just a little pricey for what you get. Each time I walk out I think to myself, " Self, you could have done just as well somewhere else for half the price."  Overall, I would say skip it and find something else to satiate your hunger.

Tasty overall! Came for lunch. Sister had the habanero wings and the jerk shrimp, very good! Daughter had the chicken tenders, mediocre. I had the chicken curry over rice with naan. The naan, eh, nothing special. The coconit curry sauce and rice very flavorful and decent amount of spice. Chicken was over cooked and hard. Service was just ok.

I ordered fish tacos with yellow rice and told waitress to put spicy taco sauce on the side and it came with it on it so I literally ate just the fish and not the taco or contents bc it tasted like garbage and the rice sucked ass so I didn't eat anything but the fish out of the taco I rate it a garbage can.
Food was pretty good. Our waitress Sandra was great.  They were missing some of the items on the menu. Overall a good experience.

I attended a group event here. The food and service were exceptional! The staff was attentive to all of our needs.  I would recommend this restaurant for group or individual dining!  Their coconut shrimp is the best I've had!

overall pretty good.. applewood bacon & cheddar burger was so bomb.. 

they use fresh ground beef so don't be scared 2 order it a little red if u like it that way...

service was fast and always attentive..

Overall not too bad.  Nice service.  The pulled pork had a weird taste.  That is my only complaint.  the onion rings were hot and crisp.  The fries were also hot.  The yet of the meals were ok.  The price was a little high.  We had 6 appetizers, 1/2 price, and 3 drinks, 1/2 price as well, Happy Hour.  The bill was $55.00.  At full price would have been over $100.00.  There was not a meal.  So overall ok food, but the price is little high.

We took our mother out for dinner last night (5-27-2015).  I chose Bahama Breeze at the Robinson Town Center Mall area.  She had never been there in all the years she has lived in Pittsburgh.  My wife also hd never been to a Bahama Breeze.  I am very familiar with the ones in Orlando Florida.

Mom had the Jerk Chicken and my wife had the Coconut Shrimp. They were amazed .at the great taste and quality of the food.  I had never tried their BBQ ribs.  They were the meatiest ribs I have ever had and delicious. Our mom could not stop raving about the food and beverages.  At 92 she has been round the world and has very specific likes and dislikes.

I must add that we were seated promptly at our reserved time.  The servers were very attentive and well trained.  We all had a great evening.

This place never disappoints me. I usually get the tropical fruit salad which is a good healthy choice. I changed it up a little and had the salmon with mango glaze, cinnamon sweet potatoes, and greens beans; it was prepared well and very flavorful. I also love how the seating and the ambiance that bahama breeze creates.

I had a voucher for $25 for Darden Restaurants and from the choices available, I opted to try Bahama Breeze.

I arrived about 5:15 and was seated in a rather empty restaurant except for a private party in one room.  I was seated immediately and my server, Mike, came over and ask for drink order and let me know if I had any questions about the menu to ask.  He got my iced tea.

I ordered a cup of black bean soup and the coconut shrimp.  The bean soup was brought in a short time drizzled with a back and forth with a cilantro-crema.  The crema didn't really give the soup any flavor.  It seems it was more decorative than functional. 

The main course--coconut shrimp--was brought with the correct amount of break between appetizer and main.  The shrimp were good and it had been quite awhile since I had coconut shrimp which I like.  It was served broccoli and yellow rice.  The shrimp were good but I think it would be better as an appetizer than a main.  

For dessert, I got the chocolate island, a dessert the menu describes as "rich chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie island in chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise."  It was a very good dessert and the best part of the meal.

Mike's service was very good.  My iced tea was refilled without asking.

Bahama Breeze was an OK place.

Called a simple quesadilla in, I arrived 22 min later to find out they never made it. I waited for them to make it and I was offered a beverage while I waiting, but lemonade was not an option, only fountain drinks.

Came in after my soccer game for a late night dinner. I ordered a water and ginger ale to drink... And BOTH beverages had mysterious items floating in it (yuck)! It looked like pulp from lemons or lines... Our server changed the beverages out, but it still looked like something extra was floating in the cups so I opted not to drink anything.

We also had to pay our tab right as we got our food. Slightly annoying but I can dig it. I ordered the Jamaican jerk chicken. It's actually pretty good and flavored/seasoned quite well. Their plantains are good as well. 

Not sure what was up with the beverage situation but I'd likely come back in 4-6 months.

Please go out of business!! Besides your restaurant being dirty a majority of the time, your managers are racist. I'm applaud at the lack of respect you gave patrons the other day. Since you were checking to see if they had money, you should have checked all their degrees. Yes, educated women with jobs!!! Disgusting!!!

Came here for first time and was told a 30 minute wait for sunroom or window seating because one server did not show up for work. Seriously ??  Lost several customers today. The greeter didn't seem to know what to do.

We have eaten here more than a half dozen times and we have never been disappointed. The food, service and atmosphere is fantastic. Whether it's shrimp, jerk chicken, fish tacos, Cuban sandwhich, or key west nachos, it's all excellent. My only complaint is that I have to drive 45-50 minutes from Canton to get here.

Worst Bahama Breeze I've ever eaten at. Went in there starving and couldn't even finish the Taste of Jamaica dish I ordered, meats were dry and rice was crunchy. Go by there quite often and will continue to do so.

First time at one of these chains. the atmosphere was cool the service was great the Drinks Alone deserve the 5-star rating. We had the drink that they make in the pineapple and it was awesome! coconut shrimp was delicious as well the main courses were good too
Can't go wrong with the Calypso Shrimp and Mojito Cubano! Huge portions seasoned to perfection. Service was great and food served extremely quick!

Came here with a whole bunch of people but we sat around in different tables.  Someone on my table ordered the tower onion rings.  That was heavy, greasy, and alright.

I ordered a jerk chicken pasta which was good and had the right amount of spice.  But the grease built up quick and could be toned down some.  I was able to try my friends chicken breast and I liked the mango salsa that came with it.  So far we have:

Appetizers:  Onion Rings (3/5).
Entrees:  Jerk Chicken Pasta (3/5) and Grilled Chicken Breast (4/5).  

But the best was yet to come!  I ordered a chocolate mousse dessert, the chocolate island.  It was made with a perfectly baked brownie!  Taadaa... Dessert:  Chocolate Island.(6/5). 

Service was alright, the restaurant was busy and the fan above our table wasn't working.  -.-  I didn't really feel the Bahama vibe but it could also be because I didn't order anything that that could be found outside Bahama Breeze.  There is that cool firepit thing to the left of the restaurant when you first walk in, i want to sit there next time!

Haven't really been to Bahama Breeze in years....but thanks to a Red Lobster gift card (both restaurants belong to Darden), and a Valentine's date for some KISS Mini Golf (review on that later), we were hungry!

Got to say, restaurant is still not bad for a Caribbean-themed chain.  Place was hoppin'!  Very, very busy.  Folks must like their congo music, eh?  Breezy.  Luckily even with no reservations our wait time for a table was less than five minutes.  Like the place - open, airy, noisy, and boy do I love the smell of Jerk chicken on the grills.  I'm really hoping that it's cooked on an open charcoal flame, but I'm pretty sure it's probably not.  Can't have everything I suppose.

After getting seated and giving our drink order (Bahama Breeze using bottles of Republic of Tea - Ginger Peach is tasty but a tad pricy) we were ready to view the menu.  It really is a bit of a mix, some Jamaican, some Caribbean, some American.  Fortunately a lot of it sounded tasty.

Wifey couldn't decide so she settled on the Island Hopper ($19.99) - appetizer sampler platter of sorts that included their signature Jamaican chicken wings, crispy coconut shrimp, onion rings, and conch fritters.  It came with sauce sides of jerk BBQ sauce, citrus mustard, and a roasted pineapple chutney.  For the most part she enjoyed it.  The Jamaican chicken wings were a bit smaller than she remembered but they were still very tasty with a peppery kick.  Coconut shrimp were indeed crispy, but light, with good hints of sweet when dipped in the pineapple chutney.  Conch fritters were only OK, a bit forgetful because they tasted more of a hush puppy with very little conch inside.  And the onion rings, well they were just onion rings.

I ended up getting the Cuban Sandwich ($10.99) and while I did like it, I should have read the menu better.  Why does Bahama Breeze put lettuce & tomato in a Cuban sandwich??  And salami???  Very, very strange.  Just do it like the Cubans guys - marinated roasted pork, good ham, Swiss cheese, pickles, and mustard between buttered Cuban bread then smooshed in a plancha till golden brown.  Simple!  Thank you Jon Favreau of Iron Man and Chef fame!  I think I would have enjoyed this sandwich a lot more without the extra fluff, but did applaud the effort of Bahama Breeze trying to make the sandwich their own.  Next time I would just order it with no lettuce & tomato, or just put it on the side.

Overall a good experience at Bahama Breeze, the atmosphere was inviting, and the service was stellar without being pretentious.  The food could use some tweaking but that's par for the course.  If this place wasn't so far from where we live I would be likely to check out their menu further or at least come down for their hoppin' Happy Hour.

Jamaican me crazy!

First of all, this place just couldn't seem to pick a type of food and stick with it. Is it a burger joint? An Italian eatery ? A Caribbean restaurant ? The menu is all over the place and the quality of the food is barely edible. There isn't much else that I can add that hasn't already been said about this place, but I certainly won't be back.

I came here with my family over Thanksgiving holiday for lunch.  We were getting sick of buffets so decided to try something different.  Food is average.  We ordered the wings (big size!), lobster quesadillas with side of seafood chowder, coconut shrimp with side of chicken tortilla soup and portabello mushroom burger.  Only items that stood out were the seafood chowder and wings.  Burger was not very good, something about all the ingredients and manchego cheese just did not work well together.  Their signature lemonade with cane sugar is very good.  Overall, the ambiance is cute and tropical inside.  Nice getaway from the Vegas crowds!!

Great, beautiful, and perfect priced! I do reccomend the Jerk Shrimp Appetizer and the Banana nut covered in brandy sauce for dessert.. So delicious  The service here is very calm and assertive to your need and delivers well. Sunday through Thursday they have happy hour after 9 til close and all appetizers are half off great deal!! Come and try it yourself #jerksauce is good on everything
Came here with my girlfriend and enjoyed every minute of it. Food was great not to mention the service.

I've lived here a year and never been to this place.  It's been on my radar

It was great.  Good food good drinks.  We sat on the patio and had a great lunch 

KAT the manager came and talked to us and was so friendly.    Ryan are server was great. Super nice 

Only complaint would be to have to pay $1.50 for the bread with my pasta.  I've never seen that anywhere ever

Had a great meal at Bahama Breeze while In Vegas. We had such a great time. But it was mostly due to the great team of Jarrod and Raven. They were the best servers EVER!! 

We got there just in time for a GREAT happy hour. We all ordered the pineapple coconut martini. It was the best!! And then got 2 orders of the best coconut shrimp I have ever had. Loved the crunch and the coconut was cooked perfect. The dipping sauce made it taste even better. 

We then ordered a bunch of apps and they were all delish too. We also ordered the coconut mojitos. It was like a dessert. Sooooo good. 

But our servers Jarrod and Raven made our night even better. They took such great care of us!! They were just amazing. They really know their stuff. 

I just wish Bahama Breeze was in California. I have to come all the way to Las Vegas to eat there.

I can't think of a reason to back to this place.  I wouldn't go back on my own, wouldn't recommend it to anyone & would suggest an alternative if it was suggested.  The only reason it's not a 1 is that the waitress was great.
All the entrees were overpriced & my jalapeno grits tasted like a bland bowl of cream-of-wheat.  
The food wasn't rancid & the environment was standard chain issue, but I can't recommend this place - go to a steakhouse if you're going to spend $20-25 a plate.

I have to say that this is a really beautiful location. We recently had a company dinner here. We are a large group. My group was able to sit at a large, fun, circular table with a fit pit in the middle. It was too hot for a fire, but we enjoyed the inclusive nature of our seating that allowed for group conversation and laughter. Our group had chosen a fixed menu (chicken or fish) that was able to appeal to everyone in attendance. Veggies offered were fresh and full of taste. I am only giving three stars because I would like to say that the staff did their best to accommodate our large group - but they fell a little short by serving everyone in our group except about five people. Those five were forgotten to the point that the staff approached and asked if we were ready for boxes while our settings were clear and we were awkwardly sitting there. We had to specifically ask to be served food (despite being served drinks all night). Large groups are tough to serve, but having experienced and aware staff on hand would really make a huge difference in these settings. Luckily, their strawberry margarita was ON POINT.

Very slow service tonight. Not even busy. Took at least ten minutes to be greeted by server. $22 steak somewhat gristly. Had to wait for a steak knife that should have been brought to the table before the steak arrived. Server seemed uninterested. Asparagus extremely small and hard. Only the yellow rice was any good. Not too much to be excited about.
Great service!! Food was good! Unclear pricing so minus one star. The orders came quick and the waiter was nice and handled our big party nicely.
Top notch service, wonderful food, great atmosphere, what more can you ask for?   Our server Mitch was great!

Tried this spot out this week and was pretty good except the steak didnt have any flavor but the jerk wings were good the firecracker shrimp was good .. would come back again to try some other stuff here lots of selections on the menu

3 stars for the fire cracker shrimps and customer service. But the Calypso shrimp linguine is absolutely disgusting, also do not order steak from this place. No seasoning and just wasn't good quality steak.

At first everything seemed great service was good drinks for refilled on time then I received my Jamaican jerk pasta which was supposed to have a cream sauce and it was extremely watery like someone just poured milk in it I was hungry so I ate it however I would not order it again our server then asked us to stack up our plates , which I thought was kind a odd because we don't work there 
however we did and set them aside 
we then ordered dessert however they forgot one of our guests And he had to wait for his dessert we pretty much had finished all of ours when his arrived and we asked why it took so long and she said we had to make more whip cream 
I do have to say the portion of sizes were large however they are way out of whack for pricing extremely expensive I will not be going back again

I go to Bahama Breeze in Seattle & Vegas.  Love this  place.  Great atmosphere. Food, drinks & service are always right on point.  Tonight I had the jerk chicken sliders, jerk chicken pasta and key lime pie for dessert. Highly recommend.
Just average nothing to write home about. Very expensive average food. Onion rings ok. I had a steak just average.

If I never have to step foot in another Darden Restaurant ever again, my culinary life would be so much more diverse. My palate would be much happier too. But shamefully, I have been sucked into the Breeze a few times too many, but not without protest I must add!

[Chain Restaurant Rant] 
For some odd reason, way too many people find these places appealing. Typical Darden Restaurants and most other big fancy-schmancy chains are propped up in mass trafficked, comfortable, suburban safe zones. The buildings that these restaurants are housed in are often made to project an elaborate architectural structure meant to impress. (I'm talking to you too Cheesecake Factory). It's almost as if to trick those who don't know any better into thinking what they are about to enter into is the pinnacle of a all dinning destinations. What many fail to realize though is that these chains lack soul, character, authenticity and a sense of local community. Atlas, I struggle to find the appeal that so many others seem to be drawn to. 
[/Chain Restaurant Rant]

Whether it's the convenient locale or the familiarity of a chain, I've been invited to Bahama Breeze to meet with friends and family of mine on a few occasions. The wait on the weekend is usually unbearable. The sounds of the faux steel drum island beats in the background is corny as hell. 

To help temper the pain, my first order of business upon entering this torture chamber is to get nice and liqueured up and as fast as possible. Unfortunately for me, there's not much variety on the beer & wine list, which consists mostly of boring domestics and a nifty house beer called "Aruba Red" (I bet whoever thought of that name thought they were a freakin' genius!). I hate to burst their bubble though, but Aruba Red tastes like any other boring domestic lager, but with red food coloring. Blach! On a more positive note, I've been told the Mojito's were good, but I can't vouch for those either. 

As for the menu, it consists of uninspiring interpretations of Americanized Caribbean food. A starch with pineapple or corn salsa dumped on top seems to fit their idea of "Caribbean", while other dishes consist mostly of salt, lots and lots of iodized salt! I typically play it safe and choke down the Cuban Sandwich. 

Why the two stars? The majority of my friends and family seem perfectly happy after a night out here and when they're happy, so am I. The second because without boring chains, I wouldn't have nearly the appreciation I do for the local joints.

Well, well, well, Bahama Breeze. I thought that I would be able to go to this establishment with some close friends to enjoy a nice dinner. Our experience tonight has truly made us never want to go to this business again. I suggest that anyone that reads this takes this information to heart. My friend had to use the bathroom and he has Parkinsons so he cannot use the bathroom on his own and needed my help. To put this as clean as possibly I was directing his stream in the bathroom when a worker walked in. He made some rude, sarcastic comment to us and walked out. I was shocked. I thought that this harassment would be over but when we returned to our tables the owner came to our table to talk to us. We did not want to scare our dates off so we just apologized but the owner accused us of peeing on the wall. He told us that it was a family friendly establishment and it wouldn't be tolerated. Now this is 2017. I don't understand why people still cannot accept someone for who they are. It has been scientifically proven that the hypothalamus lights up for certain interactions and that it lights up in a different way for one's sexual preference. They cannot change the way they are. The owner refused to believe our story and its sad that he harassed my friend due to his disability. If you have any respect for the people on this earth then please do not come to this business. They are extremely homophobic and provided a miserable experience. The food was not even that good and not worth the prices that they were. Pathetic.

I have been to this location multiple times and have been satisfied each time. It is one of my favorite restaurants. Everything I have ever got here has been delicious. Some yummy and highly recommended dishes here are the jerk chicken pasta, shrimps and grits, and any of their fresh fish (I personally love their tilapia). The service is usually pretty good and fast and they have a fun atmosphere. They occasionally have live music playing. No complaints!

I love this place..we come here everytime we go to vegas..jamaician wings are delicious..there my favthing on the menu..crispy and full of flavor!I tried the butermilk fried chicken sliders....they were good....husband had a salmon pasta that he loved..lots of salmon in it.alcohol drinks are great too..all of them! Enjoy!

Ok , this review is just for their happy hour, which is probably one of the cheapest and best in town !!   3$ large draft beers and half off selected appetizers , hell yeah !! They also have 4$ and 5$ cocktails using decent brands as well , and happy hour is available anywhere in the restaurant, which is great for people with children!!  Some happy hour highlights are the spinach dip , a large bowl of gooey goodness served with warm chips , also their wings are amazing no matter which you choose ( the Jamaican jerk , tho are an acquired taste ) and the large portion of coconut battered onion rings are crispy and delicious ! So check them out !!

I like Bahama Breeze for something a little different.  It is part of the Darden family of restaurants (Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Long Horn Steakhouse) but this is neither Italian, seafood or steak.  Sure, they have pasta, fish and beef but that is not what they're about. 

Bahama Breeze is about the feel of the Caribbean.  The place looks like a beach resort that one may find in, say, the Bahamas. There are palm trees, torches, fruity cocktails and an overall laid back atmosphere.  The menu is substantial and has something for just about anybody.  It is a restaurant/menu I have been enjoying for over 10 years.  

I started coming here with my office for a holiday party.  Then we came back for a retirement party.  And again for a going away party.  Maybe even two.  I've come in with family a couple of times now also.  Each time I stop in I try somthing different.  Coconut shrimp (amazing and unfortunately not an option for me any more), chicken skewers and rice (not on the menu any more), West Indies curry rice bowl, jerk chicken pasta, buttermilk fried chicken with mashed potatoes.  I've tried the black bean soup.  I've tried a salad.  I've never been disappointed with anything I've had here.

I've had some of the drinks too.  A sample of the coconut mojito which was good but very sweet.  A taste of the watermelon jalepeno margarita.  A zombie (which I seem to remember liking very much).  I did have an off pint of Guiness once.  Not sure what happened to that keg but it wasn't good.  However, I've also had a Newcastle here and it was spot on.  

Service has always been consistent and pleasent.  Even coming in on Mother's Day with a 7:00 PM reservation went off without a hitch.  We were seated just before our scheduled time and were waited on equally quick.  Having taken the time to look at the drinks and food, we ordered and just got to talking.  Before we knew it we had all that we had ordered and the meal had begun.  We were out of there by 8:15.  Not bad considering how busy this place was on a holiday.

This was one of the more fascinating restaurants I have seen on the inside. the view was very pleasant, staff was extremely nice and fast with their food I am very impressed I recommend if you like seafood to at least visit this place in Pittsburgh it's worth the while.

Okay, I came back again to give this place a second chance and since I'm staying in a hotel across the parking lot for two weeks.  Plus all the other restaurants nearby were pretty crowded.
