Great selection of food and drinks and always friendly service. They have a very good atmosphere for any type of event. Sometimes the service can be slow but that's the only downside.

I had the firecracker shrimp and the jerk chicken and it was just mediocre. The jerk wasn't spread around the chicken but there was enough food to fill you up. The firecracker shrimp were an attempt for the knock off bang bang shrimp and a few of the pieces were hard.

I'm sorry but Pittsburgh is too overwhelming for me to brave driving downtown at night.  Well, at least it was last night, so I headed on over to Robinson Town Center Mall,  or whatever it is called.  

Not so big on suburban chain places but I was starving.  Compared to where my hotel is, Robinson was the "big city".

For what it was - suburban chain place  - I give it 5 stars.  Had the Pan seared tilapia with rice and green beans. I enjoyed it. Felt pretty healthy too!

After I spend some more time in Pittsburgh I'm sure I will laugh at the night I ate in the 'burbs because I was too scared of the highways to drive to a trendier neighborhood.  But I will always be grateful that this place was accessible and open 'til 11 pm last night.  I don't think I could have handled another dinner of Fritos from the hotel's convenience shop!

P.S. The last time I ate at a Bahama Breeze was when I lived in Orlando.  Bahama Breeze was like going to Disney to dine without having to drive the extra 30 miles.  This was a nice little reminder of what it's like to "feel" the Florida.  Sigh... why did I move away from there again?

Not too impressed with this place. For a restaurant in this area it should be a whole better. Our waitress was nice , but not too attentive to our table. The food had a lack of seasoning. The first dish I ordered was $18 , and had to send it back. Talk about bla! No taste. The second dish I ordered was a chicken Spinach dish. Same thing really could if used some salt and pepper . I would of rather gone to Applebee's! If your going to eat in this area ...go to another restaurant. This is the place of fine dinning and great food. No need to waste your time with this place.
We had an all over amazing experience here! Amazing food, great drinks, and the best service we had received anywhere in Vegas! Amazing and fun atmosphere, and friendly staff

Ate here with the bf about 2 years ago I'm surprised I haven't written my review. Oh well better late than never right? 

We ordered the jerk chicken, coconut shrimp, seafood paella and warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake for dessert. The coconut shrimp was "yummilicious" (Maggie C I'm stealing your  adjective). Just the right amount of crunchy batter on the outside and plump and juicy shrimp inside. The jerk chicken was ok, I was expecting a little more heat, but then again that's just me and my taste buds. The seafood paella was the bomb. Not as good as my grandma's but close enough so that really says a lot. Of course I had to leave room for dessert. Warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake. Need I say more? It's got three of my most favorite food in the world: chocolate, pineapple and caramel syrup. Yes warm and uber moist chocolate cake topped with juicy, tangy pineapple slice on a bed of gloriously rich and gooey caramel syrup. Love it! Can't wait to go back for more.
The happy hour is absolutely fabulous. Always have a nice experience when I eat here on layovers. Friendly staff and fresh warm food.

Not a huge fan of this place.  I wasn't really hungry when we came here, but I was really looking forward to a nice selection of tropical drinks.  The selection was definitely there.  They had well over a dozen drinks.  A whole page in the menu, and a             booklet on the table.  Unfortunately, the two that I tried were pretty bad.  The first was a zombie.  This drink didn't look, or taste like any zombie I've ever had, and I've had a few.  I actually wondered if my order got mixed up somewhere.  Whatever it was, it was mediocre at best.  I thought a strawberry mojito would be a safer bet, since that's almost impossible to mess up.  Well...almost, right?  It looked, and tasted more like a bad daiquiri.  It was way too sweet, and apparently made with Pucker.  The only mojito thing about it was the physical presence of mint in the glass.  I tried a friend's cocktail- The Painkiller, and wasn't too into that either.  The mix of rum, and coconut cream is nice, but again, way too sweet.
The food was...okay.  Our friend ordered the jerk chicken, and seemed to really enjoy it.  We wanted to order some fish.  Three varieties were available, but they were out of the one that we wanted.  The salmon was cooked well, but the sides were not.  Gummy mashed potatoes, and oily under cooked green beans.  Oh well, at least they weren't frozen.  
I won't be rushing back here anytime soon.

Most of the time, this place rocks!  The happy hour specials work!  The Bahamarita is, by itself, a reason to come here.  One recommendation that is a have to if you like this place: sign up to get their emails.  Once or twice a year, they have free parties.  You can RSVP for up to five people.  They serve free food and drink.  The last one, they only gave you one free drink (in the past it was unlimited).  BUT I won a gift card to come back and dine.
For regular dinning, the coconut shrimp or the seafood paella.  Yum!

Happy hour is from 4-6 or 9-11p weekdays. There are plenty of $5 drinks and $5 appetizers as well. Food/drinks are tropical inspired delicious. Cajun shrimp and pina colada were my favorites. Very fun atmosphere. Try to get there early since it will get very busy. Huge parking lot and staff so friendly.

How the hell did I end up here for dinner?  $10 gift card and a $10 off coupon giving us a cheaper meal here than at Marie Callenders.  

And better food to boot.  I got the grilled jerk chicken which wasn't jerk at all...just grilled chicken w/ a fruity glaze and some pineapple and mango underneath it.  Tasty but I could never justify paying $16 for it.  My wife got the chicken santiago which was a lot better than mine and probably what I would get if I did do dinner here again.  Its also great that they offer lighter portions so we didn't have to bring anything home in a box as usual.  

The place was packed!!  I guess this is a pretty popular place?  Drinks were ok and fairly priced.  It would be a great place for happy hour if they had one.  I think doing drinks with multiple appetizers would be the way to go next time.

My waiter was great thanks Adam, but who ever the cook was didn't know what came on the plate. My plate looked nothing like the plates of past dinners I was a little disappointed because when you have your mind set on that meal that's what you expect sadly I wouldn't suggest it to anyone unless there going for happy hour.

They have added some vegetarian options to their menu, but it's still seriously lacking vegan options. The veggie burger is so bland... Play-doh has more flavor. 

However, my carnivorous family loved their Jamaican Jerk wings & onion rings. Also, they had happy hour specials on some of their food items, so it was 1/2 off the wings & onion rings. 

Nice atmosphere, lovely decor. They have live music some nights. 

I wish they'd offer more vegan options.

I love this place! The atmosphere the bar the bartenders everyone is really friendly and nice. Their food is so good! I always have to get their lump crab stack and also their lobster and shrimp quesadilla ! They have late night half appetizers off sun-thursday for food! All their or most of their appetizers are half off and they are really good! I love their ribs and their fries also!

The girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place last week. I live close by and we wanted something small to satisfy our appetite. We started off with some cocktails. I got the ultimate pina colada and she got the painkiller. All in all good but could maybe use a splash of rum to bring it all together. She likes spinach dip so we got that to start. Very creamy, hot and great. Like I said, we weren't really hungry and we shared the lobster Mac and cheese dish. Absolutely amazing. I've been in the restaurant industry for 10 years and it's hard to find a great spot without picking at everything but this was the exception. Well balanced flavors that can make you come back for more. We will be sure to keep coming back and bring more people with us.

YUM!!!! Can't wait to go again. Service was friendly, food was good. Easy location and easy parking.

Recommendations:
-Bahamian Breeze
-Bacon Cheeseburger
-Shrimp & Chicken Pasta
-Filet
-Potato Fries (? Appetizer)
-Coconut Shrimp

Basically, this is everything we ordered. And it was amazeballs.

It is one of the best authentic Caribbean restaurants in Metro Cleveland Area. The beverages there definitely made my family recall our happy time in Jamaica. The appetizer - lobster and shrimp Quesadilla disappeared in 5 minutes. My old daughter didn't like lobster at all before but this time was her first time to really enjoy it as an entree. Desert was delicious but we were all full already. I finished it next day and it was even still tasted not very bad. We will be back pretty soon.

Service was good and attentive, the seating was comfy and unrushed.  I had the Paella - it was gummy and tasteless, but my dining companion had the Jamaican Sampler and said it was a WONDERFUL meal and he would be back more often just to eat that.  The drinks are delicious (the Tamarind Margarita was soooooooo good).  Bottom line - food is inconsistent, but might be really good - and the drinks are great!

I don't often frequent this place but now and then I will give it a try. Today's visit we had a very pleasant and helpful waitress. There is free Wi Fi here in the event you need it which is always a plus for me.

My girlfriend and I both decided to have one of the seafood specials of the day. We each had wood grilled tilapia covered with almonds along with a side of sweetened mashed potatoes and broccoli. Since we got there shortly after it opened it wasn't crowded but sure got crowded by the time we left.

The food was good and for a luncheon the prices were reasonable.It is not one of my better seafood entrees but passable. There is an extensive menu and they do have during the week lunch specials which you can choose an entree with either a soup or a salad.  They do have a bar area which we didn't take advantage of.

The restaurant sits off the road near the mall of Robinson where there are other restaurants in that same off shoot. So parking can sometimes be a problem.

Please note that this restaurant is a "chain" so you will find it in other cities as well.

Favorite place to have a zombie.  The Tilapia and Shrimp Oscar was very tasty, as well as the Buttermilk Chicken.  Key Lime Pie and Banana Nut Supreme were both amazing desserts.  Spring can't be far away.

Overall great experience!  Came for happy hour and got some half off apps- beef empanadas were particularly good, though it took a little longer for the apps to get out (probably because it was during happy hour).  The dinner food was also very good, the highlight was their shrimp and mahi bowl.  We also shared a banana nut bread supreme dessert which was also good.  Server did an excellent job- was friendly, attentive, and helpful.  Will definitely be back!

I love the Breeze, I'm a huge fan of really good black bean soup, no one does it better than the Breeze. They're version is low in fat, vegan, and pretty high in sodium, but so is most restaurant food. A bowl makes a great lite lunch and is rather filling.

NOTE* the rest of this review goes back to my pre vegan days.

The Breeze has the best shrimp 'n grits this side of New Orleans, I've had shrimp n grits in Bay St Louis, New Orleans, and Shreveport, and you just can't beat the fresh shrimp caught right out of the ocean, but Bahama Breeze makes up for it with tons of cheddar in the grits, lots of butter and cream too. The shrimp are good, not rubbery, they use 21-30 count shrimp and you get quite a bit. The creamy grits, the succulent shrimp, and the spicy coating on the shrimp is like a party in your mouth, it's not always available, the four times I had it, they were part of the nightly specials.

When I stopped here for lunch I'd always get a Cuban sandwich. They are big in Florida, it's hard to find them here. Delicious garlic roasted pork, salty ham, creamy swiss cheese, tart dill pickles, spicy brown mustard, all toasted on a pressed cuban loaf. Does that make your mouth water? It does mine! Wash this beauty down with a red ale or pale ale and you'll be thanking me for the rest of your life.

Bahama Breeze is one of the better restaurants from the Dardan Restaurant group.

If you're tired of the high-priced strip food then make your way over to Bahama Breeze. It's amazing how dramatically the prices can decrease even if you're only 2 blocks away from the strip. 

Save your money for the slots, check out Bahama Breeze. 

Great tasting food (I recommend the Calypso Shrimp Linguine)
Large portions 
Reasonable prices
Fun atmosphere
Clean restrooms
Perfect for friends and family

A solid 3.5 stars!

Visited today, Sunday 2/24/18. I don' know if it's me or what but after not having gone there for quite awhile, I went a got the absolute worst waiter that I have had in a long time! First, I ordered an ice tea to drink Now I wear glasses, but, if I can see through a glass of ice tea, I know that it's not too strong, So after some wait, he brought me a Coke! Then after several return trips to see if we were ready to order, we did, so he could  go make someone else's life uncomfortable. He brought my companion's soup and when I asked where the appetizer was, he informed me that she ordered the soup ? No kidding AND I ordered an appetizer, but I guess that it doesn't come first at BB? Eventually, the appetized AND the entrees were delivered together? OK, make do! A manager (?) came over and asked if everything was OK, of course I like being served all 3 courses at the same time, it saves the waiter a trip. The waiter went into seclusion to pout and I had to walk up front to the bar to get a refill of the Coke. The waiter came to the table to ask if I needed a straw, NO I needed a refill! The food was good, as I remembered it being there, we ended up getting to go boxes. I did want to try a desert but, honestly, was afraid to take a chance with this guy! I  A terrible experience!

Well its popular! I mean I have gone twice both off day, weird hour, it was crowded both times. The mixed drinks are great!, the food is typical, nothing special, atmosphere is good. Staff was very nice, but spread too thin.

I love Bahama breeze! It's such a fun atmosphere, you almost forget you are in Ohio. I love to order the fish tacos and the crusted almond tilapia along with their mashed sweet potatoes! My boyfriend typically orders the ribs and they are once of my favorites to try!

I always have great service when I come here, although my attendance is more like once a year!  On this jaunt, we had fast and friendly service for a party of 7!  We arrived just as they opened for lunch and was seated quickly with all of the day's specials explained.  Drinks were quick to come and complete.  Appetizers awesome and the meal can't be beat!

The waiter was the best I've ever had and interacted with the boy better than anyone.  I will be requesting him again!

I wanted to find a location for the "meet & greet" on the first night of our destination wedding weekend, and I was totally disheartened by the pricing of any and all on-Strip locations. While driving around, the BFF and I happened to see Bahama Breeze. I know, I know, it's a chain -- but it has a fun, vacation-y appeal, so we called from the car to ask about group events.

Options from the low $20s per person? Cash bar available? Sign us up! We swung in for lunch to try as many menu items as we possibly could. The tostones and coconut shrimp both made for very tasty appetizers, although the tostones were a little dry -- but once you add all the cheese and toppings, yuuuuuum-ola. We both agreed our entrees were good, although now I can't remember what Jess got (some sort of chicken sandwich?). I tried the tilapia and was pleasantly surprised at how tasty it was, and it came with cinnamon sweet potatoes! We even had dessert, fantastic dulce de leche cheesecake (with an excellent graham cracker crust).

I will readily admit that I would probably only normally give BB more like 3 stars; however, this location was so upbeat and fun, the staff members were all so friendly and helpful, the drinks were so cheap... that I'm bumping it up. AND, it looks like it will be the perfect place to host a meet & greet, so if you're looking for a group event place, I'd definitely consider it!

P.S. One other reviewer mentioned the bathrooms, and I will ditto that. They're beautiful. Weird, I know.

Although a little awkward, our server was very attentive and thoughtful. Didn't catch name but young black thin gentleman. 

The food was amazing. Best cheesy, chain restaurant EVER!

Highly recommended over Friday's, RUBY TUES, Quaker steak, and others in this price range.

One of my favorite places to eat in town. I love the variety of island dishes. Highly recommended the fried Yuca cheese bites, buttermilk fried chicken and the Mac and cheese is amazing. Drinks are tasty and the staff is usually pleasant aside from occasional unhappy employee but they definitely do their best to provide hospitable service.

Wow what a great place to eat in Vegas !  Food was soo good and service from Tina was superb.  Only thing was that the drinks was a bit light on the alcohol but they quickly fixed it with another.  The place is busy but the times with good people made it fly by.  Definitely would recommend this place to anyone in Vegas and would come back again.  Too bad California can experience this place but would do well if there is one!!
Service was fast and food was great. The menu provides a wide variety of food. I would recommend this eatery to anyone that enjoys islands.

We LOVE this joint and make a point to go every time we are in Las Vegas!  The food is consistently good and the service has always been wonderful.  You can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  I had the scallops on corn cakes (a special that day) and my husband has had the Jamaican Jerk Chicken the last two times and loved it.  Also the Cuban Bread appetizer is so good.  At then end of dinner I ordered the Almond Mocha coffee drink but had them add their brandy butterscotch sauce in place of the chocolate syrup. OMG the drink rocked!  You have to like sweet coffee, but it was soooooo good!  Casual dining, awesome atmosphere, great servers; a bit pricey but worth every penny!  Enjoy!

After reading great reviews on yelp and online, my parents and husband and I came here for dinner. Jesse,our server, was knowledgeable and very patient with us as he made recommendations that would accommodate my dad's special dietary needs. He made great recommendations for tasty foods. Even though it was a Monday night, our food and service was great. Thank you! Definitely try the Jamaica sampler Platter!! It has the best of everything! The beef empanadas are also to die for!

Bahamas Breeze really is a local gem for Las Vegans. The ambiance is laid back and tropical. They even have a small water feature running the length of the Restaraunt. The staff are all polite and I have never had a bad experience here. In addition, the staff will do anything to make your visit enjoyable (including singing and dancing for my crying 3 year old). 

The drinks here are reasonably priced for the size - they are quite large! And not to mention mixed very well. They taste like kool-aid and, according to my husband, are quite dangerous on the intoxication meter as you can drink and drink as of there were no alcohol - until you stand up from your seat. 

Food: I personally love the jerk chicken pasta. The asparagus and mushrooms work very well with the spices of the chicken and the pasta sauce. The husband loves the chicken salad, and the burgers here are also very good. The portions are large, so a single entree is enough to share between 2 adults, which is nice. 

I think Bahamas Breeze is one of the best restaurants in Vegas. Off the strip. Not too expensive. Good for families. And the food quality is high.

I came here for lunch with some coworkers. We work in the Howard Hughes center so it's a convenient place to go for lunch. I was not very happy with the service we received. My friend is vegan and asked if she could make her own salad and the waiter said no and he didn't seem like he was in a good mood...then my other friend asked him what is in the seafood chowder and he said "it's creamy." uhm, yeah I am aware that chowder is creamy but what is in it. I gave him the benefit of the doubt on that because I just assumed he was new and maybe didn't know. 

I orders the tortilla soup and lobster quesadilla. I've had it before and it has never failed. When I got my food, a ton of the soup was spilled out onto the plate that had the quesadilla so my food was all wet and soggy. I posted a picture of it.  I didn't send it back because I was here for lunch and didn't have time to wait any longer because I had to get back to work for a meeting. 

I've had some pretty decent experiences here and the food is pretty good. It's a shame that my last experience here was not great. It could have been that maybe the waiter was new, but who knows.

Have always liked Bahama Breeze, We love there pasta dish's and of course are big fans of the Half price happy hour Sunday - Thursday.  You can not go wrong with that deal.
Being a member of the email club you will receive a $10 off coupon about once per month.

Great service by nicky! Shes very sweet and attentive waitress ! But horrible attitude by maya the host. Very nasty attitude since we arrived till we cashed out like shes in a bad mood . Your a host your suppose to greet people girl not have a "I have diarrhea face"  . But everytime i visit vegas this place is a must go ! Great food.
Not bad for family dinner out. Tilapia was good, sides were decent. Drinks were ok. Will go back again.

Came for Happy Hour. The bar was full but as we were on our way out, a bartender, Wayne, stopped us and said he was setting up outside. Wayne, couldn't have been nicer he knew exactly what we needed (drinks, food, water, check) and we never had to ask for anything.  I'd definitely return.

Our favorite in Veggy!! 

I love the Salmon Tostada salad! The lunch portion of the Fresh Fish Combo is also perfect! Love the cinnamon sweet potato mash!! 

This time we did the cocktail flights. I had the Hooch and Holler one ... It was so good. I hate drinks that have stupid names but this is basically like 3 shots. It was so good : ) lol. 

No wait on Friday afternoon and so much parking!

I haven't been here in about 10 years decided to try out happy hour which is mon-fri 4-6 and sun-thurs 9- to close. Appetizers were 1/2 price and certain drinks were priced lower. Got the habanero chicken wings the barbecue sauce was too sweet and there wasn't any real heat to it wouldn't get it. Jamaican chicken wings were ok very strong jerk spice might get again. Next up was the chicken quesadilla not much meat inside was ok. The lobster and shrimp quesadilla wasn't any better wouldn't get either one.  Crispy onion rings were good would get again. The crab cake was decent probably get again. The lump crab cake was a cold dish but tasty i would get this again. We also got the steak Oscar which is a sirloin steak with crab meat on top with mashed potatoes and asparagus decent. Virgin pina coladas were awesome definitely get again. The service was great.  Overall the food was blah, drinks were great and service was good.

Came for happy hour and it was great! I recommend the nachos, seared ahi, and spinach dip! The nachos were really good compared to yard house nachos.. they tasted like curry lowkey but i didn't mind LOL. Drinks and service was good! BUT MY FAVORITE THING WAS THE DESSERT. I forgot its exact name but it was the banana nut one. It was like banana nut bread with a butterscotch sauce, vanilla ice cream, and candied almonds. Our server recommended it and I was so glad he did. Definitely coming back for this dessert 10/10

This is a place that has been here for a while and although off the strip a bit it is a nice place to get some food and a drink without all of the drop froo crap that resides in the strip these days. They can make a good steak and it doesn't cost $60!!! Drinks are pretty basic, stick to the menu. Lindsey was great and tried to fulfill my more exotic drink requests but just doesn't have to back bar to be a real cocktail bar. She does make a very respectable Manhattan

Whenever I'm in the mood to hit the beach but it happens to be January in Pittsburgh, this is my go-to. True Caribbean feel. Fresh seafood entrees, refreshing fruity drinks and tropical decor and music! Recently came here with a party of 6 and I was so impressed that the waitress was able to memorize all of our orders without writing a single thing down, she didn't skip a beat! This place does get crowded so be wise about what time you go.

The tranquil setting and delicious fare at Bahama Breeze was a perfect selection for a lunch outing with my husband. This location was a hot spot for refreshing beverages and appetizing eats for night outings during my time in college, and never disappoints. I love the lunch specials, dinner selection, and island  ambiance here. Our server Dave was really nice and attentive. We will return!

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! We were a group of 10 and we didn't really have any problems with our orders. The food is delicious! The staff is really nice, depends on what time of the day you go to, though. We went during lunch, and it was packed but nothing I couldn't enjoy. I really wish they had this place in California!

The coconut shrimp is tasty.  The tuna salad is really good.  However, most of the menu can be acquired at Red Lobster for about the same price and even better quality.  There is virtually nothing on the menu for a vegetarian.  I would not recommend this place to someone craving seafood, as the quality and freshness are questionable.  Go to Red Lobster instead!

I had the jerk sliced chicken breast with bow tie pasta in the smaller portion. This was excellent I would order again. My husband had a burger with bacon and cheddar which he says was excellent. I also ordered a Bloody Mary and wouldn't recommend this. If the drink was better I'd of given it a five star. We will return next month.

Amazing cocktails and appetizers! Can't wait for the main course

UPDATE: Sorry it took long. But the Caribbean food they serve, I would say is good. I would definitely visit them again to checkout the other items

Dionne took care of us. She was very nice. Kia was pretty dismissive of us and an issue we brought to her attention. 

The Breeze cheese bites were nice and light, not oily. Loved the creamy (not spicy) dip. "It's like a cheesy donut"

Wife tried lobster Mac and cheese. 
She removed breading? But otherwise thought it was a good dish. 

The Bahamarita virgin was refreshing. 

The key lime pie was super!  A nice merengue crust 

The seafood chowder was way too spicy for us (we are wimpy about spice). I definitely tasted Cajun spice. The manager took it off our bill no problem. 

Our friend loved the mojito and said best in her life. She also liked Vieja Ropa sandwich.

The prices have increased, but they have added new menu options. I got here around 9:45 and left around 11:15. I ordered two margaritas, one spinach dip and one crab stack. The food was delicious as usual. The margarita wasn't the best, but it was tolerable especially for the price. I walked out paying $30 for my total bill with tip.  Leslie was my waitress and she was super nice and very attentive even with the large party she had to serve. This is my must come to spot every time I'm in Vegas. This is more of a local spot, but I feel like a local because I'm here everyone I come bringing other with me usually. I happen to be solo tonite, but I will bring others next time I come so that they can fall in love like I have.

When reviewing restaurants such as this one, immediately I want to lump it into a pool with other well known places like Applebees or Fridays simply due to its uncanning ability to seem mediocre. When you walk into Bahama Breeze, I can honestly say you will not feel like you are soaking up sun on the beaches of the Bahamas but I can say you will feel like you are in a large wooden building with slightly depressed servers all the while wondering why the ceiling fan is on in the middle of a 20 degree day in January to which you would later conclude that it's reasoning is to uphold the latter part of the establisments name. (That was a long sentence...pheww)

Well moving on, the food was pretty snazzy, I recommend the spinach dip since it was like giving your tongue a full massage. The beer was pretty normal..nothing special. I will say since there was no one there, I was asked if I was okay about 5 times..and that my friends is a new record. 

If you are in the area and like places like this..check it out, it's worth a glance.

Everything was delicious!from food to the drinks. Heres what we ordered.

Jamaican jerk wings - oh so good as always!we ordered extra bbq sauce!

Jerk chicken pasta - yummyyyy

Lobster mac and cheese - the sauce was so delicious. 

Lobster and shrimp quesadilla - yummyyy

Virgin piña colada and mango beach!yummmyyyyyy

Went here for a free lunch with my buddy who lost a bet. Place was pretty empty for 11:30am. Its a huge structure with a nice bar area (where we were seated). Service was pretty good, ice teas refilled 3 times during the meal.

My friend ordered conch fritters for an appetizer, a salad, and lobster tacos. I went for a salmon cooked my way, wood flame grilled and almond coated with a lemon butter sauce, side of mashed sweet potatoes, and green beans.

Food was just ok in my opinion. Portions were good. I wasn't overly impressed with the salmon because they put a lot of almond and other stuff on it, which took away from the flavor of the lemon butter sauce and the meat. The conch fritters were good, but a little greasy...never had them before so maybe that's the way they are supposed to be, but I was expecting something a little lighter.

I'd love to hang out at the bar sometime and enjoy some tropical cocktails. I don't think they ever seem to get very busy. 

Not sure I'll return....seems there are more options and better places to eat, but it was a decent meal for about $18 (mine) and an overall bill of $38.

THIS REVIEW IS FOR HAPPY HOUR ONLY.
Tropical drinks & delicious food. As you walk in, you feel like you're on an island. Came here for happy hour with a girlfriend and it was both our first time here. We were seated outside, which by the way, wasn't really outside, just another room in the restaurant that had an outside vibe to it. 

We ordered lots of different appetizers and drinks since it was 50% off. We had the Jamaican wings, crab stack, seared ahi and firecracker shrimp. The Jamaican wings were so crispy and juicy. It was accommodated by a bbq sauce (5/5). The seared ahi was ok. It lacked a little flavor (2/5). The firecracker shrimp was the same. It was just a fried shrimp with a spicy mayo dipping sauce (3/5). But the crab stack was heaven!!!! It was mango and avocados with crab meat and shrimp with a sweet savory sauce. My mouth is drooling just thinking about it right now!!! (5/5) it is definitely a must try!! They use REAL crab meat. YUMMMMM

Our server/bartender I forgot to get his name... but he was great! He constantly checked up on us and was the one who actually recommended that delicious crab stack. I had no problems with him whatsoever. 

Good food & good service!!! A place worth trying. I will be back again for happy hour!!!
Great value here. Seated quickly, great and friendly service and good, casual food.

I was probably one of the last people in the area not to have dinner at Bahama Breeze. My family and I visited tonight. We were seated quickly, having made a reservation on Open Table. Service was outstanding. Our waitress led us through the menu. Drinks were promptly refilled. Servers were professional, pleasant and engaging. The food surpassed expectation. The jerk chicken was perfectly seasoned and not overdone or dry. The shrimp linguine wasn't too heavy. It was tasty and plentiful. Prices are reasonable. The reggae music added a nice atmosphere. I'll be back!

Jordan and I were once big fans of Bahama Breeze.  Their menu was always unique and does offer some healthier options.  Since we live in ShadySide, anytime we found ourselves out in Robinson, we had always made it a point to make a stop.  Our most recent visit, we have both agreed, was our very last.  
If you have read my reviews, you may know that I do not like to give bad reviews based on just server performance.  However, it was the ENTIRE EXPERIENCE that has inspired us to give up Corporate Chains like Bahama Breeze completely.
We went on rainy Labor Day Monday.  Since I was once a server, whether it's nice our or whether it's crappy out, Labor Day is ALWAYS busy.  People are off and don't want to cook - plain and simple.  Apparently their manager just got hired yesterday because they were extremely under-staffed, and the energy of the place showed it. 
First of all, the hostess that greeted us was visibly irritated that people kept flowing through the door; but quoted us a 20 minute wait.  We waited for 60.
Still, being understanding and patient, we let the mis-quoted wait time slide, even though other patrons were getting more visibly irritated at this fact.  
When we were finally seated, we were seated at a table that faced the open kitchen.  I don't care where we sit - I really don't.  I always appreciated the Open Kitchen at Bahama Breeze; therefore, servers and line cooks couldn't engage in "bad habits" or bad food practices.  NOT SO ON THIS OCCASION!   We watched plates being stacked on top of other plates in the window (WHAT?!?!  SERIOUSLY!?!?  I would have been fired from 5 restaurants if I would have done that); we watched servers eating french fries and shrimp right off of people's plates on the line (which I have seen people get fired for!).  Then, after watching servers eat off the plates, they would touch their faces, and then grab the plates to take them to the tables.
While waiting for our server, I hate to sound snobby, but every single server looked like they hadn't showered in a week; therefore, whomever was going to serve us, I was going to be grossed out by their lacking appearance.  Every single server, contrary to the frantic kitchen, was a slow-paced tortoise not giving a crap about the food piling up in the windows, the Expo yelling for food runners, and some guests still not having CLEAN silverware.  Every single server, male or female, was very un-kept, all had hair in their faces, and chewed food in front of their tables.  Eww.  Eww.  Eww. 
When our server finally did greet us - OMG she was way over-perky.  Annoyingly perky, scripted, and high-pitched.  When she finally took our food and drink order, our waters came right away; however, it took a few minutes for Jordan to get his beer.
*(Oh - and did I forget to mention that even during the long wait - that there were still about 20 open tables and 6 servers standing around?*)
Then the wait for the food.  Jordan and I (who actually met working together as line cooks, 4 years ago) just watched the kitchen drown frantically.  Then I watched the Manager jump on the line - and that's when I knew it was all over from there.  When ANY Front of House manager jumps on the back of the line - just watch out.  Your food is going to SUCK!  Especially when every ticket that comes in, the Manager rolls his eyes.  Um...that is your job isn't it?  To make food and serve it to guests.  If you're rolling eyes dude...then PLEASE do the guests at Bahama Breeze a huge favor and leave and find a different calling.
Also - if Bahama Breeze is going to rock the Open Kitchen in the first place - that kitchen better ALWAYS run a tight ship.  Plus - the windows through that open kitchen should at least look they were washed in the morning.  Not caked on grease that hadn't been touched in a week!!!  Does anyone do sidework there?  The mistakes that we saw MAY NOT been so bad, or disgusting, had we not seen them.  But since everything was in plain sight, it made it that much worse, and hard to swallow when we did finally get our food (literally).
We saw our plates get put on the line.  And then we saw them sit for 20 minutes.  Without even an extensive knowledge of the menu, Jordan and I probably could have taught their kitchen a lesson or two.  We just watched our food sit there while the Expo and multiple servers just walked pass.  Not their table, not their problem, right?  
As we watched our food just sit in the window, our server came over to us and asked "So how is everything going?".  Ummm...we really didn't know how to respond - did she really not see we had nothing in front of us besides two waters and one bottle of beer?  I said, "Oh the water is delicious.  Where is our food?"
Finally a different server ran out our food and informed us that the plates were "really hot."  Yeah I know - I saw them sit in a heat lamp for 20 minutes.  
Food tasted dry...like it had been under a heat lamp for 20 minutes.
Need I say more?

Monday Thur Thursdays they have awesome happy hour specials. I love the coconut shrimp and artichoke spinach dip. The wings are huge but looks too spookie for me. 
The drink special are yummy too. There house drink is slushy and yummy.
Great place to get your happy you on with friends or family.
Ok, for a chain restaurant this is very consistently good. Jamaican treat was great, rum drinks were very good.

We were happily surprised by our experience here. This place has a fun atmosphere, good service, and great food. We had the Shrimp and Lobster Linguini and the Shrimp and Grits, and got the Cocoanut Shrimp as an appetizer. Everything was really nice, and there were so many appealing menu choices.  I was a big fan of the creativity that went into the dishes and all the nice flavors. Really nice service, great portions, lots of shrimp and lobster, and reasonable prices.
Bleh.  We made the mistake of stopping for lunch at a chain restaurant. Bland food, over priced, dirty. However, our server was very good.

Our family reunion was here today and must say...I am highly disappointed at the service. Ordered were confused, mixed up and our table ordered firsts, but delivered 55 mins later. All bad. All horrible. Never to return.

pretty good, very standard food, but not so standard decor. I went here with my dad after a convention at the las vegas convention center, and saw lots of other convention goers there too. Service was good, food was decent, and you get raw sugar sticks in your ice tea. I forgot what I ate, but the pina colada was super sweet.

First off I have to say Anthony is amazing and when you visit here ask for him by name. His personality and attention to detail is top notch. On to the food. We ordered the shrimp and lobster quesadilla which was solid along with the sampler. The wings were tasty and had good heat, the coconut shrimp were good along with the conch. She ordered Mahi Mahi special and loved it. I had the steak Oscar. Steak was cooked to order and crab was decent. 

For our drinks I ordered the red lager and she had a coconut mojito. The beer was good and not overpowering but the mojito was solid. We didn't opt for desert after all we tasted but can't wait to return.

It was another enjoyable meal at Bahama Breeze!

A bowl of Bahamian Seafood Chowder was good and creamy, but warm rather than hot.  Peruvian Corn Cakes bristling with kernels of yellow corn were quite tasty slathered with butter and topped by a vibrant and fruity housemade Pineapple Salsa.

A Caesar Salad with fresh Romaine leaves and sheets of Mozzarella Cheese was graced with an excellent Caesar Dressing.  And, an abundant portion of sauteed Mahi Mahi with Shrimp Saute in Lemon Cream Sauce that was presented with fine Spanish Rice was moist, flakey, perfectly cooked, and delicious.

Once again, 4-1/2 stars overall!

I had an absolutely wonderful experience here. The host immediately greeted us and sat us to a table. Our server, Taylor, was very friendly, offering up various menu options and being patient as we took a longer time to order since it was our first time here. Our food was delicious and came out quick and hot! I literally had no complaints! 
But the part that made me very happy was the fact that the host made sure to check on the servers before seating them so that they had enough time to care for each guest. I work in the restaurant industry and to see teamwork like this is rare to be honest. You can tell they are working together, and looking out for each other, as well as the restaurant. I can't wait to come back!i

Always frendly bartenders drinks are super gooooood OMG this is the best i had and the mojitos always excellent today i try the real pineapple piñacolada the whole pineapple is soak in rum sweet n strong of course..
I  be back !!! ,Terminator voice

This has always been a family favorite  for years . But last two times we have been disappointed  not so much with the food but the service  When we are out to eat I don't want to listen  to the waitress complain about who left the dishes there and would  like  to see her once in a while. At our table And they should train their people  not to hand a hot plate to anyone  especially  a child

Food is so good here. I had the swordfish last night and it didn't disappoint! The coconut grande dessert was amazing as well! We love the ambience here. Island flair with live music that makes you feel like you're on vacation.

I will start by saying this place is great I made a reservation for my girlfriend's birthday the staff there is very nice very friendly they even go through the menu with you if you're a first time customer they offer you drinks right off the top and the service is very fast and friendly the food came out shortly after we received our appetizer very presentable on the plate very tasty and exactly what we ordered because it was my girlfriend's birthday they found a man in there who actually has a very nice voice to sing her happy birthday and bring out the pie that she ordered I would definitely recommend anybody coming to Vegas that's never ate at Bahama Breeze to stop in and definitely try their food everything on the menu is very appealing and looks very good our waiter was kind very friendly and definitely deserves a tip that we left him I would say for locals this restaurant is perfect tourist as well it's right near the strip

Took the kids on a Thursday night to try a new restaurant!  I was very surprised by the size of this place.  The decor is super fun and you feel like you are on a tropical island!  Maria was our waitress and she was awesome!!  

Food reviews:
Skillet simmered jerk shrimp - the sauce was delicious, the shrimp was ehhh!
Habanero Chicken Wings - My husband and the kids loved them!
Grilled Jamaican Jerk Chicken - A lightly grilled chicken with a light marinade-lacked flavor
Seafood Paella - The husband said it was good.  Large portion.
The kids had sliders which they enjoyed.  Kids meals are only $4.79
Yaka Hula Drink - Super strong!
Bahamarita - Yum Yum!
Chocolate Pineapple upside down cake - Awesome!

I will be back to try other dishes!

Great first impressions---welcoming cantaloupe-orange and vanilla exterior surrounded by many colorful, healthy-looking, well-maintained outdoor plants and flowers.  (If neglected, would have been a bad sign.)  Inside, an inviting, up-beat, spacious, expected tropical-theme, with dimly lit and bright areas, and a variety of green plants clumped into groupings throughout.  Other servers may be fine, but we lucked out with ASHLEY.  Friendly, smiling, knowledgeable, and very likeable.  Ask for her section, and see for yourself.   (When we were ready to leave, she said she hoped we'd be back.  "But only if YOU'LL be here." I answered.  She giggled, then said to please ask for her.)

If not famliar with Caribbean dishes, I'd suggest viewing their menu online before stopping in---unless you'll have time to take time.  Many photos, too.  We aren't familiar with "authentic"---except for the couple of times my husband brought wonderful Cuban sandwiches home from Puerto Rican business trips---so that's what we did.  Their site also has a very helpful "All about Caribbean Cuisine" tab.    

Being new to this style---and looking forward to trying---unfortunately, we weren't transported to Nassau or Montego Bay.  We were still in Beachwood, sitting in a booth. ... UNTIL tasting their luscious portobello sandwich.  We were still here, but I think Bob Marley's ghost walked past our table.   And the disappointments could have been our choices---some dishes might not be our "thing".   You just might love it here---as many reviewers attest.

~~~~

JAMAICAN CHICKEN WINGS   1 star
First time trying jerk.  Whatever Jerk seasonings were used---apparently there are several variations per their website---the results didn't taste good.  Very large, too.  More like turkey wings.  These are older, big chickens, which I feel are best used for slower stewing/braising along with other ingredients, which helps flavor elderly birds.  Smaller, buffalo style, remain our preference.  

CONCH FRITTERS   1 star
First time trying conch.  Nice mild flavor, but if conch pieces were mixed into the batter, they weren't visible.  Still don't know what conch tastes like---or maybe they taste like dough.  Looked just like dough.  Good dipping sauce.

FISH TACOS   2.5 stars
First time trying ANY fish taco.  The flavor of the delicate mahi-mahi and other ingredients, were lost to the aggressive cilantro. The flour tortillas may have been just warmed up in preparation for filling, but had then cooled and firmed up.  This method---inevitably---and anywhere, not just this restaurant---can end up chewing like cardboard, and tasting like it, too.  When I prepare any dish using tortillas I either bake them along with the other ingredients, or fry them separately.   Even though I'd expect these tacos to be much better with less cilantro and quickly deep-fried tortillas---for that crunchy/tender/blistered combination---we'll never become fans of fish tacos.   We love fish and tortillas---just not together.

SUN-DRENCHED PORTOBELLO  
& VEGETABLE SANDWICH, grilled   8 stars 
Excellent.   Caramelized onions and slices of portobello, soft pickles, tomatoes, and lettuce, with a wonderful sauciness and flavor---probably the melted Manchego cheese.   Heard of it, but never tasted Manchego until now---WOW.  (I'm going to buy this cheese.  Wish I knew the brand they use.)  It also had asparagus spears, which weren't listed as an ingredient online.  Cooked---but woody---so I removed them.  The bread---hoagie-shaped and generously-sized---was perfectly pressed, having a crispy, toasted exterior.  I definitely recommend it.  And If meat or chicken is your preference, I'd ask for it on this sandwich, it was THAT good.   If we ever return, I'd order it again.   Until then, I plan to try making it myself, since I'm a lot closer to my kitchen than Beachwood. 

BEAN AND RICE BOWL SIDE   2.5 stars
One of the choices offered with sandwiches.  Basic beans and rice---which I like and have prepared myself, but with other ingredients added.  Theirs had no discernible seasoning. 

BANANA NUT BREAD SUPREME   2.5 stars
Nicely-flavored dessert.  With a banana sliced in half lengthwise, vanilla ice cream, warm banana-nut bread, whipped cream, and hot butterscotch-brandy sauce.  Bananas were too firm---hard to cut into with a spoon.  Ask for a knife and
fork---or it might land in your lap.  Better yet, ask if they could saute the bananas to soften them.  That would make it 3.5 stars.

I love this restaurant 
When I want to treat myself or have guests come in to town this is the place that I take them 

I found this jewel many years ago and actually had thought about it over the years but could never find it again, after being here a week or two I happened upon it by mistake 
A fortuitous drive by 
Yay 

Now they are always BUSY and it's first come first serve so the wait can be very long 
If there's a bar stool empty, we opt for that as there is no wait 
Now service at the bar is extremely slow but again, this establishment is extremely busy so I get it 
In my opinion the food is worth the wait 

I always get the same thing, lobster and shrimp pasta 
NEVER disappoints 
I'm a garlic addict so I ask the chef for extra every time, it's perfect 

Was there last week and first time I've ever gotten a table !! Lol 
The waiter was very good, I had friends in town from France and he made them feel very welcomed 
Serving them first which I thought was just EXTRA !! ;) 

I will be back, and when I get visitors in town, even though this is 18 miles away (in Vegas there's a bazillion restaurants) this is the one we head to. And all my friends love it as much as I do 

Nice Ambiance, my only suggestion is to train their staff better 
When you check in at the door each time the staff of 3 that are there look overwhelmed and confused.... 
pretty much every time I go there however, they also informed me there's usually a 2 hour wait for a table, so I guess you can't blame them for feeling overwhelmed 

Cocktails and are very good, and in comparison to other establishments here in Vegas near the strip, these prices are very reasonable

This place is kinda depressing. I would normally never go here (or a place like this in Las Vegas) on my own but 'had to' because of a group of business folks I was with. They had live music but it was very drab. Happy hour had decent prices but the food was very underwhelming. Service was pretty horrible so we are assuming the girl was new or trained horribly. I don't recommend unless your car breaks down in front of it and you are starving.

It's freakin' 100 degrees in Las Vegas today, so my co-worker says "let's try this place" because he'd been here before and enjoyed the food.

I had to agree that the food was really good.

I ordered the Chicken Club Salad.  Fantastic and DELICIOUS!!!  Right amount of salad, bacon, cheese, dressing and chunks of crispy chicken!!!  Yum yum in the tum tum!!

For dessert, I had a slice of Dulce De Leche Cheesecake.  It was too good.  I could not finish it because I was full and it was very sweet.  This is saying a lot because I ALWAYS eat all of my cheesecake (I'll be working out a lot tomorrow morning in the hotel gym!!!!!).

Our server was friendly, polite and always checking up on us to see if we needed anything else.

Next time I'm in LV, I'll try the clam chowder.  I hear it's very good.

FYI - bathroom was clean.  There was even mouthwash and hair gel near the sink.  Really.
I love the seafood paella it's not too salty perfect! & the sesami seared ahi taste good and fresh!

My party shows up, we tell the hostess we have a party of nine and after I said I didn't have a reservation she seemed like she didn't want to deal with me. Reluctantly she said the wait was fourty minutes. A few minutes later another member of my party showed up. After I said the weight was 40 minutes, she went to go ask again to double check. When she came back she said the hostess rolled her eyes and was sassy when she said the wait was still 40 minutes. They seated us in 40 minutes, I didn't mind the wait because we did have a big party but I thought the service was bad.
I've been here several times before and I love the ropa vieja sandwich and any of their flavored lemonades. I ordered the ropa vieja sandwich again. It came out in a reasonable time, but it tasted awful. The bread tasted like it was old or like the sandwich was microwaved. Normally the meat is tender but this time it was tough and it almost hurt my jaw to chew it, and certain parts of the sandwich were cold. My raspberry lemon breeze tasted like it was powdery and way too sweet. Our waitress was nice but she didn't come back until it was time for dessert. We ordered a key lime pie. If you like eating straight up sugar, you'll love this dessert. The crust tastes like hardened brown sugar, it melts in your mouth. Which I would like, but it was way too sweet. 
Needless to say, I'm not sure I will come back to Bahama Breeze. Or at least not with a group or when it's busy. But I'm not sure if I want to pay for rude service and bad food with decent dessert and drinks.

So me and my Honey Anniversary was Yesterday 11-17-16 of 4 years. And I let him pick the Restaurant. At first I was A little skeptical because I never ate Jamaican food before. We arrive kinda late about 120 before closing. But to my surprise food was still very Fresh and customer service was on point. And by us arriving late it was happy hour as well. Omg their Drink is off the chain ... No complaints the food was everything. This place is a must!!

For a chain restaurant Bahama Breeze was not spectacular nor amazing. Food was good, nothing to write home about. I had jerk chicken which was not as spicy as I'd like but the side of rice and their plantains were very good. Service at lunch time was great, food came quickly, definitely a good spot for grabbing  lunch during a workday. If you're looking for real traditional Caribbean, don't come here. But if you want a chain style Caribbean version, Bahama Breeze is great.
Coconut shrimp. Good!  Mahi fish tacos ....even better. Best Goombay smashes since we were in Key West...... Ding ding ding!!!!   Great job!!

I'm giving BB 3 stars but it's a gift, believe me.  When my wife and I went to BB in Tampa, Florida back in March 2016, it was a super-awesome experience. The restaurant was superb, as was the food and service. This BB has A LOT to learn from the one in Tampa.  Best way to do this review is the good and the bad. Nothing was truly ugly, but a couple of things were close to not being able to get a date to the prom.

The good:
Plenty of parking
Told us 30-minute wait but sat us in 15
Food was decent
Service was decent
Manager came to the table to follow up on an issue

The bad:
Called at 5pm to make a reservation for 6pm and was told
all reservations must be at least 2 hours in advance -- shitty policy.
I thought the people who work at the host/hostess station could have
been way more friendly and receptive. Instead they don't even say 
hello or greet you. No eye contact.  They seemed more interested in
talking to each other than with the customers.
I ordered a pina colada. First one was not what I ordered. Second one
was a pina colada and it was HORRIBLE. Even my wife said ICK.
My wife ordered the chips and only got 1 type of chip when
it says 2 types of chips.
My wife ordered a dinner that is supposed to have edamame in it
but they did not put it in there.

We're not picky people or hard to please. We're usually pretty easy going.
But c'mon people, this restaurant should serve the dishes as described and not
forget to include parts of it -- FOR TWO DISHES WE ORDERED.
And wow, learn how to make a good pina colada. It's not rocket science, I promise.
The 2-hour rule for reservations is a corporate policy for all the BB's, so it isn't the
restaurant's fault per se -- but it still stinks.

We traveled 35-40 minutes to get to this restaurant.  While we wouldn't say the experience was terrible, we can say that it wasn't good enough that we would come back.   There's a lot of room for improvement.

The drinks are as expected, pretty good. It's nice island ambience gives it an easy going feeling. The service is ok, nothing special. Our waiter seemed impatient. The coconut shrimp appetizer is crispy delicious. The live music wasn't bad but I would love hear more reggae and Caribbean songs, instead of country or folk or pop. Definitely give it a go for happy hour.

Always love coming to Bahama Breeze! I have never had a bad meal here! Today we had the Jamaican Grilled Chicken Wings as an appetizer. The wing is the full wing and they are delicious! You can order in 4's or 8's! As an entree I had the Breeze Wood Grilled Chicken with a Citrus Butter sauce, Broccoli & Mashed Cinnamon Sweet Potatoes! Yummy!! The chicken was grilled perfectly! The broccoli was steamed just right and the sweet potatoes were mmm good! 
I had a bite of my husband's Calypso Shrimp Linguine and the shrimp was very tender and there was just the right amount of sauce! He also had a Barbados Rum Punch and said it almost tasted like the ones we had in Barbados! It was actually made with the same rum! 

We've been coming to Bahama Breeze since we lived in Orlando,  so about 15 years. Out there we would wait up to 3 hours(it was well worth the wait) on a Fri/Sat night! Was glad when they opened the one here that it was much bigger!! 

We'll be back!!
We had our wedding reception here, best prices for 65 party, amazing food,  so many drink options. Friendly and fun relaxed staff, we will defiantly be back.
Always a must when we come to Vegas from LA. Great atmosphere, great service and great food
Great live music and happy hour deals.  Felt like I was on vacation. Drinks and food were good. Service was a little slow though.

This was a crazy busy ridiculous location
Never saw the Vegas location so busy 
But we did get seats at the bar and sat with Taylor. 
My friend got steak and I got paella. 
We had the hibiscus margaritas and they were good. 
The paella was good. 
Saturday night is busy and crowded on Saturday night
Appetizers delicious!!! Shrimp linguini delicious!!! Jamaican jerk chicken delicious!!! Cocktails superb!!! Service, ah-maxing!!! Great place for family and friends!!!

Loved it! The theme was cute and the drinks were amazing! I went during lunch hours and I had the caesar salad/ shrimp and lobster quesadilla combo and both were delicious! I ordered the hibiscus margarita and it's an acquired taste but I enjoyed it!

We went there for a happy hour and had a blast. The service was excellent and super fast. Drink specials cannot be any better. I got 2 drinks as a matter of fact. Only 5 bucks each. I loved my pina colada with coconut. The food was very good too. We got coconut shrimp and crab stack which looked like a work of art itself. I cant wait to come back.

Maybe it was a bad day, but hardly anyone in here, chicken crema was so over cooked, couldn't eat it. Bacon on a cheeseburger was almost raw. Ultimate margarita was not flavorful. Service was also slow... Wish it could have been better. Florida locations are much better!

We came here for an early dinner on a Saturday evening.  I was pretty excited to try this place as it came from a recommendation of one of my friends who had been here before.  However, I found the service here to be a bit spotty and lacking.  Despite it being early, our server was occupied with other things other than checking in to see how we were doing.

But, besides that slight nuance, and a bit of confusion over us wanting soup, and then getting bread, but then getting our meals at the same time as the said bread, I still liked the food.  My paella was delicious and so was my boyfriend's chicken and yuca. Their mixed drinks were also pretty tasty too.

Met up with a friend for Happy Hour.  Service was great!  The place is so much fun, live music, delicious margaritas and appetizers are 1/2 price!  Coconut shrimp, onion rings, street carnitas tacos, spicy jerk shrimp and Empanades all delicious!

Delish! I had fish tacos which came with huge chunks of avocado and super scrumply seasoned black beans and rice.

Service was good, if a bit phony.

Bathrooms: Lotion, hairspray, AND mouthwash. I was bitching all weekend about how bathrooms should have lotion and voila! Also mouthwash is a totally nice touch, more places should have it.

If for any reason i'm lurking this part of Vegas again, I would return.

Finally got to try this place out. So long over due. Came here on a Monday night was a great time there was essentially no wait. This place is pretty big in size, there is bar, indoor and outdoor seating. Thy have good HH specials 1/2 off apps 9-12 and a lot of $5 drinks. Ordered the jerk shrimp app it's like a scampi def not what I expected but very good. The jerk chicken and rice meat was amazing and I just had to get the paella.. man it was amazing I am so pissed I didn't have a bigger appetite. The service and staff were all kind and attentive. All in all I'd go back for sure, so sad they don't have this place in Los Angeles.

Can't say I'm a huge fan of the place, but it is ok for large groups. 

I'd never heard of this place before I moved to Vegas, but my friend recommended it one night years ago for dinner. I had my reservations once I realized it was owned by the Darden Group, since I'm not a huge fan of Olive Garden and Red Lobster, but I held back on my complaints.

I've tried several dishes here over the years and some are hit or miss. The portabello mushroom sandwich lacked flavor and texture and it wasn't as hearty as I was hoping for. I tried a pasta dish on my last visit which I actually quite enjoyed, however.

Overall, what I really like about the restaurant is that it's a great place for groups. There are lots of spaces to socialize and and private places. I've even seen weddings and receptions held in the private area. They also have a great little happy hour.

Memoriesss, of when I was a wee girl and got hammered for the first time at a Bahama Breeze in GA. And also celebrated my 28th bday while on business in Orlando... And Now this location when my other flight crew showed up tipsy, embarrassed us by telling the bartender "Just surprise me with any drink, but make it dark like my soul!" (Then later SPILLED a drink all over the bar!) Anyway I throughly enjoyed the pinot with a "light" sized Mahi/Shrimp rice bowl and it was so friggin delicious. Lots of veggies, fresh and affordable. All ingredients for a four star+ review!
If you like margaritas , you must try the margarita flight . Absolutely delicious!!!! As far as food the empanadas are also really good as an appetizer .

Worst service ever. Came here with a group of 8 people from work. Came in the girl (blonde hair) said it was happy hour then charged us for our drinks and said "did he tell you that?" She must have been training but she was the one who said it. Then she didn't offer to fix anything and continued to have a dirty look on her face the rest of the time. Thanks. Never coming here again!

DELICIOUS BIKINI APPLE-TINI, fyi :)

I had the salmon pasta that came with bread. It was decent, not terrible.
Hubby had and enjoyed the jerk chicken pasta.
Hubby's grandma had the seafood chowder and loved it.
We all shared the key-lime pie (which was my first time having it) and it, too, like the apple-tini was DIVINE!

If I'm ever back in Vegas (we came here right after we landed in Vegas), will definitely be coming back!
Eine nette Bar etwas abseits vom Trubel mit live Musik, angenehmes Ambiente, aufmerksame und freundliche Bedienung, empfehlenswert!

Love this place.    Awesome drinks and food.   Coconut shrimp app was great.   Salmon tostada also great.    Super fresh and salmon cooked perfectly.   Christine B was a great server very helpful and quick and anticipated out needs.

Decided to try it because it was within walking distance of our hotel. Started out strange with the host commenting that we were different because my wife and I sat together in a booth instead of across from each other. Didn't get much better from there, server had to be asked several times for the beer that had been ordered, two rounds, two sets of excuses why we had to remind her. We were in a booth near the POS and got to listen to the disgruntled servers the whole time we were there. The food didn't make the experience any better, lacked flavor and seasoning. Would be hard pressed to recommend it based on this experience.

Always a good place to go. Can get fairly busy. I ordered the almond crusted fresh fish. The fish was fresh cut about a half inch thick with a salt and pepper taste with Allman crest and lemon butter sauce over.  Also my meal was served on a hot plate to keep fish warm and tasty The server was very polite and continued to ask us if we want to refills on our drinks. The service was more than acceptable. I left a 20$ tip.

Service was extremely slow on a slow night. Food was absolutely horrible quality. Sitting at a business dinner, my boss sent back his epinadas. I ordered the pork tenderlion, and no joke, it was like a cheap flat iron steak. I choked it down because I was hungry. I would give this place negative stars if that was feasibly possible.....

So, one of the reasons I am drawn to this restaurant is the ease of getting here and the simple parking lot. However, I have been pleasantly surprised each time I come to this chain here in Las Vegas. I always get the fish in season, which comes with the chef's veggies and some sort of starch - my favorite being cinnamon mashes sweet potatoes. Every time, the fish is cooked perfectly and the service impeccable. So, for a fabulous, very reasonably priced lunch or dinner, and away from the craziness of the strip, this place is a nice option. Plus, there is always good music streamed in!
